Reviews.Title: “First New York experience”
Reviews.Author: Hangaroundgirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 8 nights for business. The service from staff was virtually non-existent, and the rooms were cleaned very late. The beds were exceptionally comfortable and the showers great. So all in all, no real complaints. But at $300+ per night, I did think they could have helped me with my luggage (two suitcases and two carry bags) rather than watch me struggle in and out of lifts etc. Not a lot of connecting the dots in this hotel between the restaurant, the doorman (cars, taxis etc). Reception was a bit of a problem as people who phoned for me were told I was not there, and someone left a message three times but I never got it. Whilst I'd stay there again for business, I probably would try somewhere else if I was taking the family. Oh, and I didn't have a room with a view! So the whole way they sell the hotel is a bit of false advertising really.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful view”
Reviews.Author: nikolaos_g_pappas
Reviews.Content: We stayed during our honeymoon at Hotel on Rivington and it was an impressive experience. Our room was on the 19th floor and had this great view of almost the whole Manhattan. Room was clean, modern decorated and with a laaarge bed! Breakfast was not what a european expected (only coffee, fruits and some bread n cookies available) unless you paid extra (almost anything was available). Nice, typical NYC neighborhood with a vivid nightlife (hotel ground floor is also a night club so try to ask for a room above 5th floor!). Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Trendy Neighboorhood”
Reviews.Author: JoeDanski
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for the weekend in The Rivington, and was very pleased with my stay. I stayed at the 9th floor, and my room (#94) was really gigantic according to NYC standards. For this rate (+/- 300 UD) you can get much crappier rooms. Decoration was top, nice design, the bed was just simply perfect. View was good though not sensational, but that was not really a concern. My room was very, very quiet, there 's a very busy trendy bar at the G-floor, but you don't notice for a second. Hotel is very helpful and always available to assist. The neighboorhood is fantastic, lot's of great bars and restaurants, subway 3 blocks away (5 minutes). Overall, best hotel I ever stayed in in Manhattan in this price range!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Nicola R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the rivington for 5 nights, during this time there was very little interaction with the staff as the lobby is on the 2nd floor, so we were not told that breakfast was included in our price , so we never ate breakfast there.When we checked out the girl on the desk processed my credit card without letting me look at the bill , when I went to sign I noticed she had charged us an extra $135 for the minibar which we did not use! When I told her she grudgingly refunded me, now back in Australia and I notice they have taken a further$135 off my credit card without my permission. I have emailed them twice with no reply.and called twice, I am pretty upset about this.

Reviews.Title: “Where do I start......”
Reviews.Author: Andrew N
Reviews.Content: Everything was amazing, but I'll start with the service.... which was exceptional. From the concierge who greeted us, to the 5 or 6 times we needed something we forgot to pack, the staff was standing by to serve us. The entrance to the hotel captures the essence of NYC with their modern design and nightclub adjacent to hotel lobby. Checking-in was handled in 2 minutes at most as opposed to under-staffed front desks which make you wait on-line as they are on the phone. Our room was simply MAGNIFICENT, and I urge any couple who is staying here to upgrade to the "King with soaking tub." The view we had on the 15th floor was amazing and having a skyline view in the shower plus a balcony made it worthwhile. The layout of the room was great with a contemporary couch and coffee table set-aside from the plush King-size bed (which was very comfortable). We didn't use the bath, but the rest of the bathroom was spacious as there were something like 8 different mirrors and more than enough towels available. (which is an area where most hotels fall short) I can't get over how fast the room-service was. The breakfast was brought up 15 floors in less than 10 minutes. I was impressed by how great the coffee tasted and the blueberry pancakes were "out of this world." It was very convenient to have the nightclub right next-door. After dinner we took advantage of this and it was just great to be able to have a few drinks in a club rather than an average hotel bar. We checked out about 1 hour after check-out time and the staff was not pushy in this regard. We were also accommodated by them allowing us to keep our bags in the hotel until 6:00pm, 6 hours after checkout. What more can I say? It was a great stay and I will be coming back the next-time I stay downtown!

Reviews.Title: “Rivington is great after all.”
Reviews.Author: Jellish
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Rivington the first week of this month. It didn't start out so promising. First of all, we thought the lighting was too dim. We could hardly see anything! After a day and night, I finally figured out that there is a tiny switch next to each light switch, which is the dimmer. It just had to be turned up. It would be nice if the bellhop would show this to new guests. Then, the service was slow to nonexistant. Our refrigerator stopped working, and the staff said no one could fix it until late the next morning. They did put some food we had bought in the hotel kitchen refrigerator. The second day our room was still not made up when we returned late in the day. As we were waiting in the hotel lobby for our room to be cleaned, we were greeted by the new general manager, Marcanthony. He listened to our complaints, said he would take care of things, and comped us breakfast for the next morning (which was delicious, by the way). After that, everything improved 100 percent. Service was immediate, our refrigerator was fixed, and we set about really enjoying the hotel. The beds have temper pedic mattresses, which are wonderful. My daughter's favorite thing is the steam shower room, and there is a huge tub as well. The room is spacious. As for the street noise, there is some. We were on the third floor. It was only really bad on Saturday night. I had earplugs, so, no problem. The rest of the week, it isn't that bad. I would recommend this hotel, and I'm pretty sure we will stay here again on our next visit to NYC. The location is great, if you love the LES, which we do.

Reviews.Title: “Now my official NYC hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Meg B
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hotel on Rivington a few times, and I'm finally taking the time to write a review! First of all, the staff is incredibly friendly and helpful, including the concierge, who has never steered me wrong! I've always received great ideas on where to eat (ended up at Sauce, which was such a surprising treat!) and where to get a good 4 mile jog in (East River). The hotel itself is still super chic and comfortable - I LOVE the mattress, seriously wish I had purchased one of them instead of the new overly expensive mattress we recently bought. The views from my corner room on my latest trip were incredible as always, and make the space a perfect place to spend an evening catching up on work with a glass of wine in one hand. It's the kind of hotel I honestly look FORWARD to coming back to after a full day of business trip meetings. The staff was incredibly accommodating on my most recent trip, hence my desire to finally write the review they deserve! I held a bunch of interviews at the hotel, and they kindly allowed me to use the conference room space for a few hours while it was empty, and then I relocated to the quiet, comfortable, cool second-floor lobby for the remainder. The complimentary coffee is a major plus! Breakfast at Co-op is consistently great. I opted for an omelet both days and attempted the NY Post crossword (a copy of the paper is left at everyone's door, which is amusing!). I love the little touch of fresh homemade cookies by the bed in the evenings, possibly most of all! I'll be back and will continue to make this my NY hotel of choice!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but dirty”
Reviews.Author: MartinAdroguÃ©
Reviews.Content: I spend one night at the Hotel on Rivington last summer. I got an exceptionally low rate through Jetsetter so I stayed at a corner suite. It was big, with a separate sitting room and amazing views all the way up to the Empire State. The hotel is trendy but it's starting to age. As I said I had a nice, large room with floor-to-ceiling windows but it was plainly dirty; I even found toe nails in the carpet -disgusting. As I was staying only one night I preferred not to complain. The bathroom was comfortable although the shower also had floor-to-ceiling windows that might be intimidating for some. Location is not great but there're some shops nearby and a subway station less than two blocks away. I might stay here again if I get similar rates (around 100 usd in July 2011!) but I would never pay the ordinary fare for this place. Staff is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, disappointing event venue”
Reviews.Author: NYLON2008
Reviews.Content: We recently hosted our wedding at the Hotel on Rivington and stayed in the hotel the week before and a few days after we got married. The view, location and 'vibe' are undeniably fantastic. The fabric of the building is on its way to becoming pretty tired but it is sleekly styled. We had mixed experience with the front desk and reservations team and a fairly awful experience with the event staff. While the front desk was generally responsive and helpful, in the six nights we stayed there the groom's luggage went missing and our marriage documentation got thrown out by housekeeping. The event staff were extremely difficult to deal with in the run up to the event, completely unresponsive to both phone and e-mail. At no point did any one in the hotel (front desk, events, management) acknowledge that we had chosen to spent and extraordinarily special period of our lives (and, for us, an extraordinary amount of money) at the Hotel on Rivington and a tasteful touch like a congratulatory note or fruit plate would have been a small touch that went a long way. While it is a neat hotel in a great location with fine service, our overall impression was terrible and we won't be going back to celebrate our anniversaries..

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled”
Reviews.Author: sty56416
Reviews.Content: Don't let the beautiful website pictures fool you. We just got back from New York and stayed at Hotel on Rivington for New years. We booked the hotel a month prior based on what we saw online, we called the hotel and booked a high floor suite with a a view and balcony. We arrive and check in, walk into the room we were paying 500 a night for and it was horrific. The room was tiny and it barely fit the bed that took up 85 percent of the room. We were furious and went downstairs. After going back and forth with front desk they finally moved us to the room we asked for. After getting into our room we start hearing our toilet flushing by itself and making noises. We call and they come up and "fix it". The following morning we are getting ready and toilet starts making noises again but this time water starts gushing out of the tank flooding our bathroom. We call downstairs and they came up and fixed it. Not once does anyone call to apologize for any of the inconveniences that occurred. For what we paid we could have stayed at wayyyyyyyy better hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel though not quite in the right area”
Reviews.Author: Avataarkaap
Reviews.Content: We were looking for something in a funky part of town, and lower east side is not quite that area. The hotel is great, and the staff were fab, but it was super cold outside, and there didn't seem to be much of interest that was within close walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Unusual - Plusses and Some Minuses”
Reviews.Author: twothereandback
Reviews.Content: The location is definitely "downtown" and frankly not for everyone. My room was a corner king with great views - both out of and in to the room. The bathroom and shower had a glassed exterior wall - that is definitely not for everyone. There was a huge (think small car) soaking tub that was outstanding. Actually OUTSTANDING. I'm not a black bathroom fan - particularly in hotels. How clean or unclean it might be is anyone's guess. I was disturbed that the two bottles of water in the bathroom (for which there is a charge) had broken seals and were probably refilled by the previous occupant. The finishes were largely inexpensive and starting to show wear. Security is LIGHT. Anyone could walk in from the street into the elevator unquestioned and onto any room floor (as my husband and a friend did on separate occasions). When you consider the neighborhood,i find that a concern. I wasn't cool enough to learn the lights, locks, etc. quickly - but I did. Sounds unappealing - but there are great things too to be fair. I found the front desk quick sharp and helpful - true, no offer to help with the bags, but they handled checking in and checking out more efficiently than some of the 5 star hotels I've been in. Room service for dinner and breakfast is FANTASTIC and QUICK and I found the prices very fair for the quality of the food. Servers were inexperienced but very attentive, helpful and caring and refreshing in their want to please attitude. We ran up quite a bill because we liked the food so much and ordered several times in less than two days. Lots of wine, beverage and snack choices in the not overly cooled "mini" bar, including an assortment of menu appropriate half bottles. The fridge is a lot larger than "mini." Note: their kitchen does not provide lunch - they send out to local places as indicated on their menu. Didn't try that. The bed was VERY comfortable and the pillows,sheets and towels were very, very nice. The best bathrobe (two actually) in a very long time. i think for a targeted clientele (and I fall outside that circle), this is a really good, if not the only, option in this area. Even with the aspects I really didn't care for or would want to repeat, I think they do a pretty good job and I expect have a very satisfied following - and deservedly so. It all depends what your tastes are, but I don't question the management's intent to build a brand and provide customer satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated - awful service”
Reviews.Author: Jmo867
Reviews.Content: There are some things to like about this hotel but lots that drives you totally crazy. The staff were rude and unhelpful. We stayed over thanksgiving weekend - I had called when i booked to make sure could get food on thanksgiving day - was told absolutely and then when called to get dinner (when nothing else open ) they said absolutely no food. It took an hour and a half to get ice. Only one elevator worked for 19 floors for 4 days. They think they are four star hotel but not even close.

Reviews.Title: “Very Modern & Great Views & Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: sdudley24
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is in the Lower East Side of Manhattan...just one avenue away you can get on the F or J subway train and start exploring the city. You could also take a walk to Freedom Towers, Brooklyn Bridge, China Town, Little Italy, SoHo, or even Washington Square Park...all 30 minutes or less...and it's fun to walk to places when you can in the City because you never know what cool little shop or restaurant you will find. Speaking of restaurants, the hotel had two very good places directly underneath...CO-OP and Victor & Spoils...I would highly recommend checking one or both of these places out while you're there...we had a chance to meet Chef John Keller and he was fantastic. Now back to the hotel itself...the rooms were very modern and had spectacular views of the City...of course, I would assume you need to request a high enough floor for the views. We stayed on the 12th floor and it was perfect. I believe all of the beds had tempurpedic mattresses, so you'll definitely sleep good...and we did not notice any street noise while sleeping, which is good considering the location has bars and nightlife everywhere you look. Look, when you go to the City, you're not going to spend a lot of time in the room...and if you're looking for more of a cool vibe and a sense of staying in a local neighborhood away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square...then definitely stay here! The room is great with plenty of space and the neighborhood has plenty to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views. Nice Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jazzgator
Reviews.Content: I was really pleasantly surprised by this hotel. First, the views are AMAZING. We were on the 18th floor in a unique king room, and I've never seen such an outstanding, unobstructed view of NYC. It was breathtaking. There are floor to ceiling windows throughout the room, including the bathroom. The bathroom was great and very spacious, with an amazing tub that looked out over the city. If you don't like the idea of showering with nothing between you and the city but glass windows and no curtains, you might not like this, but I thought it was cool (I seriously doubt anybody could see you from the neighboring buildings, as they are not extremely close. Somebody would definitely need binoculars, and really who's doing that??). The room decor is sparse but modern, and the room is actually quite spacious by NYC standards. I had never slept on a Tempur-pedic mattress, but I have to say it was great and I wish I had one now. I woke up refreshed every morning. You really can't beat the location, especially if you're like me and prefer to stay away from midtown/times square/above 14th street when you come to town. It's a super short cab ride away from Williamsburg, and you're in walking distance to so many great bars and restaurants in the Lower East Side, including the terrific Inoteca which is a stone's throw away. You're also a short walk away from the East Village. There was no noise on our floor, and the staff was great. I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - fantastic view!”
Reviews.Author: Barloe
Reviews.Content: We had a corner room on the 19th floor with a great view over Manhatten. That was truly a great experience. The room was big (got an upgrade), the bathroom was huge and the amenities the best I have seen! I

Reviews.Title: “Cool, Comfortable and Chic”
Reviews.Author: Lauren1226
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Rivington with my mother, brother and sister and really loved the whole vibe and energy of the accommodation. The doormen were extremely helpful and friendly, the breakfast staff were highly attentive and even memorized our orders every morning. Unfortunately, 6 days into our 3 week stay at the Rivington, we received some news from home and sadly my mother and brother had to suddenly fly home. The staff were so caring and attentive and really made sure that my sister and I were taken care of - constantly checking up on us and making sure we were as comfortable as possible. The rooms were very comfortable, especially the beds, and the view from the 16th floor was incredible. Being 22 years old, I loved the Lower East Side area - perfect for trendy restaurants, cafe's and clubs; as well as cute stores and vintage shops. It was also very easy to get around with a subway just around the corner. I would definitely stay at the Rivington again. It will be my New York City home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay on the 3rd floor”
Reviews.Author: gado0002
Reviews.Content: First off, this hotel is in a pretty good location with a subway a block away and good restaurants nearby. Our room was ok, not worth the price, but that is what you get for staying in the city. Our first night we stayed on the 3rd floor. We had a pretty awesome steam shower and tub, the bed was memory foam and very comfortable, but the noise at night was ridiculous!!! The coop club was below us and we could hear the music and people allllll night. The street noise was also loud. We requested to switch to another room the next night and the staff was neither apologetic or surprised. We switched to the 9th floor which was a lot quieter. I think we actually had a downgrade in room, but the hotel did not offer to cover the difference bc they said it was the same rate. Overall, I was disappointed that they would even have such ridiculous noise levels Inthe hotel and disappointed they did not seem to care about it.

Reviews.Title: “Unique, Cool, Boutique Hotel in Lower Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: chapetx
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our 3 year wedding anniversary! The hotel is located in Manhattan's Lower East Side. If you like the hustle and bustle of the neighborhood you'll like this hotel! We asked for an upgrade before arrive and they were happy to accomodate us. We were given a room on the 8th floor with a bathtub. I was worried we would hear traffic noise but the room was quiet which was a pleasant surprise. The room itself was well appointment. It housed a desk, couch and King size bed with room to spare. It had a balcony too. The bathroom was the best part. A glass shower that overlooked the city and the deepest soaking tub I've ever seen! My room was very clean. The hallways of the hotel and elevator are looking a bit used but that's to be expected. During my one night stay I received 2 cookie and 1 cupcake deliveries. Having sweets brought to my room was the icing on the cake of our stay! The staff was helpful as well. When we couldn't catch a cab they called a car service for us. I recommed this hotel to tourists who want a little adventure or for couples looking for a modern, unique getaway.

Reviews.Title: “More cool than comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Vegas_Colada
Reviews.Content: This place is minimalist and dark. By that logic, if you like minimalist and dark then you'll love it. I've had my fair share of NYC minimalist and dark experiences and I think I'm ready to move on now. Give me some warmth, some light and an easy to find reception area. The hotel does do a couple of things very well however. The mini bar is one of the best that I have ever come across and has quirky items as well as interesting drinks. The view from my balcony was also a treat. Watching the sun rise made my jet lag almost worthwhile. Apart from that, this place is unexceptional. As one of the other reviewers mentions, the breakfast was not for champions. It was for chumps. The poached egg arrived floating in a little puddle of water. Is that right? Other eggs I saw were presented in the same way, so maybe I am missing out on something here.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing unobstructed views of the beautiful city.”
Reviews.Author: ritchie83
Reviews.Content: I booked the standard high floor king room for my husbands 30th and noted it in my reservations. I was prepared to ask the hotel manager if I can get an upgrade, but upon checking in they offered me an upgrade first thing. I went from booking a room on the 9th floor to getting room 195 on the 19th floor. MY jaw dropped when I walked in and saw the view! We had a balcony that just about wrapped the entire lengh of the building. It was amazing, the staff left a birthday card for my husband with red velvet cupcakes and when my husband met me at the hotel, he was surprised. He had no idea I booked a room here much less the amazing room they gave us! We had dinner at co-op and danced the night away at the lounge. There was Not too many pretencious people there which was good and the staff was friendly. I will def stay there again for two days instead of one so that I can enjoy the view of my beautiful city, that is New York. Living in queens, the hotel provides that dream apartment with gorgeous unobstructed views.

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST”
Reviews.Author: aheldz
Reviews.Content: Dirty, phones don't work, no hot water, dark, minimalist in all senses of the word. Minimal service, minimal willingness, inept and disorganized staff. Reservation staff has no idea what they are doing. Food in the restaurant served cold, not exactly the breakfast of champions. Flatware was dirty...rice was stuck in the tines of the fork. Low level floors on weekends are not meant for sleeping. Make no requests of the staff...have no expectations. Women, if you want to put on makeup you will have to go elsewhere to do it, lighting in bathrooms is also minimalist. Showers were difficult to adjust and there are no exhaust fans so the bathroom steams up and it just lingers, sinks don't drain so if you want to brush your teeth spit in the toilet, it just might flush.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Dublintwinkle
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a stay at Hotel on Rivington and I have to say it was amazing. When we arrived we were greeted by very nice doormen who were so helpful during our stay. Reception is located on the 2nd floor and has a very french bordello feel. There was a problem with our reservation, the room we had requested and paid for (a high king corner) was not available due to a plumbing issue, they were very apologetic and gave us a high king on the 19th floor. The views from the room were absolutely fantastic, we could see across the whole city. The room was so bright with lovely furnishings and the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. We loved the shower - nice to be able to see the NY skyline while washing your hair. The hotel sent us a bottle of wine to make up for the room change, this was a nice touch. We loved the space in the room, a total change from the normal tiny NY hotel rooms. We also loved the location of the hotel, refreshing to be away from the total tourist hot spots. Lots of bars and restaurants nearby and a real buzz about the place. We had dinner in the hotel restaurant (Co-op) and have to say it was one of the best meals we have ever had. Food was divine and so well presented, the bar is also very lively. We definintely would return to this hotel - it may not be to everyone's tastes but for us it was perfect and we cannot wait to visit again

Reviews.Title: “Interesting”
Reviews.Author: Sue C
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the this hotel purely because I could not get in anywhere else. It was a great surprise in that the room was a fabulous size. I had a king corner suite with a huge deep bath, and amazing views. I thought it was new, but realized it wasn't from the paint and badly patched up 'bit's'...BUT it wasn't a problem. It was very private, and in a great location. A completely different part of NYC..I enjoyed the diverse restaurants, and the very comfortable bed. I would stay there again, even though the price was more than I wanted to pay...oh, and the evening cookies at night were much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced - Tired - only if you need the neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: hillsoftuscany
Reviews.Content: Our friends booked us to this hotel in order to be closer to his son's apartment. I arrived early before the room was ready - my first impression entering the hotel on the street level was not good. Door glass dirty only matched by the tired dirty red carpet on street level. I was told to WALK up to the reception desk - not given an elevator option. Reception was quite nice - though the furniture, floors, looked very tired. Asking for a bathroom to use - told the only one was in the restaurant in the lobby - down the stairs - (learned later elevator worked just fine) - and down again down stairs to the lower level toilets. Room - Balcony room on the 19th floor. Views fantastic. Long narrow room, no desk, low furniture, no room safe (later learned rooms have safes - front desk was puzzled when I asked why no safe) - bathroom DARK with one sink - no make up mirror (wife not happy about that), excellent water pressure in the shower. I didn't call the desk on this. Our keys didn't work after coming back from theatre - back to the front desk - told the batteries on the system probably need changing. No one on duty at night. TV never worked right and if your tall you could bump your head as it's hanging from the ceiling. No need to call the desk, no one on duty to fix it. Fresh baked goods at night turn down don't make up for no room service before 7am (how about those who come from different time zones) - our request for coffee at 6:40 was simply left hanging on the door. I get that if they had taken it I would have expected coffee - no illusions here. At $750 a night for this balcony room is a high priced not so funny joke (remember I didn't book this) - one would expect the services and comfort associated with this kind of pricing. It's a happening area of town for some and if you MUST be in that area it's a choice. Too many other better choices in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Slipping...”
Reviews.Author: jbleenyc
Reviews.Content: This is about the fourth or fifth time I've stayed at the Rivington. Perhaps it's the effects of the general economic downturn, but this once super glamorous hotel is starting to feel a little forlorn... The ground floor bar/restaurant seems to cater almost exclusively to tourists and bridge/tunnel crowd now, and though the rooms on the upper floors (had a corner on the 10th floor this time) still offer some of the most quintessentially downtown NY views, and seem to have been physically maintained quite well considering that the building must be going on 10 years now, there's something slipshod about the serviceâ€”housekeeping, room serviceâ€”with toiletries not being replaced/replenished, breakfasts arriving way too late, cold and missing silverware, that sort of thing. Feels the staff has been downsized, but when the rooms here are still going for almost $500 a night, in a town that has recently seen new boutique hotels springing up in Chelsea and downtown, it's inexcusable. I hope the hotel can bring itself back up to its previous level of service, because it's still one of my favorites whenever I'm in NY.

Reviews.Title: “High floor corner king with balcony”
Reviews.Author: FloppyCopy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 nights. Great area for exploring manhattan. The hotel was very clean and quiet at night. The cleaning personell came twice a day to clean the room. Every day they also left different kinds of cookies, that where free of cost. Could not hear a sound from the other rooms. The aircondition made more sound than excepted, but this could be turned off. The bed was amazing, actually the best bed i have sleeped in at a hotel! Service at the reception was a bit too much high class and not the typical new yorker friendly style. But if you look for a hotel with a fantastic view and great sleep quality in the lower east side of manhattan, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Silver Wedding Treat”
Reviews.Author: brennanz
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 great days in NY using the Hotel on Rivington as our base. The staff could not be more helpful and the whole experience was very enjoyable. The location was great, close to the subway on Delancy Street, and a reasonable bus service to midtown. Hotel provided a door to door cab service if required. Stayed in a King corner room on the 18th which was amazing!! Fantastic views over Manhattan towards Freedom Tower and Brooklyn Bridge. Incredibly atmospheric, it really made it special. Brilliant shower where you could overlook the neighbourhood, just hope they could not see you. The area at night was buzzing, good bars and restaurants nearby if you did not want to eat at the hotel. Thoroughly recommend this for a special trip or occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel Save for a Few Grumbles...”
Reviews.Author: Amietheresa
Reviews.Content: We visited the Rivington for 6 nights in August/September 2011. After much research on here and reading the good and not so good reviews I decided to take my chances and book it anyway. We booked a high floor corner king with balcony. Before our trip I emailed the hotel and asked to ensure that our room was north facing (i.e. with a view of the Empire State Building) and received a response to say this had been added to my reservation and if there was anything else they could do to please get in touch. Lovely. We arrived a couple of hours early and even though our room wasn't ready yet the doormen took our bags straight from us and gladly stored them and assured us that as soon as we checked in they would bring them right up. The hotel reception staff rang us as soon as it was ready (which was before the 4pm check in time). Check in was smooth and pleasant and I found all the reception staff that we dealt with during the stay helpful, and friendly. The reception area, the lobby and the lifts are all very funky which we liked. Doormen always around although sometimes they are a tad frosty but never rude. Security guy on a weekend plus the added security of needing to use your room key to access the lifts and stairwells after a certain time at night. Makes for a very safe feeling. One of my downfalls - when we got to our room on the 12th floor which was very spacious, big tempur bed was heavenly, large bathroom with a fabulous shower, a little lounge area and a decent sized closet - it had a DOWTOWN VIEW! My fiancee popped down to reception to mention that we'd requested a north facing room only to be told that THE ONLY ROOMS THAT FACE NORTH WITH AN UPTOWN VIEW ARE SUITES!! Unfortunately it doesn't say this on the website so be warned people!!!!! Nontheless we still had a lovely view of the bridges and it was stunning to see the sun rise over them in the morning. I wouldn't have bothered with a balcony had i seen it beforehand, it wasn't anything to write home about, you couldn't sit out on it or anything. We still really enjoyed the stay, lighting was never a problem - bright sunshine in the day from two walls of windows and plenty of light in the room and bathroom at night, i think people who have had a previous issue with low lighting don't realise there are dimmers on the light switches. Didn't hear a peep of noise from our room other than usual city noise of sirens and the odd car honk. The hotel bar was wonderful - good strong drinks, albeit a little pricey but if you're going to any upmarket bar in Manhattan expect prices like these. Good music, didn't try the food but a nice mix of people and a wonderful guy on the door. I read online that they open the penthouse on a Sunday for a rooftop party - they don't - private events only. The area is great - loads of funky bars and restaurants a stones throw away and a subway just round the corner. Never felt unsafe, plenty of people wandering round at all hours and a real buzz to the nightlife. Spitzers Corner Bar, just a few steps up the street is great for people watching and the bar staff in there are great fun. I'd stay here again if i was going to stay in the Lower East Side.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: smoe
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here! Great location, great views, and spacious rooms. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: petezigs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend recently and had a great time. Super comfy beds, cool interior design and great views. The service was great as well. The ipod connections and lighting in the rooms is a nice touch, although some of the ultra modern furniture and fixtures are starting to look a teensy bit "lived in". That said, everything was super clean, turn down services left rice crispy treats and it was fun to watch the ebb and flow of Lower East Side life on the streets below from the giant windows in our room. I would definitely return here for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Who Needs A Desk?”
Reviews.Author: Salhowl
Reviews.Content: You would think that a desk would be a standard piece of furniture in a hotel, and not just any hotel, one that charged me $515 a night (that's $590 with taxes). So, if you don't care about a desk, maybe you'd like a room with some light? Oh, sorry, you're also out of luck. The lights are very difficult to figure out, but once you do that, the room is dim at best. With all the lights on, it's lit like a bar. And this is true in the bathroom also. So, really not a big deal if you don't want to put in your contact lenses, or apply makeup. When you walk in off the street, the carpet is dirty. The carpet in the room is black, so good luck finding anything you drop that is also dark. I almost left a shoe there because it blended in with the carpet, and I had a black case that went to my iPad, but I couldn't find it--a combination of the low lighting and black carpet. Next time, I'll bring a flashlight. The hotel is in an area that is still a bit dicey, and it is filthy dirty--it does not look anything like the streets or sidewalks in the nicer areas of town. I'd have prefered to pitch a tent in Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “Exhibtionists delight”
Reviews.Author: robin_d822
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked through hotels.com and was quite an eye opener. The showers in the bathrooms have one glass wall - on the outside of the building. Anyone who wants to view you, can, unless you a) shower at night with the lights off or b) really steam up the bathroom first. The place may be suitable to those who wish to be risque, but beware parents, and be ready to cover the little one's eyes.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveltoparadise
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night. I had a reservation at the 60 Thompson and when I got to the hotel, there where no rooms available (even though I had my reservation)....so the 60 Thompson sent me and my husband to the Rivington hotel just for one night and we really liked it. We liked the bathrooms, the rooms are a little bit small and organized differently (the end of the bed close to the window)... but it was very good and they have like a little living room. We also liked the minibar. Our stay was too short because we went back to the 60 Thompson next day, but We definetly will consider this hotel in our next visit to NYC. Employees at the front desk where really friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: bittercool
Reviews.Content: I booked a regular king room via Jetsetter and I was reassured that the room was rather spacious! It was overall a comfortable stay and I would definitely recommend this hotel (as well as Jetsetter) to my friends who are traveling to NYC. I stayed at the 6th floor, and it was generally quite quiet, safe for the occasional noise from our air-conditioner at night. Breaking down the pros and cons: Pros: 1. Spacious room - for the regular king room, there was a king size bed, a spacious "living area" with 2 sofas, coffee table and the bathroom was of a decent size too. 2. Good location - ridiculously near the Delancey/Essex subway station, and a decent walk to several restaurants at Lower East Side and the shops at Soho. There were several pubs and restaurants within the vicinity of Rivington, so there is always people around the streets. Pretty safe neighbourhood to walk about at night - there is no lack of food choices. 3. The hotel itself serves great brunch. Try Co-Op for brunch and this place transforms into a pretty happening bar at night. Cons: 1. There is a see-through window at the shower area, which we were not too comfortable about. 2. Although the hotel is rather new (built in early 2000), some of the places and furnishing shows wear and tear. But this is something I could live with. 3. As an Asian who is used to the wide array of amenities offered by Asian hotels, I was mildly disappointed when I found out that there was no toothbrush, bedroom slippers and cutlery in the room. Nonetheless, you could get this from the hotel by calling the house keeping department. It was just a bit of a hassle to request and wait for spoons everytime I wanted to eat my yoghurt. 4. No bath tub in our room, and no swimming pool in the hotel. I thought there was a rooftop bar at the hotel, but it was apparently not opened anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay was much better”
Reviews.Author: WanderLSP
Reviews.Content: My first stay here (in July 2011) was so crazy awful that they gave me a free night (that I used August 2011). I thought that was a great way to rectify the situation. My second stay was MUCH better than the first. Plus, the gave me a nice suite.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel in LES”
Reviews.Author: ceirela
Reviews.Content: Letâ€™s get the negatives out of the way first. Despite its sleek modern dÃ©cor, most of the furniture in our room is pretty beat with lots of visible wear and tear. Noise level varies depending on where your room is. Our room is on the 8th floor, the backside of the hotel, which is pretty much noise-free, except the occasional noises from the bathroom (shower running) next door. Our friend, whose room is on the 6th floor towards the front side of the hotel, complains about noises from the street as well as music from the clubs, keeping him up at night. Now moving on with the positives. First of all, the location is GREAT!! Itâ€™s literally one minute away from all the trendy bars/clubs, 5 minutesâ€™ walk to famous food stops (Katâ€™z Deli, Russ & Daughters, Doughnut plant, Lukeâ€™s lobster, etc), and the subway station is one block away. Secondly, the room is pretty spacious, for NYC standard. Turndown service is nice and the daily sweets that they leave by the bed add a nice touch. Staff at the concierge desk is friendly and helpful. Tempeur-Pedic beds are comfy. Finally, free wi-fi. Not that you are going to spend a lot of time in your room using it, but itâ€™s still nice when you donâ€™t have to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for a better place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sharon M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on the lower east side, one block from a subway and within $15 cab ride to most of the attractions. We would definitely recommend this hotel and will likely stay there in the future. Balconies are not for anyone afraid of heights! They are very narrow and small. Unless your a smoker, wouldn't invest the extra money for a balcony. The tub was beautiful however we were so busy and on the go, we didn't get to enjoy it. So if you are going on a short trip and a nonsmoker, probably just a room without the balcony and tub would be sufficient. Request the highest room they have available, a corner room if possible facing north.

Reviews.Title: “My stay in the hotel was simply great!”
Reviews.Author: MichalCichecki
Reviews.Content: New York was one of the places I visited during my around the world trip and I stayed in the Hotel on Rivington in March 2011. My stay in the hotel was great and there is probably not much what I could add here what could change anything. So if you are going to be in the Big Apple for a business meeting â€“ I hope it will be a successful one. If you are going there for a sightseeing â€“ I hope you will have a good time. If you are looking for a place to stay in the city â€“ I hope it will be the Hotel On Rivington...

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel - not mad on location!”
Reviews.Author: brophylad
Reviews.Content: So stayed here for just the one night - prior to a cruise from Bayonne. We were on the 22nd floor with balcony and have to say that the views were superb and room was great, glass walls floor to ceiling - pure relaxation. It is ideally located if you want to cover Chinatown, Soho and the lower east side (LES). I was with my wife and to be honest she felt a little unsafe at times when you were a few blocks from the hotel. From reading previous posts it turns out that there is a couple of missions within a few blocks of this hotel and this draws what could be construed as some unsavoury types. The hotel is not cheap and to be honest it is a bit different from other hotels I have stayed in, tis a little bit quirky with the reception on the 2nd floor with a pool table just off it, the fully glass windowed bathroom and bed rooms but I really liked it. So over all a nice hotel not the best location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot at Lower eastside”
Reviews.Author: Marthes
Reviews.Content: The hotel on rivington is located in the hearth of lower eastside. The rooms are spacious and cleened twice a day. The bathroom is dark and luxurious with a turkish steem bath combined with the shower. A cute gesture is the home made cookies they serve you in the afternoon. The lobby is chick with a pool table.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the cookies for turndown”
Reviews.Author: Iloveboutiquehotels
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, clean and functional. The first night when I arrived there was a thunderstorm so I left the curtains opened in the fishbowl room and enjoyed watching the LES light up. For turndown they delivered different cookies every night, much nicer than chocolates. I loved the shampoo & conditioner (Momo by Davines), I've seen them sold in hair salons but never tried it before, I loved it so much now I have a full size bottle at home! The location is great if you spend most of your visit in downtown. I had several meetings in midtown and it was a bit of a pain to get up there and cabs are difficult to grab around there in the morning. So many restaurant hot spots as well as funky galleries, ideal for those who have the energy to enjoy their time after business is over for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CC1980London
Reviews.Content: Really good place to stay if you fancy being away from the madness up town. LES is a cool happening area plenty of bars and restaurants and shops nearby. Soho is also close by. Hotel bar is a great place to visit (cocktails are strong) likewise the nightclub is also worth a visit. Can't fault the staff throughout the place all very polite and helpful. Hotel rooms were amazing we had a steam room in our bathroom ! Worth a visit !

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in the world!”
Reviews.Author: visit10
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. Not cheap admittedly, but priced well for a high end place. I'd requested a room on a high floor and got one allocated -in fact they allocated a free upgrade and the room was a good size, with a massive hot tub in the bathroom too. Slightly unusual about the shower being by the full length windows with no blind! - but once you get over the lack of privacy on that front, you get on with it! Bed was one of the most comfortable we've ever slept in! And not sure i'd say the reception staff were friendly as such, but they were business like and professional. The guys on the door downstairs were very helpful and friendly though. As they always say, it's location location location. And this hotel was in an amazing location. Out of the main tourist trail, but still located with easy access to subway etc. More importantly, it felt like real NYC, lots of locals, nice bars and restaurants etc..

Reviews.Title: “Amazing boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: InAllMyTravels
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the fantastic hotel in June. I had heard a few reviews but was not prepared for how nice it really was. The view, I was on the 18th floor, was simply incredible. Having a corner room, the bathroom was situated in the corner with a HUGE tub with the faucet coming out of the ceiling. Staff was friendly and ehlpful with the local fare and it is in a very cool part of NY.

Reviews.Title: “Easy-going stay”
Reviews.Author: brencunningham
Reviews.Content: Check-in was a breeze. Everyone at the desk was professional. Room is minimally decorated (no desk, no crummy wall art) and one of the largest we've had in the city. Bed is supremely comfortable. Bathroom was spacious and sleek. Steam shower was a nice amenity. Bed and shower outshines most everything. Bathroom shampoo, conditioner, shower gel by MOMO; nice. Umbrellas in the closet was a thoughtful inclusion. No ironing boards or iron, which could be helpful. Full minibar (for a price, though reasonable). I really enjoy staying in the LES and exploring that area. I'd stay here again if possible. Doormen there 24/7, I believe.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: Castor
Reviews.Content: We went for the High floor corner king. Fantastic views, fantastic room - beds are amazing. People complaining about dark corridors and it beeing worn down I do not agree. Hotel is close to loads of hip restaurants, bars and shops within the Lower East area. 5 minute walk to chinatown and LIttle Italy. Super hotel - would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Huge room by NY standards”
Reviews.Author: TheTravellingSnob
Reviews.Content: Hotel on Rivington was our last hotel in New York. I had read the reviews and decided to stay, besides we had received a great price through a booking company. The hotel itself falls very much in the level with most of the upper range hotels and although I can't put my finger on it it just looked a little dated. There is absolutely nothing wrong with it and the staff were friendly and helpful. The bed was possibly the most comfortable I have ever slept in in my life (it was a tempur bed I think) and the steam shower was a welcome relief after a busy day's shopping. The room was spotless and as I said by NY standards, enormous, although it appeared a little "sparse", but don't let that put you off, you don't go to a hotel for the room decor. The wireless internet access is free and worked well which is a great pleasure for someone who is there from overseas. All in all, woth every cent we paid for it.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Luxury Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: SookieLondon
Reviews.Content: If you like I thought you were going to a luxury trendy hotel in a cool area then you are WRONG!! where to start...being from London I will reference it to things in London as a comparison Location: LES trendy...well yes in the same way that Hackney in east London is considered "trendy" by some....area is distinctly run down...dirty and in summer very very smelly, there are also a couple of shelters in the area so quite a high population of drunks/addicts/homeless people. I have no problem with this generally but it's not necessarily what you wanted to be confronted with when on holiday...suffice to say as a woman I did not feel safe walking on my own at night in the area. Hotel: Service is TERRIBLE...would rather have stayed in Novotel or Premier Inn (which I have in the past and are a million times better than this). This was a special trip for my 30th Birthday, as such I made sure to ring the hotel 4 days before I arrived to tell them this to ensure that our High Floor Corner King (which is what we booked) would be on a high floor. This was not the case when I got there, the room was on the 9th floor (rooftop level) and having been travelling for 10 hours I couldn't have a shower as the builders who were working on the roof of the building nextdoor had a prime view in through the glass wall of the shower (partially not frosted). Reception were distinctly unhelpfull, it was only after strongly complaining to both the hotel and virgin travel that they agreed to move us to a higher floor the following day. The communal areas feel dirty and have not been maintained..there is no quality to the finish of the rooms...curtains were hanging off the rail and the furniture is very tired (badly marked tables with scuffed edges and faded lampshades) some of the lights in the room were also not working as were two of the tv channels (choice of tv was also poor- no BBC/CNN) The so called trendy bar and club were far from that, a group of us went to the extremely small club on the saturday night and a small number of highly unglamourous people were in attendance - atmosphere was completely dead! New York has lots of great hotels - some of our group stayed in Trump Soho and that was amazing - definately get what you pay for! This is a distinctly average hotel and is good if you are quite young and like the kind of grungy scene that the lower east side provides or if you do not have the busget to afford a better hotel...for this reason I can understand some of the other reviews - if however you are used to staying in high end luxury hotels with good service please avoid this place like the plague or you will be bitterly dissapointed as I was

Reviews.Title: “Will be recommended to friends!”
Reviews.Author: Terratravel33
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, friendly staff, designer type hotel. Bed was great (for sleeping as well), plenty of towels in bathroom. We stayed in a "lowpriced" room on the 7th floor, but didn't notice the nightclub noise. Next time we probably will upgrade to a higher floor , just to get a better view. Perfect distance for Soho and the areas on lower Manhattan

Reviews.Title: “Looks cool on paper - but not a good hotel at all...”
Reviews.Author: sydtraveller_11
Reviews.Content: We booked in for 10 nights and the longer we stayed the more we realised this hotel is all style and NO substance. Our front door did not close properly The internet speed is dial-up at best when it is working Our air con kept breaking down but they refused to move us The staff have no idea about service It is a shame cause the views are good and the location is great. If you are after service and comfort stay somewhere else

Reviews.Title: “Well run hotel in a bustling neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: septemberfalls
Reviews.Content: My new favourite hotel in NYC - spacious rooms, nice bathrooms, huge windows with views, great bed, warm cookies every evening. The best part about it is that the staff is so helpful and nice. It's right in the heart of the LES, and there is a lot of activity going on around the hotel until the wee hours - but sound was not a problem in our room on the 7th floor. Tons of great restaurants surrounding (including 'inca, and Coop, which is right off the lobby). Also near Essex food market, and a subway line. Highly recommend - didn't find a single thing wrong with this place!

Reviews.Title: “Good experience in the Lower East Side”
Reviews.Author: Elle47
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I purchased a 2 night stay on a hotel auction site and got a great deal. Overall, it was a good stay. The interior of the hotel was rather dark, but the room was very bright with lots of window. We had an amazing view of the Manhattan skyline, including Empire State Building, from our view. We loved the turn down service with desserts - brownies one night and rice krispie treats the next! The service was very good. The doorman went out of his way to find us a cab on the street corner at an off-peak time. There were some good restaurants and bars on our street, and it was fun to spend some time exploring the LES.

Reviews.Title: “Sadly not as good as it used to be!”
Reviews.Author: Marc7373
Reviews.Content: Having previously stayed here in 2005, when the hotel was a great deal newer, my second visit left me feeling a bit sad. My two biggest moans are that the rooms (we stayed in a corner king both times) have not been touched in those six years. Cracked tiles in the bathroom, even a cracked window pain, and the tv and iPod dock now just seem old. On one of the 4 nights our bathroom wasn't cleaned. Perhaps more sad is that the bar and restaurant are now almost completely estranged from the hotel. At the prices charged, it feels more like you are staying in a serviced apartment rather than a hotel, which the old Hotel didn't feel like. The new Co-op restaurant is a blatant attempt to entice the local population in, to the detriment of the hotel guests. I think this is a big mistake by the hotel, especially when the rooms are now so tired. You cannot fault the location, the views and the surrounding bars and restaurants - but Hotel on Rivington have really dropped the ball here, and with hungrier and hipper places springing up nearby, you have to worry for the hotel in it's current guise. Still good, but need some big investment and to recapture some of the original attention to detail. Overall a bit sad.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in the great LES”
Reviews.Author: tasteful-travel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my friend for 2 nights in a lovely suite! The hotel is of a very good standard and doesn't feel stiff or has that arrogant feel that so many other 4star NYC hotels have. I especially liked the attention to detail, such as cookies before bedtime and cool toiletteries. We had a suite and it was awesome as it had a huge terrace! The location is ace, as it's good some great bars and restaurants around the corner and is also really quick to get to from JFK by taxi. There's a great Meatball restaurant around the corner, don't miss!

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel in top location!”
Reviews.Author: Nathan Z
Reviews.Content: After reading loads of reviews on this hotel (mostly good but some bad), we bit the bullet and booked it and thank god we did! We love the LES, so many great bars, restaurant's, cafes and shops within a stones throw of the hotel. Check Schillers for dinner and a drink 1 block away and grab an awesome crepe for breakfast on the opposite corner of the hotel. We have a room on the 14th floor looking uptown directly at the empire state and have had magnificent sunset's to watch from our room each night (i am looking at one as i write this). The staff have all been lovely and extremely helpful with everything we have needed, we have had complimentary freshly baked cookies dropped off to us in the evening, the room has been cleaned well and promptly every day and the tempur beds are wonderful - a little different at first but we love them. Great bathroom amenities, nice powerful shower, comfy bath robes and a well stocked minibar. For the money, this hotel is a winner if you want to be downtown. A 5 minute walk to soho and East village, rooms are a good size for nyc standards (we have a sitting area and 2 large suitcases and we can still move around easily) and free wifi. Love hotel on Rivington x

Reviews.Title: “Disgraceful - an Ikea hotel at Conran Store prices.”
Reviews.Author: charlesreston
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our final two nights in New York as a treat - after a lot of research on hotels in this price range this seemed like it was going to be not only luxurious but also a bit different from the old style Manhattan glamour of a lot of Midtown hotels in the same price range. We booked a high floor king corner room with a Japanese Soaking ~Tub as a paid extra. What a mistake. The signs were there from the beginning - the famous bar downstairs was under renovation (and apparently had been for some time). Nowhere was this made clear on the website or even in the hotel. Staff at check in gave us no information about anything - breakfast, fitness center, check out times, hours of the smaller lounge bar. Eventually we found out that this opened at 6pm and headed downstairs to enjoy a cocktail, only to find a completely incompetent bartender who (at $15 a drink) was unable to offer us a menu, and unable to offer any suggestions when we asked him for house specials. We even had to tell him what the word refreshing meant. In the next fifteen minutes the hotel staff decided to carry out a building meeting in front of our very eyes (why this couldn't have been conducted outside of opening hours I don't know) before we witnessed check in staff and our bartender then descend upon the leftovers of a plate of food at another customer's table. In front of paying guests. The room was equally disgraceful - stained towels, loose tiles in the bathroom, no hotel information pack, no shampoo/shower gel in the bath area, nothing but a rubber plug in the bath which would dislodge with the slightest bit of movement, letting all the water out. The hairdryer was broken, insufficient cleaning had left clumps of hair on the armchairs completely ignored, and the general furnishings showed all the signs of scrimping and saving on the proprietors' part; furniture and units (probably from Ikea) that might have looked slick when first bought for the hotel's 2008 opening but only three years down the line look tacky and tired. We presented these compaints to the manager (after initial check-in staff were completely indifferent) and to be fair she accepted our compaints and offered to waiver the room fee for one night. However this doesn't change the fact that the hotel is poorly staffed, poorly equipped and generally an all round disappointment. Avoid it like the plague and stay in somewhere with real charm and service like The Library in Midtown.

Reviews.Title: “hipsterville”
Reviews.Author: TerryD
Reviews.Content: The hotel is stylish and comfortable and the location abounds with a great choice of restaurants and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Staying here now and not impressed.”
Reviews.Author: allicatsimmons
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 2 years ago and from this stay I would have to say it is in decline. Lobby bathrooms were not very clean and a handle fell off in my hand. The "double double" rooms lack balcony's and the views of the rooms pictured on the website. NO soundproofing so all hallway and other floor sounds are heard at all hours. Super slow internet. And anything you request is met with the response "no sorry, health and safety reasons". But the hotel provides in room candles so figure that out.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: Bronzchica
Reviews.Content: i think this was my favorite hotel ever! It is a beautiful glass tower on the lower east side. The rooms are beautifully furnished and windows are everywhere. We were given a complimentary upgrade to a corner room on a high floor and we had a view of the Williamsburg Bridge. Light was coming in from every angle and that includes the bathrooms. The bathrooms are black tile with windows int he shower, but they are opaque glass. Also had a gorgeous japanese soaking tub but i did not have a chance to use it. other reviewers mentioned noise fromt he restaurant downstairs but I never heard anything. Subway is very close by and taxis are readily available on Rivington Street. I booked through expedia and got a great deal. I will definitely return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “perfect place”
Reviews.Author: bugzy019
Reviews.Content: When it comes to places in Manhattan, I tend to be very picky....In this case there is nothing to be picky about! fantastic atmosphere, staff, prices and the nightlife...well lets just say they could make me feel young again..I would love to spend a weekend here.

Reviews.Title: “Great LES location, great views, cool design”
Reviews.Author: rhhsf
Reviews.Content: Love this place. Stay here for CMJ and other conferences in lower manhattan. The rooms are beautiful modern style. The beds are really comfortable, tempuredic mattresses, nice soft bedding. Incredible views from high floors. The hallways are very dark, but the rooms are very bright, and good sizes too. The lounge/restaurant gets packed and there is often a line to get into the hotel. Make sure when you're heading out to smile and say hi to the doorman so he'll remember you- otherwise you might have to fuss with your wallet to show your key to get into the hotel. I was a little disappointed on my last stay that the room I was in didn't have the electric-operated draperies anymore (seems like they broke and they just replaced them with standard curtains). I guess that the hotel is showing its age a little, but it's still great. The bathrooms have giant showers with floor to ceiling windows (partially opaqued on lower floors, less partial on higher floors). The soaps and shampoos are lovely as well. It's fun staying here. Right in the heart of the Lower East Side, tons of interesting places near by, close to the subway. Tallest building on the block, which makes for the great views. Much better than the Thompson LES that I stayed at lsat year.

Reviews.Title: “dark, dreary and already beat down”
Reviews.Author: lapsarian
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights last week and was mostly disappointed. The room was an OK size, but there were only a few tiny halogens in the ceiling and the bathroom lighting was very low as well - making it non-functional as a place to shave or get ready for a big day. After spending a few mornings in the room with the blinds wide open (exposed to the tenants across the street) I could see why they wanted to keep the lights down - the construction was sub-par. For example, the floor tiles in the bathroom had been removed and replaced unevenly so they were painful to step on (had to lay towels down). Parts of the room that you could see had cracked molding, chipped or broken wood and grout sticking out...just sloppy, unskilled construction. Listed as Deluxe, but it's definitely not. Other than the disappointment regarding the condition of the room, I had to sleep with earplugs. The windows, though new, were not sound proof and the toilet never stopped running.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Rivington”
Reviews.Author: thisiscooling
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Rivington while on honeymoon and overall had a good stay The positives - The lower east side is less touristy and has lots of gorgeous boutiques nearby to explore - The hotel was just one block from the Essex subway station - The staff were generally very friendly and welcoming - The room was always well cleaned and well stocked, room service bringing cookies every afternoon! - Breakfast wasn't included in our room charge, but at $5 each it was reasonable - The candy shop directly opposite the hotel is amazing! The negatives - The windows still let in a lot of noise 15 floors up and I was woken up in the early hours of the morning by another guest shouting on their balcony - The hotel's website SEVERELY glamorised the views from bedroom windows, the view from our window was by no means stunning - Bar prices were a little steep, even for NYC Would possibly stay again, but we chose the hotel based upon a very glam website that turned out to be highly airbrushed. Good stay nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel with one of the best beds I've ever slept on.”
Reviews.Author: M4RKM
Reviews.Content: After travelling in from San Francisco, and delayed by a few hours, it wasn't until just gone midnight that I got to the Hotel on Rivington. The party scene was downstairs, but a doorman spotted me straight away, took my luggage for me and then up to the lobby on the second floor. Check in was smooth and problem free, and I was given a room on the 16th Floor. With floor to ceiling windows, looking south, I had an amazing view, which only got better the next morning when the weather cleared up. A huge king bed with a Tempur Mattress was in the bedroom area, and there was a well stocked mini bar, desk, sofa and table, and plenty of closet space. I couldn't have asked for more! The bathroom was huge, and in all my years travelling, I've never had the bonus of a bathroom with a window, so an opening window next to the shower, and being able to admire the view was just out of this world. Cookies on turndown are a nice touch, and also not having to request the turndown service, it is automatic is even better. Free Wireless internet really makes a difference, I still don't get why some hotels charge! So, onto the bed. First time I've slept on a Tempur Mattress, and it was just amazing. First morning I woke up, I didn't want to leave. Onto that mini bar. Not really overpriced when compared to a bar price, but over priced if you compare it to a store. Plenty of space to put your own things in the mini bar too, so you can buy things locally to stock it up a bit more. The bathroom had both the shower with a view, and a huge japanese style soaking tub. Yeah, it takes a long time to fill up, but it's worth it just for the relaxation after a long day pounding the Manhattan streets. The floor to ceiling windows were amazing, and also I had a small balcony to walk out onto, maybe not the best in March, but perfect for taking some amazing photos of the view. The only annoyance with the room, (which I did get used to within a day), was that even though you had a black out curtain to block out the light from the main window, there was a frosted window in the bedroom to the shower area, which then, when it hit morning, let light into the room from the bathroom windows. The first night it annoyed me, and I found it bizarre, but then the second night it didn't bother me in the slightest. The hotel itself is great, the location in the Lower East Side is great for exploring the nearby area, East Village, Greenwich Village, and up to Union Square, all really within walking distance, plus you have a few subway lines around the corner to hop on and get you into Midtown for the normal NYC sightseeing. If you're thinking this hotel is too far away from the "centre" you must remember that NYC isn't a theme park, and the Subway will take you where you need to be, cheaply, and quickly. I can wholeheartedly recommend this hotel for a stay in NYC, especially if you can get a bargain rate, which then makes it more worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great views”
Reviews.Author: PHoustonCBalara
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel on Rivington a year ago, and we liked it so much that we have just booked it again for our honeymoon this April. The location is superb, when you like to experience the less touristy, but buzzing and creative Lower East Side. We walked whereever we wanted to go to and the streets in the LES are filled with great restaurants and bars (Schiller, Kampuchea (!) Enoteca, Living room to name just a few.) My partner had asked the front desk at the time of booking whether we could have the highest possible room (we booked a High corner with soaking tub). When we arrived, they gave us the lowest possible room (the view was still good) and said they couldnt change it for at least three days, which was disappointing, but they sorted it at the end of our stay and we stayed on the 14th floor, which we LOVED. The views are spectacular. The rooms are spacious, the bathrooms amazing, the amenities plentyful and eveything was always very clean, showing a bit of wear (chipped furniture), which was fine, but they will hopefully have sorted this by now. We loved the tempura mattresses so much that we bought one for home.The view from the 12th floor up takes your breath away, the parties (with hot tub) on the roof on Sunday afternoons were great. The restaurant is good, but it wasnt amazing. We had breakfast included, but only made use of it once. Its fine, very standard continental, but there are so many great coffee and bagel places around we preferred. Im a tiny bit nervous about people writing about bed bugs, I do hope that these were just people trying to take revenge for an unusally unsatifying experience. We are definetely looking forward to a romantic honeymoon at the Rivington!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: TMercogliano
Reviews.Content: I went here with my husband for a weekend get-a-way and it was worth it 100% The views are breathtaking! Especially at night or sunset. The room was spotless and was very welcoming, the bathrooms were very modern and I loved it! We did not want to go home! We will most def. be returning and letting friends and family know of this fabulous hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: waters62
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at Hotel on Rivington again and each time gets better. I have never stayed in the same room twice and I love how all the bathrooms are different. The beds are very comfortable and I love the views! The staff is extremely helpful. They always have such good recommendations on where to eat and what to do. You don't even need to leave the LES there are so many good places to eat and have drinks. Check out Economy candy across the street and Sugar Sweet Sunshine (cupcake place) if you have a sweet tooth. Already looking forward to my next trip to the city!!

Reviews.Title: “this is a disco with a Hotel in it!”
Reviews.Author: InesLopes
Reviews.Content: The hotel was much better on the internet than it was live! It has seen better days, the lifts smell of weed, and are surprisingly grubby compared to the rest of the hotel. First they gave us a 6th floor room, but it had no view, so we've changed to the 3rd floor, front view room. The room was very soothing, comfortable bed and spectacular bathroom with steam shower and amazing bathtub. Very cool. However, from midnight to 6:30 a.m. there was constant shouting, horn honking and blaring music. Terrible. The hotel has a club on the ground floor, and it's opened the whole night! The bedroom floor shakes, the bed vibrates.... It's like trying to sleep on a nightclub.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT for me”
Reviews.Author: bertha69
Reviews.Content: I loved this place the only bad thing was that i was travelling on a business and this hotel is all about pleasure! So here is my trip: Arrived from the UK on a late flight so didn't get to the hotel until around 10.30pm i could instantly tell the hotel was about fun as Thor was buzzing (the restaurant / bar at street level), we were greeted by the 'door man' who was really friendly and took our luggage straight away). NOW here is a note to management - I hate uniforms, too stuffy, but i was slightly concerned that the 'door man' was really employed by the hotel and was a little concerned with leaving my bags on the street, no reflection on him as he was great, but maybe a badge or something? Headed to the first floor where the staff were friendly and check-in was quick and easy on to the room. Yes the corridors are dark (very dark), then i walked in to my room on the 18th floor and i realised why - THE VIEW is AMAZING - yes i'm shouting you walk in to this room and the lights of the NYC skyline are amazing! As for the room, very clean,very big, massive closet, big bed (mattress too firm for me, but that is just my preference), free wi-fi (I hate paying for wi-fi) then i walked in to my "oversize corner bathroom with soaking tub" OMG AMAZING - so half frosted glass and half clear glass with slate floors open shower - i just loved the space (they even provide candles in the bathroom). Now as for location - The area is a real "locals" area so if you want tourist NYC this is not the hotel for you, if you want to live and party like a new yorker it is for you!! Things to note: This is not a hotel to relax in, head here for the real NYC, head here to party and if you book a room below floor 15 on a weekend i expect you won't get much sleep! (that is the only reason i scored 3 for sleep quality) I can't wait to head back on a trip that is 100% pleasure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, hip but customer service is lacking”
Reviews.Author: Lubran
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel because of the location, which was close to a wedding location. The room was spacious and the noise level was acceptable. Unfortunately I left an expensive fountain pen in the room and after multiple attempts to notify the hotel's lost and found department (as well as the hotel manager) I never received a return phone call.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs!”
Reviews.Author: hummingbirdface
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for five days, and when I returned home I had a bedbugs with me. Check out the bedbug registry. This place is infested. Beware.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, modern, great views from great rooms”
Reviews.Author: d0gtanian
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through virgin hip hotels. When we arrived they didn't Know about our booking, but after a 10 minute wait, the issue was resolved and we had our high floor with soaking tub room set. The reception Setup is odd and is not on the ground floor. The lobby area on the ground floor is confusing and it is almost a confused bar or club as you walk through the main entrance. The door staff were more interested in texting on their phones than opening the door for you - which they are paid to do. Customer service at the hotel desk lacked a little, I did at one point ask a staff member to fetch a taxi upon our departure. I was told it's a busy day and I would have to go down to do that myself. Having said that the actual hotel room was fantastic. Modern, fresh, and had the best bed I have ever slept in. I even checked the mattess as I was so impressed. FYI it was a Temper mattress - ads on tv talk about it being used by NASA in the past. The soaking tub was massive, and kind of felt guilty filling it up to the top using up so much water...! But it was lovely, candles and toiletries ready and waiting. There was also a walk in shower with floor to ceiling windows so you can shower whilst watching New York! (bottom half was frosted glass!! Mini bar extortionate but expected, free wifi - good speeds, No tea/coffee making facilities a little bit of a shame - especially for us Brits. On one occasion we had room service breakfast in bed which was fantastic, beautifully presented and a real treat. Housekeeping was perfect, those guys work like troopers and the room was always spotless when we returned after our days out. Best cleanliness in a hotel room i've ever experienced. They would leave freshly baked cookies and treats in the room for your return. Location of hotel is pretty good, in the lower east side. Subway v close by with some really good shops on broadway street a few blocks away. Bear in mind that this hotel doesn't exactly have all the attractions on the doorstep however like some others. My feet were killing me after 4 days! For a more central location, consider times square area. Breakfast was continental and fairly basic, cheap though at $5 with a coffee however we ate out most days. Checkout time was midday which was nice as wasn't really clock watching, however front desk staff didn't ask how our stay was, we could have given some valuable feedback to you guys! Overall a really chic trendy hotel, fab room and lovely views, service needs touching up at reception, but housekeeping spot on, you are out most of the day in New York anyway, so most important thing is the room ultimately which was great and faultless.

Reviews.Title: “Worn down”
Reviews.Author: fromtoronto8
Reviews.Content: Rooms are needing update. Very noisy at night from street. Amenities are sub par. 2nd time staying here...last time was 2008. Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fine. Not great, not awful. But for the price I'd expect more.”
Reviews.Author: ebrable
Reviews.Content: Good points: Great location, good views, close to subway. Extremely comfy bed, good black-out blinds. Good shower, although warm rather than hot, with nice view. Staff were helpful, if a tad too cool for school (but hey, it's a design hotel!). List of good local restaurants was spot on. Bad points: Room a bit shabby. Could do with some TLC. Noisy, could hear room above us. Hole at bottom of door meant you could hear everything in the hall. Some irritating 'form over function' features; ridiculous sink, nowhere to hang coats, very minimal lighting. Basically, it's perfectly fine. Nice even. But for $340 a night (inc. taxes) you expect something a bit special, which this place just isn't.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you like to sleep at night”
Reviews.Author: achapstick
Reviews.Content: I was excited to get a good rate on this hotel, which I've wanted to try for a long time. It is very contemporary.
