The room was very soothing, comfortable bed and spectacular bathroom with steam shower and amazing bathtub. Very cool. However, we were on the 3rd floor and from midnight to 4:30 a.m. there was constant shouting, horn honking and blaring music. Terrible. And no warning about this from the front desk staff in advance. Perhaps on a much higher floor things would have been better, but given that the staff didn't even seem to care how our stay was when we checked out, we won't bother to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Some of the best views of NYC in a cool and comfortable place”
Reviews.Author: eltyUK
Reviews.Content: I always love visiting New York City and rarely find much to complain about when I stay, so perhaps my opinions are biased. On my most recent trip, together with my wife, we opted to stay in the Lower East Side. For those who donâ€™t know Manhattan, the LES is a bit more gritty than other parts of town. Itâ€™s a good 10-15 minute stroll from more bustling parts like Soho. Itâ€™s considered an â€˜edgyâ€™ part of NY, with plenty of thrift stores, antique & art galleries, cafes and fashion boutiques. If this is your thing then the Hotel on Rivington might be a good place to stay. By far and away the best thing about Hotel on Rivington are the views. If you get a room high enough (we had a corner king with balcony on the 18th floor and loved it) the views over Manhattan are spectacular. In fact waking up and seeing the sun rise of this part of New York is something to behold. The rooms are nice. General style is modern and decor is overall pretty slick. All rooms have floor to ceiling glass windows hence the great views of the city. There is plenty of wardrobe space and spacious room. The bathrooms are quite special with the floor to ceiling glass windows continuing into the shower (perhaps not great for the very shy). Our room also had a very large soaking tub, complete with candles and matches. The beds were extremely comfortable. A fantastic night sleep was had (this despite the relentless hustle and bustle of NY streets 18 floors below us). Breakfast was not the greatest I have ever had. The continental breakfast comprised bagels, toast with a choice of cream cheese or jam and fruit, but it was not very well organised. Likewise I was not overly impressed with the level of service - there was at least two occasions we asked for something to be done and it was totally ignored. A personal gripe of mine. In summary though, I would say a stay at Hotel on Rivington was probably worth it. Itâ€™s not the cheapest place to visit but hey, neither is anywhere in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Over-Rated! Give me a break!”
Reviews.Author: Syracuse_Hotels
Reviews.Content: This is my first time ever commenting on a horrible experience at a hotel but I feel like the reviews of this hotel are giving people the wrong idea. Here are my issue. #1 Unless you are a circus freak the rooms are 300 sq ft too small with old banged up furniture. #2 After pulling up the sheets I saw about 20 black pubic hairs on the brick mattress. #3 The website? Really? Reallllllly? These photos make this place look nicer than the the Ritz, spoiler it's not.... Whoever photoshopped these images could make my grandmas living room look great for the homepage of design and architecture, give me a break. #4 This place is banged up... With a nasty stained red carpet pulled up the lobby, tiny 12 inch TV's, and weird staff, I can tell you as I still sit at this hotel it's not worth your time. I'd rather stay in times square, and I HATE times square.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the View & the Area!”
Reviews.Author: cocacolacub
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights on the 16th floor - in a Corner King Room over the New Year period. The choice of hotel was based on us wanting a change from the main tourist areas of mid town and we were not disappointed. The location is in an up and coming area - meaning a great bar or restaurant could be located next to somewhere less desirable... it reminded me of the MeatPacking district of 5 years ago. You have to be a bit more 'on guard' as there are plenty of the less well off in the area and we were hassled a couple of times for a 'few dollars'. Hotel room was very good and would recommend for the great view and unusual layout of the room.. slept very well but did take the 'ear plugs' and they were needed! I would be happy to answer any questions if you want me to! All in all good hotel, good location and something a bit different that the razamatazz of times square.

Reviews.Title: “Q: How many bar staff does it take to serve a drink?”
Reviews.Author: censington
Reviews.Content: At the Hotel on Rivington the answer is more than five. There are lots of bad things about this hotel. The bar staff don't seem to have been told that they are there to serve customers. Having been ignored for some minutes at the bar by five staff, when one of them left the bar and walked passed me I asked him for some drinks. He told me to wait at the bar. I told him I'd been doing that and suggested he go back and get the drinks. He didn't seem to find this a reasonable suggestion and so did so with bad grace. The doormen display the same attitude. The room service staff are a bit better, although they are let down by the food they deliver. It would seem reasonable that if you order some food that is what will arrive. Something else probably will. Something that isn't even on the menu on one occasion. And if the food should be hot, don't expect that it will be. And if you don't order a wake up call in the early hours, don't assume you you won't receive one. On realising the caller has called the wrong room, don't expect an apology either. Expect him to laugh instead. Don't expect the furniture to be clean either. It's in an interesting part of town but the hotel's a triumph of slightly dated style over substance. On the plus side, if you have a room on a high floor, the views are great but that, along with it's location and good beds are about it. I had some meetings with some contemporary art dealers at the front of the bar. They are a discerning bunch who viewed the place with a cross between amusement and mild horror. I often thought complain but there were so many things wrong I'd have been doing so constantly and the staff really couldn't care less so I wonder what the point would be. I just won't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised after reading all previous reviews....”
Reviews.Author: AmberKnows
Reviews.Content: and I am thee most picky hotel guest ever as I work in the hospitality industry for one of the world's richest people - so you can imagine my standards are very high. The bell men were super friendly and helpful, the reception desk staff were OK although hardly friendly, the room was huge and light and airy with good linen on a super comfy bed. The bathroom was fun - clean and full of little touches that make a hotel nice (candles and matches, decent lotion and haircare products). The view was real NYC and it was quiet where we were (12th floor, looking south). Sure the hallways were dark - but if that's the only problem then it's a great hotel. For the price of NYC the room we had off a "travel bargin" type website was a steal and I gladly would pay that price again and stay there again. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but a little loud”
Reviews.Author: Tibbygirl
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for one night, but it was a lovely hotel! Pros: >Great location â€“ close enough to walk to Soho and great stuff on the lower east side >Beautiful room >Stunning view! >Window in the shower. I canâ€™t say enough how wonderful that is. And it opens. So, when youâ€™re showing and its 60 degrees outside and sunny, it is one of the most relaxing things in the world! Cons: >Noise â€“ Weâ€™re not sure where it was coming from but it was noisy ALL night long. Iâ€™m used to typical NYC noise, but this went beyond that. >Mini-bar prices were extravagant >The bellhop when we left was not helpful. We had left our bags there for the day since our flight was not until 8pm and we stood in the lobby for 10 minutes waiting for help. The bellhop passed us several times and ignored us when we tried to get his attention and then went on his break.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Amazing room! But...bring a flashlight with you!”
Reviews.Author: TOinTO
Reviews.Content: The service is amazing and the room is fantastic. The hotel staff are friendly and accommodating, for the most part. The hotel is located in the lower Eastside - older part of NYC. There are some hidden gems of restaurants that I stumbled across as I wandered the streets. I arrived at the hotel on a Friday night at 9 pm to be ushered passed a hip and trendy bar/lounge filled with a bunch of young twenty something wannabees who want to be a part of the trendy NYC party scene. The first thing I noticed, as I waited for the elevator to take me to the 2nd floor where guest services is located, was how dark or "dimly lit" the hallways and guest services area were. To my surprise so were the hallways on the floor were my room was located. I actually had to use my Iphone to provide extra light to gain access to my room. If you have poor night vision, I'd recommend bringing a flashlight with you if you're going to stay here. The room is fantastic! Large by NYC hotel standards with floor to ceiling windows. I would think the view would be amazing, but, unfortunately, the corner room I requested was below the 12th floor and I looked onto the roof tops of the buildings below and a limited skyline of NYC. My only complaint about this hotel was the noise - not from the hotel but from the surrounding area. When the clubs and lounges empty out at 3 or 4 in the morning, there's a lot of yelling of patrons and honking of horns by passing cars. Wish I had brought my ear plugs. Definitely a cool and trendy hotel....just bring a few extras (flashlight and ear plugs).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, no customer care”
Reviews.Author: SmashleySimpson
Reviews.Content: I stay at the hotel for a whole week. While the position is simply stunning (you gotta love the Lower East Side!) and the roomas are great, the customer service of the hotel is poor to say the least. The problems are the following: 1) the reception NOT being on the ground floor 2) the unfriendliness of the the doormen 3) the awful bar on the ground floor 4) the breakfast and waiters So here's my experience. The staff at the front desk is polite. I asked for a different room, even offering to pay more, but they gave me a free upgrade. Besides this, even though I stayed for a full week, their attitude wasn't anywhere close to "friendly". Also, no one takes your suitcases upstairs, when you get to the hotel. Which I find rather odd considering the price of the rooms, not very far from those of the most famous 5 star Manhattan hotels such as The Plaza or The Pierre. 1) so, the fact the front desk isn't on the ground floor means the doormen are perfectly unguarded and can act how they see fit. If you need to go to the airport, they will try to get you in a "private car" (not a cab, or a black car) that'll take you there. And the minute you say you'd rather take a cab (especially if you're a woman travelling by herself) they'll start being seriously rude and basically, insisting you do what they say. I don't know what's up with that. I found it most unpleasant. 2) the bar, The Feast I think it's called, gets seriously crowded on weekends, to the point that if you get back at 3 am you have a hard time getting to the elevator. Also, depening on your personal taste you might find the crowd terrible. It's mostly drunk twenty year olds. The music? Super loud dance tunes. The good thing is that if your room floor is high enough (I was at the 7th) you won't be bothered at all. 3) the breakfast id BAD. Especially if you are in for a long stay like I was. They basically have only bagels, boxed cream cheese and a few croissants. If you want orange juice you have to ask for it: it's free, but you still have to ask for it and the waiters barely speak any english (though most of them are pretty nice). What's preyy annoying, though, is the "a la carte" service: the choices are quite limited, but most of all the dishes come after 20 minutes you ordered and won't respect your order. I asked thrice for running yolks eggs and three times I got them hard boiled (I eventually sent them back, the third time). On the bright side, and to be fair, I must say that the rooms and large, well furnished and extra-clean. For one, the maids are precise - even if they still knock even if there's a "do not disturb" sign. Still, I will totally choose some other accomodation when I travel back to the fabulous NYC.

Reviews.Title: “I had a blast with my friends at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: always_economy_class
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay in the lower east side with my friends. This hotel was recommended and I paid more to get a higher floor with a corner balcony. It was a wonderful experience. I have no idea if this was too pricey or not but the balcony, the windows, the beautiful huge bed, the skyline, the huge bathroom and so on seemed worth it to me. When I came back late one night, I was surprised that the hotel entrance had become a entrance for some sort of club event. Tape was up and there was a line of people waiting to get in. My hands were full and I was so pleased when the person at the tape said "Welcome back" and put the tape down. I have the impression they have some sort of roof top club but never checked it out. I was too busy. The restaurant and the bar on the first floor were wonderful. I even ordered desert. I don't want to think about my bar bill. I loved the light that came into the room. My friends enjoyed it too. At night, the rooftops seem to be pretty busy. Being in the Lower East Side enabled us to walk everywhere. Gotta love New York.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Views”
Reviews.Author: rawspaws
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights to celebrate our 35th Wedding Anniversary and my 55th birthday. We booked a corner king with balcony and requested a view of uptown and the Empire State Building. We were not let down. The views were amazing. We woke up to views to die for and went to sleep with the Manhatten lit up like a Christmas tree! Wonderful. Easy access to the tube, cabs on tap and easy access to everywhere. The complementary buffet breakfast was well appreciated. The only downside was that we wished we were 20 years younger as the hotel and surrounding area comes alive at weekends with busy bars, clubs and restaurants. We found all of the staff to be very helpful, the rooms clean, the mini bar outstanding. A great hotel for the 20 to 30 somethings and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “amazing view and beds”
Reviews.Author: fluffnalf
Reviews.Content: the hotel on rivington had the most comftable bed i have ever slept in .myself and my husband stayed her for one night on the last night of our honeymoon. the veiws are amazing seeing the skyline while lying in bed is a sight we will never forget. we think it was a little expensive for what you get .though the quirky touches really made it stand out. staff were quite aloof and a few minor maintence issues hadnt been fixed broken lamp etc.

Reviews.Title: “View and room outstanding”
Reviews.Author: N-Laporte
Reviews.Content: Plus: - Large corner suite high floor with the japanese soak tub. Impressive view over the city. Service great. Minus: - Breakfast: could offer more choice

Reviews.Title: “Minimalist vs the view”
Reviews.Author: MoniqueH2
Reviews.Content: The hotel was interesting. Very unique design, minimalist, modern. But so minimalist there were no towel bars in the bathroom, and no hand rails for my Mom. Hallways were all black, great looking, but dark dark dark. Could barely find our door. Rooms were very efficient, all the closests, drawers, TV were in a single wall unit which was very nice. A little sitting area with a sofa, nice and comfy. So not very elderly friendly, and definitely not traditional in any way. The staff was helpful, though the doormen were even more so. And the view, well thats why you stay here. The lower east side may be a mixed bag neighborhood wise, but every room had a spectacular view out over the city. Ours included the Empire State building.

Reviews.Title: “Old friend but the noise on the weekends has become intolerable, particularly when its warm outside”
Reviews.Author: Sidewalk7Records
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this at 4am from the 10th floor. I first came to the HOR in 2005 before it opened, always taking the same room on the 18th floor, staying approx 2 or 3 times a year. Since then the hotel have always been very helpful and I always enjoyed the service / views etc. I don't know if its because I haven't been here during the sunny season, most trips falling when you'd probably rather not be outside - or perhaps I used to stay out until dawn - but I have found that the past two nights ie weekend nights, have been OUTRAGEOUSLY noisy. Every 30 seconds a car horn honks, then a revving motorbike, now a car playing lauren hill at stadium levels (no joke), howling, screaming - its total carnage. I'm seriously not overreacting either, a little noise is fine but this is insane. I'd be intrigued to know if the hotel is talking with the police about the car honking, the bars about controlling their patrons outside the door w their doormen, and maybe even their architects about triple glazing the rooms - what a shame. The only consolation, some earplugs, I'm going to be talking to them in the morning and requesting a refund, I'll let you know how I get on. Otherwise this is a cool place.

Reviews.Title: “Rivington”
Reviews.Author: acylin
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean on lower East side. Stayed at the 15th floor, nice view over Empire State Building

Reviews.Title: “Comfort with a Spectacular View!”
Reviews.Author: reservations07
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel on Rivington 4 times now, so I think that establishes some credibility, and let me say that the view is...spectacular. It is the tallest building in the area. I actually didn't want to close my eyes to go to sleep. I just wanted to stare at the beautiful nighttime view of uptown Manhattan. But the beds are the most comfortable I have ever slept in and I always seem to drift right off to sleep. They are all King-Sized and Tempur-Pedic mattresses. In the morning we had the continental breakfast which is very inexpensive ($5 per person) and includes freshly baked muffins with blueberries AND raspberries that came right out of the oven. MmmmmmmMMM! The staff is always cheerful and professional and the concierge service is top notch. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and CANT WAIT to get back to my view among the clouds... --Charlotte West

Reviews.Title: “go high or go home”
Reviews.Author: neilsonparc
Reviews.Content: one of the great selling points of Hotel on Rivington is the floor to ceiling views - you do not want to be on one of the lower floors - we had to upgrade to get to level 12 and i would recommend that you do the same if you find yourself on the lower floors. .. the bathrooms are a highlight, as is the bar and happy hour. Breakfast was a bit of a let down - some fruit juice would have been appreciated after the previous evening's libations. Still, Hotel on Rivington still earns itself a 'Pink' on the neilsonparc Lust List.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel - although needs a bit of TLC...”
Reviews.Author: takenover123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Rivington on our wedding night. We were upgraded to a corner King room with balcony which was fanastic - boasting an incredible 180 degree view of New York . The rooms are huge - far larger than you would normally expect from NY. The hotel itself however does need a bit of TLC. The carpets were a bit stained, the walls needed a splash of new paint, and the service was underwhelming. For the price I expected a little better - but all of this could be sorted easily if they spend a bit of money updating it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jimmymuldo
Reviews.Content: My colleagues and I stayed at the Hotel On Rivington twice this summer. The rooms are excellent, the beds were super comfortable, and we got an upgrade on the first trip. The shower facing outside was a bit disconcerting at first but it was actually really nice to have the view. On the second stay my room faced west with amazing views of the Manhattan skyline and the sunset. The location is great, walking distance to Soho and Tribeca, and the Lower East Side has loads of cool places to discover on the doorstep of the hotel. its really easy to get a taxi outside and there is a subway station round the corner. The nightclub atmosphere downstairs is good if you like that kind of thing but I mostly avoided the restaurant as it felt a bit grubby and there are plenty of great places to eat within a block. I loved this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and spacious”
Reviews.Author: Moranbahtravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in June 2010 and loved it. I found this hotel via trip advisor due to the great reviews and am glad I did. The rooms were spacious and comfortable (we had a corner king) and we loved lying in bed looking at the city from all directions...the view was amazing. The only downside was the lack of a bath but that is nothing really to complain about. The staff were fantastic and organised dinners and even assisted with my birthday suprises from friends in Australia so that was hightly appreciated. There is a "groovy" bar/restaurant downstairs which has the BEST sliders I've ever eaten (I didn't even know what a slider was until we got there) and the hairdresser next door was great as well. The hotel is a little hard to find when you first pull up in the taxi, just look for the door men next to the bar and get into the lift for the 2nd floor and you will be fine. The lower east side seems to be a great place to be and is central to everything which we loved. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, spacious hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnnaBenji
Reviews.Content: We moved here after checking out of our original hotel - Hotel East Houston, 2 nights into our 5 night stay due to the tiny room and lack of style. We were very happy with our decision. The room was almost twice the size, very funky in decor, had a small lounge area with couch and coffee table, a whole wall of wardrobes, automated blinds that you opened from your bed which provided a nice view of the New York skyline, a great bathroom which was grey and silver with double shower and japanese tub and every night there was a turndown service with a different type of sweet example brownies. Although the room rate did not include breakfast like Hotel East Houston, it was $10 cheaper. The Lower East side area is a little gritty and sometimes a little confronting so might not be to eveyone's liking but great bars and restaurants like Stanton Social Club are close by, subway is around the corner, it is close to great areas like NoLita (Elizabeth St is great) and Soho.

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyed The Rivington”
Reviews.Author: Alto3
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights with my son as a 21st Birthday treat for him. We had a high corner king each. He was on the 19th floor and I was just below him on the 18th. The rooms were clean, bright and comfortable. Loved the views although I felt nervous standing on my balcony - it was so high up. The treats left at night were lovely and one night I had the nicest chocolate brownie I ever ate. I liked the idea that reception was on the 2nd floor - you have to walk in to the bar/restaurant Thor from the street to access the lifts to reception and the rooms. Unlike the Thompson LES in which I've stayed twice, there was no one fussing every time you stepped in or out which can get annoying. Unfortunately we never got to try out the rooftop bar as there was a wedding on there on our last night when we went to try it so that was private. My son tried the hotel club CV and enjoyed his night there. No noise problems whatsoever and we both slept soundly every night. I'd definitely go back again as opposed to the Thompson which seems dark in comparison. The LES is definitely not for anyone over 30 though which is why if I'm with people my own age group the next time I'll probably try another neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Sensational NYC experience”
Reviews.Author: Greedypig73
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights in May 2010. Had a fabulous room on the 5th floor, looking out onto the backyard (not a fab view, but an interesting one, watching a little old lady watering her vegie patch in the middle of the city!). I think the rooms facing the back would be less noisy than those facing the front as the front street is quite busy. We thought the location was fantastic - LES is a great combination of trendy, clubby, arty and grungy. Plenty of bars, restaurants and coffee around and very close to the subway. Also easy walking distance to Soho, Little Italy and East Village. Beds, as everyone has said, are AMAZING. The room was huge, clean and quite well appointed. Unlike some, we had loads of hanging space, a couch and coffee table in the room, a funky bathroon with powerful, hot shower and we loved the bakery treats every night! Would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to everyone. Perhaps just check what room you are getting in advance, as it sounds like lots of people had a different layout, which may not have been as great as ours was.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful surprise and i definately will be back”
Reviews.Author: nelyp
Reviews.Content: this was my first stay at the hotel and I had an extended 15 days stay at the hotel in the regular king room on the 8th floor facing the opposite building, not much of a view but i wasnt in new york to stay in my room 24/7. Firstly i arrived after a 25 hour journey so it was good to meet friendly staff and as soon as i landed on the bed, i was sound asleep. normally im a fussy when it comes to beds because i cant sleep well unless its my own bed at home but the tempur medic? or pedic?matresses here were AMAZING. the room wasnt huge but its relative to what you would expect at the hilton or sheraton etc but lets face it, you are not in new york to spend time in a hotel room. the bathroom was a normal shower head over bathtub and at first the water was lukewarm and i spoke to reception and they sent an engineer to fix it and it was hot, but days later it went from hot to lukewarm again... luckily new york was 85+ degrees so it sorta didnt matter. the ceiling also peeled away because of the steam from the showers obviously but as soon as i alerted reception, they had someone come and plaster it. the staff are very very friendly, the housekeeping staff drop by every afternoon with cookies and other delights... its a nice touch. the hotel's downstairs restaurant turns club towards the end of the week and weekend, but i did not hear any noise at all from the 8th floor and ive stayed at expensive hotels and heard noises on the 20th floor. there was also a small gym which had the right equipment, it kept my fitness routine in synch so i didnt feel like i abandoned my workout regime. there is also the free wifi internet, which wasnt as fast as i thought it would be, but i think guests use it download big files so thats why it slowed down the speed for the rest of us. now for the location, it was like the twilight zone. the lower east side goes from chic, trendy to albania and all it takes is to cross the road. but this hotel is perfectly located in the middle of everything, it leisure walking distance like 5-10 minutes from little italy and chinatown and soho, so there was no need to take a taxi anywhere (unlike staying at the midtown) for dinner because the food choices were endless and cheap! nearby there is a balinese and cambodian pub restaurant which serves good food and were reasonably price. and mikeys burger when you feel peckish. when i felt like a gelati id walk to little italy and my dumpling cravings were subdued with a short walk to chinatown. this was a great place, nothing went wrong in the 15 days i was there. and id stay there again if i can get a good deal :)

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Breakfastmanager
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the lower east side, in walking distance to the subway, SoHo and a lots of restaurants and bars in this pulsing part of Manhattan. The room was clean and quiet and comfortable. The mini-bar selection was great, better than anything I have ever experienced in other hotels. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the lobby-bar was a hotspot at night. A lots of little bars, restaurants and diners around the corner made it easy to find a breakfast or dinner in walking distance. I would say the hotel is perfect located to explore Manhattan by feet if you like to walk around a little bit. We had a basic room with backyard view, which was the only "negative" thing about the hotel but it was quiet at night because street-side located rooms might be a little more noisy as it is a nightlife area. If you book a higher category you might get the rooms in higher level with a nice city view. Up to you, we didn't need it as we were out all day and only in the hotel for sleeping at night.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly comfortable bed, but room function is compromised by style”
Reviews.Author: Opelle
Reviews.Content: Very trendy hotel with an incredibly comfortable mattress that just moulded to my body...however, the room was style over function: there were no hooks to hang a gown or a towel, and no mirror in the room (ony one in the bathroom, where you were lit by an orange glow). Lovely shower; huge square trendy sink, which meant you couldn't fill it deep, proving it difficult to shave. Room very spacious. I was disappointed by the lack of complimentary extras - apart from the cookie we got every evening, everything extra (e.g. gowns, adaptor plug) had a charge. No tea or coffee facilities in the room. Our 5am wake-up call never happened. But it's in a great spot (lower east side), near the fabulous east village, and in the heart of all the bars and restaurants. Lively area. Did get very noisy in the hotel one night (there is a club/bar on the second floor) but we otherwise slept really well.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: cassandraPerth
Reviews.Content: Hotel on Rivington was the best hotel I stayed in across America. The service was exceptional and the team were friendly, accommodating and went out of their way to help with any queries. The staff can not do enough for you. The suite was very comfortable and roomy and the bed was a delight. The bathrooms are funky and products luscious. Each evening a delightful treat is left in your room. The location is close to the subway and cabs are always ready available, you are walking distance to all good shopping on Broadway and in Soho. The funky Thor bar is cool to hang out in and meet new people, plus the food is great. Hotel on Rivington put the rest of my hotel experiences too shame.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay for location and views”
Reviews.Author: realityczech
Reviews.Content: First off, negative points. 1. Putting reception on the second floor seems daft. The whole layout of this hotel is odd as the ground floor bar/club/restaurant takes presidence and the hotel seems to be an after thought stacked on top. 2. Getting guaranteed great views of Manhatten is hit or miss. Even if you book a Suite. The Suites are badly designed ( bathrooms being located in the middle of the suites thus breaking up the flow of the rooms,making them feel dark,cramped and pokey ) and feel smaller than the ( less expensive!!!! ) Corner Kings which had a better view of Manhatten. 3.Don't expect a good room if you book via a 3rd party site as the hotel prioritizes guests who book direct. 4. Shower drain was blocked ( we read this on a very old review too - so they have not sorted this issue ) down lights were blown and taps leaked from their wall sockets!! 5.It's cheaky to put two small Evian bottles by the sink in the bathroom and then place a small card stating they cost $4 each!! We drank 2 days worth until we realized we had to pay for them. Drinks in the minibar is understood to cost money, but drinks left by the sink in the bathroom is a bit crafty. Plus points. 1. They moved us from our expensive suite overlooking some graffiti on the 8th floor after 2 nights and placed us on a 15th floor Suite. The views were simply magical. Watching Manhatten light up as the sun went down was unforgettable. Highly recommended. 2. Personally, i liked the Dub music they played in the lifts. I understand that this point is totally irrelevant to people who do not like Dub music.But hey ho. 3. Location was fantastic. LES is very much like Hoxton in London. Great vibe and gritty while being totally safe ( the whole of Manhatten felt safe and we never saw or heard trouble anywhere - in fact it felt way better than London ). So many cool bars,restaurants and places to go near by. Highly recommend breakfast round the corner at 88 Orchard St. You will love it.The hotel does $5 breakfasts which we never had.Cheap but i suppose ya get what ya pay for........ Over all the Rivington is a cool hotel more suited to the younger crowd and having said all the above, we are planning on staying there again as the whole NY experience was great. We checked out the Gansevoort Hotel a few times and found the roof top bar staff too cool for school and rude, which we never experienced at the Rivington. So i would recommend this hotel if you want that highrise NYC experience in a slightly trying too cool kinda way.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: suzzy230
Reviews.Content: This is a very unique hotel. When the cab driver first pulled up, I couldn't tell it was a hotel - it made me very nervous. Once in, I was a little confused on how to get to the front desk. Once I got to my room, it was pretty nice. Its a unique hotel with very different amenities, but definitely an experience. The restaurant at breakfast was a lovely experience. Great ambiance! The internet was horrible though - very slow!

Reviews.Title: “Super Accommodation in an Off-Beat part of Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyFiasco
Reviews.Content: Being a hotel designer, I unfortunately know the history behind this hotel. Mr Wanders came on board halfway through the development of this hotel and unfortunately it shows. Nevertheless, fantastic design development for the Lower East Side of Manhattan (possibly the only 'designer' icon on Rivington Street...). Black sanitaryware is unfortunately a no-no. FANTASTIC steam shower !!! HIGHLY recommended !! LOADS of cupboard space. FABULOUS mini-bar. Spacious rooms. OK views. Maintenance not up to scratch. Please note that 'do not disturb' means nothing to these people : They will still enter your room and check your mini-bar & room even if you have expressly indicated that you are 'not to be disturbed'. The bar downstairs is very trendy & well occupied. It is very disturbing however to have to explain to the bouncer every time that you leave the hotel that you are actually a guest. Ridiculous ! (since reception is on the first floor). Being treated like a 'nobody' everytime you get back to the hotel is a serious problem. At a rate of $300 per night, I would at least expect to be recognised ! Otherwise, the hotel is OK : general maintenance needs attention. Rooms are great. More of a business hotel than a holiday hotel. Nevertheless : great value & adequate service.

Reviews.Title: “v hip. v trendy. v good”
Reviews.Author: smoothie78
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fantastic: very media but great. I proposed to my girlfriend on the balcony overlooking Manhattan and it was so special. It took me a long time to find a hotel with a balcony that overlooked the Empire State Building that you could have a glass of champagne on, but this did just that â€“ thanks to Mr and Mrs Smith for helping me find it. Hotel itself is very hip and trendy. We stayed in a suite with all glass looking over empire state and x2 showers both which had glass to the floor which is a bit odd showering 20 floors up looking over Manhattan and anyone can look in!! It was really hot when we stayed and so there was a drinks do on the top floor with a big hot tub and bar which had incredible views of New York. If you walk out the hotel and turn left there is a great little cafÃ© owned by Moby on the right hand side called 'teany'. It's a cosy little place but really relaxing and cool.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel on Rivington...Ain't What it Used to Be”
Reviews.Author: kmackdeuber
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our fourth stay at the Hotel on Rivington and we were extremely disappointed in the hotel and the service we received. The hotel, which used to be one of the most interesting and trendy hotels in the country, was tired and dirty. The carpet was stained, the white sheets and towels were dull and the walls and furniture were filled with nicks and scuffs. The Lobby floors were scratched and the elevators and halls smelled of food and BO. While the room itself was large the heat was overpowering and we had to turn the air condition on in February. Also, we couldn't turn the hot water off in the shower and the hair dryer was broken. When we stayed at the hotel in the past it was very distinctive and the service made us feel like we were staying at a first-class hotel but also a hidden gem. During this stay it felt like just another hotel. It used to be no question as to where I would stay when visiting Manhattan. Now, while the location is ideal, I will think twice about staying the the Hotel on Rivington again.

Reviews.Title: “Special hotel in perfect neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: docsla
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading reviews on tripadvisor and are so happy with our choice. It was one of the few hotels near our sons apartment in Les NYC, so the choices were limited but this is a place we would rebook whenever in the city. It has modern decor, not our usual choice but very well done. The room was large with a large bathroom, beautiful glass tiles, modern sink . We were on the fifth floor with no noise, some prior persons said noise a problem. The kingsize bed had a heavenly mattress, like our posterpedic at home. The refrig in the room was the best stocked room bar we have ever seen with reasonable prices for Nyc hotel. We had the best eggs/ ben for Sat brunch at 13.00 each. During our many stays in Midtown we have never found such low prices. The small cafes, rest's, shops are great around the neighborhood. Lucky Jacks and Donnybrook are great Irish Pubs, worth making a stop. At Donnybrooks, try the Fish Pie it was out of this world good (an Irish MOM'S recpt). The best part of our stay here was the staff at the Hotel on Rivington, they were a very kind and professional group of people from the front door to the front desk as well as the persons serving in Thor's. We look forward to the next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room but the staff needs an attitude adjustment”
Reviews.Author: Alda428
Reviews.Content: The room was amazing but felt very un-welcomed by the staff. I travel for work and pleasure numerous times per month and have never encountered hotel employees like this. A "snooty, better than you" attitude filled the air...and even more so because I booked a discounted rate through this website, NYC.com. I would stay here again for the same discounted rate but would check out other options first.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy in LES”
Reviews.Author: g0ne-walkab0ut
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the Lower East Side (East of SoHo). There are lots of restaurants, bars & clubs(rock) on surrounding streets. Hotel is trendy, but not that hip, this is no Luxe Manor. Due to it's location, you would expect better sound proofing. From the 10th floor, I could hear the streets as if I was on ground floor, definitely not the Kitano. The rooms is quite small even for NYC, & not rather plain for such a trendy spot. Bed was tempurpedic (which I've since determined, I don't like). The black tiled bathroom, makes it feel smaller & even with the light at full brightness, was quite dark. You do have a great view though. If you're primarily staying around downtown (East Village, LES, NoLita, Chinatown, Tribeca, SoHo) & don't mind the noise it's a great location. The prices were about 20% too high in my opinion, I've stayed in larger rooms & as luxe hotels in NYC for lower prices. The staff were great, the doorman/valet was the friendliest I've ever dealt with in NYC. (Note: at night show you're key card to get past line for bar)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome leisure hotel; not recommended for business!”
Reviews.Author: DHM2006
Reviews.Content: Fab downtown location, convenient for bars, clubs and shopping. Cool bar downstairs. Lovely room, amazing steam shower room. Good food, friendly service, reasonable rates. Very loud late at night: I was there the night before Thanksgiving, the entire street was rocking, and I heard every last riff and chord. Six blocks from subway, although easy to get a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmbleGamble
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing, it is based Lower East Side near China Town and Little Italy and easy access to everything. We had a room with Soaking Tub and Balcony, we were on the 16th floor and had views out to Manhattan and Brooklyn Bridges. Our room was great, with the floor to ceiling glass windows giving great views of the sky scrapers! Loads of wardrobe space and spacious room. The bathroom was great with a shower looking out to NY (the floor to ceiling glass windows continue into the bathroom) and a soaking tub which was so big I could take a swim...they provided you with candles and matches and really did think about the little touches, with fresh cookies placed in your room every night. The bed was a memory foam mattress so made for a good night's sleep after a long day taking in the city. The conteniental breakfast was bagels, toast with a choice of cream cheese or jam and fruit, but it was a bit unorganised. Room service was great also, enjoyed the food in the hotel. Staff were not very attentive however, we asked three times for a folder that was meant to be in our room giving us details of the hotel and room service menu etc, we never recieved it. They also charged us twice!! Overall the hotel was great and the room was a haven from the 24hr madness that is the fabulous big apple!!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, toddler friendly, if a little off the beaten track”
Reviews.Author: LadyCaroOfEssex
Reviews.Content: Stayed over Christmas with my hubby and 1 year old little boy. Boy loved the lifts (danced to the cool music), the restaurant (long soft leather benches to run up and down), the views from our corner suite (we got upgraded - thanks!) and the big quiet lounge area with the pool table where he could run around to his heart's content. Hubby loved the decor (cool, chic and monochromatic), the bed (soooo comfy....some special type of bed that moulds and matches your body/temperature). I just loved being somewhere really cool, that made us all feel welcome in such an amazing city. It's a bit off the beaten track but only 10 mins walk to the centre of Soho and easy to get cabs further afield. Noisy? Not with our jet lag and comfy bed. Tired? Obvious it's not brand new but looks good. Amazing views? Don't expect views of glam Manhatten, it's a much more urban vibe. Recommended? Certainly.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, atmospheric and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: banksyuk17
Reviews.Content: My two daughters took me on this trip along with some friends and my little granddaughter of one years. There were six of us in total. We had a lovely trip and the hotel staff were so accommodating and friendly. They provided a lovely crib for my little granddaughter. My daughters love this part of town and there are so many eateries close by. I was babysitting a couple of evenings and had room service (lovely food) and watch TV while the little one was sleeping. The hotel is very buzzy in the evenings which makes it convenient if you don't want to go far for an atmospheric night out. Stylish decor in the restaurant and the restrooms - yes even the restroom! with some graphic artwork of hendrix and dylan to name just a couple! Thanks especially to Jeffrey and James who looked after us very well.

Reviews.Title: “So much wrong it's funny- but had a great time, in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Sworn2Fun
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rivington for five nights on a trip that was primarily business but also an opportunity to see friends (I'm a native NYer). First note: I got a great price on Quikbook, $219. I knew I would get a lower floor room at that rate & I understand the hotel is all about the upper floors. Still, it was in the heart of the "new" Lower East Side, and the rooms supposedly modern and nice. For $200 in NY that is enough! The hotel upgraded me to the 5th floor, which is still a lower floor, the main difference being that it looks at rooftops rather than brick walls. The room was good-sized, decent bed with ok sheets, nice modern bathroom, closets, couch & small table. The windows were wraparound and frosted up to waist level (this is about when I started snickering). They were covered by an automated curtain which was pretty well broken and had to be manhandled to open and close. The bathroom had a steam shower (that was part of the upgrade) and REN products, which are lovely. Now...how do I put this delicately?- there was a large picture window in the bathroom with no shade and no way of covering it, and for a male guest, well let's just say you would have a VERY difficult time not serving as entertainment for the building across the street. (This is when I really started to laugh. I call the place "Hotel Exhibitionist".) During my stay various lights burned out and so forth and were never fixed, eventually making the room nightclub-dark, which is the mood of the hallways and entrance. That was my biggest annoyance- total lack of upkeep. Wifi was that 24-hour deal that is constantly expiring & you need to call the desk for passwords. Kind of a drag. Don't remember if it was free or not. Service here is nonexistent, but it didn't really bother me. The doormen were too busy chatting to open doors or check who was going in and out of the hotel, and the only thing that stopped them talking to each other was when they stopped to flirt with me and my friends! I never once saw them hail a cab or grab a guest's bags. If I had expected service I'd be horrified, but having read TA reviews, I didn't expect a thing, so it just made me laugh. This hotel is NOT hip in the slightest, and it so wants to be that it's kinda sweet. How can I explain "not hip in the slightest"? Let's just say that the hot party while I was there was a "fashion show" put on by the hair salon next door, which seemed to be trying to re-enact "Jersey Girl". The lobby bar has attitude which is a little less amusing. All that said the location is FANTASTIC, near all the good LES restaurants and shopping. If I were dropping $500 a night I'd try to get a good rate at Gramercy Park or something, although the Riv high floor views are amazing, but for my two bills I was actually fairly happy with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Recommended”
Reviews.Author: letyaknow
Reviews.Content: We booked a block of rooms at this hotel for guests who were coming to NY for our wedding, including the room we stayed in on our wedding night. Our guests LOVED the "chicness" of the hotel, along with the location. It was also very easy to arrange the group booking and our overseas guests appreciated that they could book their rooms via email. I used our suite to get ready for the wedding--the lighting was fabulous (natural light from the wall to wall windows). The staff could not have been more accommodating to us and brought up whatever we requested within minutes (extra chairs, food, steamer, etc.). Our photographer also raved about the hotel for our photos. I would HIGHLY recommend The Hotel on Rivington.

Reviews.Title: “To cool to work!”
Reviews.Author: SmaggNY
Reviews.Content: I have never been in a hotel, where the staff if cooler and more stylish than the guests and to stylish to do there work. If you have a problem with the internet, you end up in a telephon hotline with voicemail for technical advice. Staff is not willing to help. A room high up might be appealing to you, but have in mind that they have clubbing in the hotel all weekend long... Nice basses at night...

Reviews.Title: “favorite Hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: heavyset
Reviews.Content: I have to travel to NYC for business a minimum of once a month. 3 months ago I had a friend recommend The Hotel on Rivington. I booked and was ecstatic. Clean rooms, attentive staff, convenient to everywhere i needed to go. I have returned every month since. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Grandepadre
Reviews.Content: If you want a fun, edgy place in the middle of it all, this hotel is the spot. Step outside and everything NYC that you could ever want is right there, and you can walk to even more amazing dining, coffee, and bars. The room we stayed in was incredible--they made the most of the small size, including beautifully hip bathrooms and amazing Temerpedic beds. After a hard day with clients and then hitting the bars with them, the Hotel on Rivington was the ideal place to come back to relax, and feel cool while doing it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: NY_LA09
Reviews.Content: Comparable to the standard downtown LA, maybe even a step up. Nice spacious room for NYC. Little extras like the lighting, high-end mattress steam bath in the shower really made the difference. If you like the neighborhood this is the place to be. However, that part of town can be noisy at night. My only recommendation would be to have bigger HD TVs, but we weren't there to watch TV anyways.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a view”
Reviews.Author: superinnie
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at noon and as our room wasn't ready yet (we were early!) we decided to first go and check out the surroundings. We came back in the evening (while it was already dark outside) and when entering the room we could only say 'wow'! We had a High Floor Corner King with balcony and this is really what I call 'A room with a view' . The view was amazing! By night but also by day. The rest of the hotel room was very nice too : 2 lounge chaires, tempur pedric matrass, a shower which was great,... an unforgettable experience!

Reviews.Title: “Edgy and exciting”
Reviews.Author: Vronny
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay if you want to see the real NYC. I love the edgy Lower East Side and my daily walk from the hotel to my conference venue in Greenwich Village took me through Little Italy, Chinatown and some really interesting old tenement areas. Not once, as a single female, did I feel intimidated or in danger - even walking back late at night... There are just sooo many people around and all of them really friendly. The hotel was different and the staff - particularly the doormen - were very helpful and friendly. The rooms are contemporary and well-equipped. The only thing missing in the extremely well stocked minibar were some earplugs... This is the city that never sleeps and this is the district where they do all their partying so prepare for a noisy, but thoroughly exciting stay!

Reviews.Title: “Worst customer service per $ EVER!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SpicesofLife
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pretty. The rooms are nice. Lobby is cool. However, the staff - from the bartenders at THOR, to the restaurant manager, to the reception desk attendants, to the worst of them all - the god awful woman who arranged a bulk room purchase for a wedding we were there for. terrible attitude at every step. "I tell this to everyone, even the celebrities who come here. You can not check in early without staying here the night before." Duh bit#h!!! I understand that when I make special requests they can not always be met, but at a hotel that charges $500 a night for a small, plain, no frills room - there is no need for this awful attitude. If I owned this hotel, I would send in a few spies and fire 75% of the staff as soon as possible. Its a recession - lets step up the service or lose out to China. Never again!!!! Would I recommend this hotel to a friend, no way. I only have a few enemies I'd recommend this one to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but.....”
Reviews.Author: thetraveller617
Reviews.Content: The hotel is definitely showing signs of wear and tear. The rooms are nice but could use some TLC, the furnishings, carpets and overall fixtures are not in the best shape. Housekeeping is also an issue, we were here for 5 days and 3 out of the 5 days we returned to our room after 4:00pm and the room was not cleaned or being cleaned which was very annoying. As someone who usually stays in boutique hotels it has been my experience that they usually start off great but tend to lose their momentum and unfortunately this seems to be the case here.

Reviews.Title: “sleepless and not compensated on Rivington”
Reviews.Author: Evelove
Reviews.Content: Floors 1 - 7 have no views. Bathrooms smell like vomit, but they supply candles. Our neighbors were throwing items off their balcony to the street below. Security was as loud if not louder than the drunken, dangerous guests. We were offered a discount one night, but not the night after. They did move our room, but to a comparable room, not a better room and there were many superior rooms available. Several emails stating a desire to get some kind of discount later and the answer is still NO. So there is no misunderstanding.... If you can't sleep due to criminal behaivor in the hotel, that is not their problem. I was very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “cool vibe in the LES”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Battersea
Reviews.Content: The last neighborhood of NY that is still 'cool' and not taken over by Starbucks and Pottery Barn now has a cool hotel without the self-conscious attitude of a 'W'. The Rivington...low key entry...check in on 1st floor...quiet, confident and sexy vibe. If you want the antidote to 'corporate' america hotels..here it is...if you want frequent sleeping points, business centres and all that stuff = Dont stay here. If you want a low key cool vibe...comfortable and quiet bedrooms (on the upper floors) with killer views...check it out/check in. Rooms are dark (black tile bathtubs and sinks. Brown/white linens and great windows w/ views. Great toiletries...robes, comfortable towels and plasma tv w/ free wifi. Cookies at turndown and paper in the morning. Didnt eat at the restaurant...why? Schillers is a block away. And Tiny's sandwiches are the best...great bars in neighborhood and close walk to all the cool Lower East Side (LES) venues. We will stay here again! Very cool.

Reviews.Title: “Cool neighborhood and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MinneapolisCate
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in the lower east side and i loved the neighborhood feel of the location. Great shops and restaurants nearby (try the creperie a block or 2 from the hotel). Hotel rooms were modern, clean, and comfortable with great views from the floor to ceiling windows. The complimentary breakfast was just ok. It would have been nice to have some yogurt or cereal like many of the other hotels offer. There wasn't really anything that was wrong with the place but nothing stood out as fabulous either. It was perfectly fine and in a fun neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and location, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: ItinerantLondoner
Reviews.Content: You probably should not book this hotel without understanding the location: the Lower East Side is a bit more gritty and perfect for a good night out. It is also 10 minutes walk from Soho. But is not the ideal location for tourist hotspots, if this is a priority. For me, the location was perfect, but it is worth noting. Key positives: the hotel was slick, the room smart and minimal, light with very comfortable bed and decent bathroom. Upgraded to a 10th floor corner room with a great S Manhattan view. The bar was pleasant enough for an early evening drink and the inclusive breakfast offered fruit, bagels, toast, jam and tea and coffee, which was enough (though for something more imaginative google 88 Orchard, a decent cafe within 5 minutes walk). The LES location is great for evenings out (also close to Soho and East Village) and there is a Subway within 2 minutes walk that gives you quick access to Manhattan/Brooklyn. Free wifi also gets a ++. Key negatives: the hotel designates all rooms as non smoking, but does not enforce it. Hence my room smelt like a smoking room on arrival. The best the hotel could do was offer an air machine during the day, which took two days to have an effect. In addition, the exterior primarily being metal framed glass, the room got cold in the evening without pumping in enormous amounts of hot air through the AC. Summary: A great location, great views and no complaints about the size or contents of the room. However, it's not perfect: anybody who is a non-smoker probably doesn't appreciate a night in a smoking room and it can get chilly in winter without blasting the AC. I would stay here again but would probably try other alternatives in the neighbourhood first. BTW - the light switchers have dimmers - for those who complained the rooms were too dark.

Reviews.Title: “Eh”
Reviews.Author: NYCSFCT
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine, but definitely NOT worth the price. The rooms are spacious, and clean enough, but the spacious bathrooms are dark (do hotel designers not think people need light in bathrooms? Absurd). Too dark to even apply makeup, so don't even bother trying. The beds are comfortable, but sleep might be difficult given how thin the walls are. You will have full audio to your neighbor's evening. Even though the hotel is relatively new, for some reasons the bathrooms and corners of the rooms are dingy and kind of gross. Not sure if it's just disregard but it's disappointing. If you need to be in the LES, stay here. If you can go a few blocks north, go stay at the Bowery Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Daughter's Last Night before Wedding”
Reviews.Author: Lindy905
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel to spend the night with my daughter before her wedding. Her older brother and his fiancee were on the 7th floor and we were on the 11th floor corner. The rooms were amazing, the staff was amazing and extremely accommodating. My daughter's wedding gown was delivered before we arrived. The general manager placed it in his office for safekeeping. Ditto with the flowers the next day. Everything the staff did was prompt and professional. When the limo arrived for our trip to the altar, we were notified and escorted. I couldn't have asked for a better group of professionals. I hope we have the opportunity to stay again. Especially on those mattresses!!! And the Chinese soaking tub was great for my daughter's nerves!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of street noise at this cool if overrated hotel”
Reviews.Author: design_and_comfort
Reviews.Content: Great design and dÃ©cor, modern and sleek. Best are the floor to ceiling window walls and automatic curtains, with sweeping views (though the views are not particularly impressive for NYC), and the Tempurpedic beds, heaven if you don't mind the street noise. I came to this hotel attracted by Marcel Wandersâ€™ design of the restaurant, and the Thor restaurant and bar are indeed beautiful and "wanderesque". But this is no Mondrian hotel (the astonishing South Beach wonder by Wanders), not even -not remotely- close though it is way more expensive, this being NYC. The Wanders design is limited to the first floor. The best is probably the feeling of living in a loft in the Lower East Side. The worst is the poor insulation from the constant street noise at night, the hotel being located in a hip busy nightlife area. The traffic jam, horns and screams from the crowd below kept me awake despite being in a suite in a high floor, overpriced and where the hotel wi-fi does not reach. Loved the furniture and the sleek design, but wonâ€™t come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with incredible view from the room”
Reviews.Author: JoeL81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel on Rivington and absolutely loved it. Staff is great and very helpful. Minibar is filled with the typical products, but with some fun products as well such as binoculars! Best part of the room was the balcony with an incredible view over the city. With the big glass windows in the room, we wouldn't have needed the balcony anyway! And have you ever taken a shower while watching people walking on the street? I haven't before I stayed here, and it was great! Beds were very comfortable, haven't slept so good in a long time. Breakfast was good, really liked the bagels. Overall, I recommend staying at the hotel on rivington for its great service and the view!

Reviews.Title: “Loving The Hotel on Riv”
Reviews.Author: ScootersPeople
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights. First, we love the lower east side, but realize it's not for everyone. The proximity to Soho, Orchard Street, and Chinatown are a plus, but the immediate neighborhood around the hotel is lively, arty, and never boring. The hotel staff was very helpful and welcoming. They knew where to find anything in the neighborhood with tips on bargaining. Loved our room, a corner king with balcony and floor to ceiling windows,even in the shower. Great views and plenty of room. We will definitely go back to THOR. Thanks everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Chic”
Reviews.Author: JoshuaSims
Reviews.Content: the room was a little run down this visit but I love the hotel, location, and wrap-around views

Reviews.Title: “The cleaniness and the view is awesome.”
Reviews.Author: jodilovenwirth
Reviews.Content: The service was fantastic. The view is breathtaking from the clean and beautifully decorated rooms . The staff was courtious and helpful when ever they were called upon. i certainly would recommend this hotel to any of my friends or business partners.

Reviews.Title: “stayed here loads of times”
Reviews.Author: Sidewalk7Records
Reviews.Content: in face.... I was here before the place opened. Stay in room 185 - massive bath, the views are awesome. Quite pricey, but views make it worth it - see my pic from the window.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!! Valet service ruined my car”
Reviews.Author: themprudente
Reviews.Content: Pulled up...valet came out to greet me. Turns out he was the valet AND the bellhop. After the 10 minutes it took to get luggage to the room, he went downstairs to presumably park the car. About 10 minutes later got a call that my car had been hit by a truck (which was under vontract to the hotel to remove laundry). No apology was made for the incident, no offer for compensation given. Later, after dealing with the front desk and on-call manager, neother of whom made any effort to make my stay better, I was given the General Managers number. He made the call to compensate me for my room, albeit reluctantly. Additionally, folks above me were playing music and throwing stuff off their patio at at 4 AM. If you are teir on the weekend have to fight through a velvet rope to get back to your room amongst the desperate ho hos that skank around its first floor club.

Reviews.Title: “Hype Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ptitlu
Reviews.Content: I was staying in May for a business and private trip. The service is nice, concierge was very helpfull for restaurant, show and limo service. The hotel is very busy at night, there is a long line to go in, but they reconize hotel guests and give us a prioity access. We was in a room on the 14th floor and even with the music it was quiet for a NYC Hotel. View are totally amazing. Its not a regular and boring hotel as Plaza or other, but service is quiet the same. Helpfull, polite....

Reviews.Title: “Ah, to be young and painfully hip again”
Reviews.Author: jbleenyc
Reviews.Content: This was the first boutique hotel in this part of the city, the Lower East Side, which despite all the hype still remains a neighborhood that is slightly run down, dirty, and not very convenient in terms of access to and from other parts of NYC. Oh, but it is, for some mysterious reason, achingly hip. So if you're young and want to be feel you're at the epicenter of cool, this is just about the only upscal lodging option available to you in this area. The hotel was, and to some extent still is, a little glittering gem rising from the gloomy tenement buildings surrounding it. Stayed here for a week in a high corner floor king with balcony. At the time something like $500 a night, which isn't cheap, especially for this part of town. The room isn't large in square footage, but because of the wraparound, floor-to-ceiling windows, it feels airy. The decor is downtown modern chic, but I imagine susceptible to becoming dated pretty quickly as all trendy things are. Judged by conventional measures, the hotel rarely rises above the merely adequate in terms of service, professionalism, the quality of the accommodations (though the Tempurepedic bedsâ€”I was skeptical of the foamy mattress at firstâ€”are incredibly sleep-inducing and comfortable). And at night, the bar/restaurant on the first floor becomes a velvet-roped mob scene. It becomes a strange combination glam/sordid bling on those nights. But it's an experience. I'm in my forties now, so this all feels a bit nostalgic and probably soon just strange and awkward. Would I return again to THOR? Maybe, but as some reviewers have pointed out, the hotel has to maintain guest loyalty as a hotel and less as a nightspot or merely a hip destination.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Views”
Reviews.Author: HotelEnthusiast09
Reviews.Content: The big draw for us to stay at the Rivington was the views and it did not disappoint. They are absolutely spectacular and, on a very cold January morning, we woke up to a warm, sun-filled room with New York spread out around us - it was well worth the money. Having said that, it is a question of money as, unless you pay for an upgraded room, you'd be stuffed with some pretty uninspiring views (a wall maybe?) on the lower floors. The room itself had nice touches (eg Ipod docking station; nice shower stuff), and a nice seating area, but looked a little dated in parts (the wardrobes are quite scruffy and scuffed and the bathroom door came off its hinges one time - someone was sent very quickly to fix it but it really shouldn't have happened and was quite dangerous as the door was heavy). We got an apology from Reception but that was it. Also while the floor to ceiling windows in the bathroom are spectacular, the water pressure in the shower wasn't great and you couldn't turn up the temperature much (which was pretty surprising and not great on a cold winter's day). Breakfast is really disappointing, pastries, some fruit and cereal in packets, and you get coffee in paper cups which is nasty. Even though breakfast was included in the room charge, we chose to venture out almost every morning - there are some really interesting local cafes nearby. We also ate one evening in the restaurant - it was ok, nothing special, and pricey for what you get. Room service was completely blah. The bar had a fun happening vibe late into a Saturday night. Best thing about the hotel: Views from rooms higher up. Worst thing about the hotel: Breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky hotel on Lower East Side!”
Reviews.Author: Malino
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel on Rivington with my partner for a 3 day weekend break in mid June. We had a lovely corner suite on the 16th floor with great views over NYC. Really loved the room and the bathroom.Very impressed with the automatic curtains and like previous reviewers have said, the bed is HUGE and really really comfy with a tempur mattress.. slept really well! The only little niggles would be the a) shower pressure which wasn't great - buy hey, you are having a view whilst showering ;-) and b) the lifts in the hotel - there is only 2 of them and 1 seemed to be out of order the whole time or it was used for preparing the top floor huge suite for private parties etc. Saying that, we would happily stay in this hotel again! The neighborhood is really up and coming with lots of little bars and restaurants scattered.. also is really close to the underground and walking distance to Soho. I also recommend the restaurant on the corner (come out of the hotel and turn left) for breakfast/brunch. The hotel offers a complimentary breakfast which includes bagels, toast, cakes, cereal and fruit but if you fancy something more substantial then next door is a good bet! In summary, i would happily stay here again and if you are planning a trip to NY - try this hotel for something a little different!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in New York!”
Reviews.Author: TOMAS-SP-BRA
Reviews.Content: I stayed one week (07 nights) at the Rivington Hotel this June, and it was a great experience. The Hotel is cool but not arrogant, the guests are modern and stylish without being snob. The staff in the door are helpful and in the front desk they are young hipsters with not appropriately the best attitude, but this is not really important at all. The room I stayed (45) was in the fourth floor, very wide and spacious and the bathroom had steam, and a nice shower. The bed is incredible, simply giant, and the sheets and pillows wonderful. The street is full of bars and nightlife but the windows are noise proof. You can hear some noise and streetlife but nothing that really bothers you, or canÂ´t put you into sleep. My girlfriend had a great impression of the Hotel, and we enjoyed it a lot. In the morning breakfast is good, with a selection of breads, butter, jelly, cream cheese and fruits. The atmosphere is also calm, with a good music and service. I have always stayed in mid town or the Upper East Side, but chosing the Rivington was my best option. The are is modern and fresh and has a hip atmosthere. It was definitely a great cost benefit choice, and I strongly recommend this hotel for those who are looking for a rest but like to be in the middle of where things are happening in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed impressions”
Reviews.Author: DomenicaA
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at The Rivington and give the room high marks for style and comfort. However, the hotel is a mixed experience. The lobby and common areas are worn and shabby and not up to our expectations considering the top dollar price we paid for our stay. We enjoyed the room, but will not return again.

Reviews.Title: “One perfect stay, one good stay.”
Reviews.Author: bab7306
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Rivington twice now for business, in Jan and in Feb 09. Both times I got an awesome rate. The first time really impressed me. At check-in I was given a voucher for a complimentary tasting menu dinner in the restaurant downstairs (which was delicious, by the way). My room was a corner room on a relatively high floor with a small balcony that overlooked the atrium of the restaurant and had both the biggest/deepest soaking tub I've ever seen and a lovely shower with a view. In fact, I had the most amazing view from my bed, which was nothing short of magical when the snow started falling the next morning. It was hard to find fault with anything on this stay. Certainly not the cookies they give you at turndown! The second stay was very nice, but I didn't feel like they had pulled out all the stops like they did the previous stay. The room I got was not a corner room and much plainer on a lower floor. Same sort of decor, just no soaking tub. The beds are SO comfy though. Still got cookies at turn-down and even a little welcome amenity of nuts, chocolates, and dried fruit. I used the gym this time and it was small with no windows, but the equipment was great. The room's windows faced the back of the hotel which was over a courtyard of a bar/pub I think. VERY loud on the Thursday night that I was there and other coworkers that have stayed there since have also complained of noise on certain nights of the week. Will definitely stay there again as long as their rate is competitive. The location is great for those who like being in walking distance of some of the best restaurants in the city (the Lower East Side).

Reviews.Title: “A Solid 4 Rating”
Reviews.Author: JWellingtonJ
Reviews.Content: Expectations determine experiences. If you want Rockefeller Center and mid-town tourist havens this is not your place. On the other hand, the edgy (or tawdry depending on perspective) Lower East Side has a dynamic young vibe and is easy walking distance to the Village, Soho, and Tribeca. The Subway "F" Line is only 1 block away. My 22 year old son and I had a "double double" room on the 16th floor. Many NYC hotel rooms have only one bed. Bathroom was interior, unlike some rooms with glass walled exterior showers. You want to be on the higher floors (12 and above) both for the view and the distance from street noise. Beds are visco memory foam and outstanding. Rooms and bathrooms are compact, but well laid out and acceptable in size for New York. Wi-Fi is available throughout the building and is free. Our room was clean and well serviced by the housekeeping staff, but the bathroom tile needs a thorough cleaning (one of the few negatives). Unlike some other posts, we found the staff to be exceptionally helpful and friendly. My son left 3 shirts in our room after checking out and he was tracked down in the lobby with the returned shirts. Nice. Don't discount the value of an included continental breakfast. It saves time and money, and the basics were there (fruit, cereal, croissants, coffee). We stayed 3 nights during the Tribeca Film Festival and got a fair rate of $280 per night. All in all a favorable experience worthy of a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty with Rude staff!”
Reviews.Author: CathyQuarding
Reviews.Content: The staff actually lies to you. If you request something they say yes and then do nothing about it. All the staff if uptight and obnoxious. The hotel is dirty and there were creatures walking around in the night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location. Average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Dan1954
Reviews.Content: The two things that Hotel On Rivington has going for it are it's location and the rooms. We stayed in a high floor room with Japanese soaking tub. The room was a good size but in need of a lick of paint. We had a fantastic view of downtown from both the bedroom and bathroom. The hotel bar is fairly dull and also in need of some care and attention. It gets busy for after work drinks but apart from that there isn't much going on. You're better off going to the bar next door. Breakfast was a continental buffet affair with anything hot involving an extra charge! I would look elsewhere in future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel close to finest Gallery”
Reviews.Author: Lordleighton
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, close to the Michali Fine Art Gallery. I came to buy art and found it walking distance to the gallery..made and excellent investment and had a delightful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps the Best Hotel Views in NYC? Very Cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spiderquadrifoglio
Reviews.Content: I started staying here in early Summer of 2005 before the hotel was officially open (they were still painting and the restaurant and bar were not open). I had seen it on the back page of Conde Nast Traveler "The Room". Lucky me - I actually got "The Room" shown in the article. In the years since, I have stayed here about 30 nights. It has been great to watch the transformation of the neighborhood around the hotel. Initially a little run down, now filled with cool boutiques and restaurants. If you read the other reviews, they are all accurate about the hotels hip and trendy clientelle and decor. I love this hotel. However, I have recommended it to some friends who felt a bit scared hanging out in the Lower East Side. However, I also have a friend who took her 12 year old daughter for her first trip to NYC and they had a blast. Why is this hotel so special? The views and the bathrooms. The view: If you want a view, you need a room above the 7th or 8th floor. Definitely worth the extra to get as high as you can. South and West views look over to the financial district and Brooklyn Bridge (just visible). North side rooms are what you really want. High North facing rooms have views looking all the way up across midtown. A highrise condo was recently completed a few blocks away, so you now have either a view of the Empire State Building OR the Chrysler building. Used to be able to get the full panorama. Either way, its simply gorgeous and I have spent many a late night watching the lights go out across the city. Who needs the LCD TV?? The size and layout of the rooms varies widely. From basic accommodations to uber-luxe hip suites. Furniture is minimal. Walls are white. almost no artwork. But you get floor to ceiling and wall to wall windows overlooking Manhattan. All the bathrooms are done in glass tile and a lot of windows. Many bathrooms are located on exterior walls and the shower is full glass with the view (with strategically placed frosted glass to obscure your privates from outside view). Some of the rooms have enormous bathrooms with spoon shaped tubs filled from a spout in the ceiling, or deep Japanese soaking tubs, or full shower/sauna combos. The Hotel web site has several good photos - they really need to add more to show the full variety of what they have to offer. I also highly recommend this hotel for a romantic getaway. This may not be the place for you to spend a week in NYC (not centrally located - but there is a good subway stop on the block), but get a bottle of wine, bring some food from Inotecca across the street, and camp out for the night on the Tempurpedic bed and crisp sheets. The rest will follow. . . Oh, and when you are finally done with the view, be sure to close the drapes because you are in a fish bowl and the sun will wake you up VERY early. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Hip and Trendy”
Reviews.Author: SCaron42
Reviews.Content: The Hotel on Rivington is a very trendy, modern, sleek hotel in the heart of the Lower East side. Nice rooms, decent continental breakfast included in rate, very comfy temperpedic beds and great views of tenament rooftops from our all glass room. Great old neighborhood with a new young vibe. The bar/restaurant Thor is VERY young and loud. 20 something kids. We are in our 40's so we skipped the social scene in the hotel. All in all, a nice experience for a weekend. Hallways are VERY dark, so beware!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for a trendy week end in NYC”
Reviews.Author: tilsitt
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 days week-end in New york. Our 2 nights at the Revington Hotel contributed to make it a memorable experience. First of all, the location is just great for those who do not want to stay in the so crowded and so touristic areas of the city. The lower east side is a great alternative to discover the inside Manhattan atmosphere.
