The hotel is 10 mn walk from Soho, Tribeca, Nolita and Little Italy, 20 mn walk from Greenwich Village or Union Square, and 5mn walk to the metro station from where you could reach Central Park in the upper side ( we only took metro twice when our feet could'nt carry us anymore !) The hotel is trendy and design. Rooms are immaculate and offering an astonishing view (ours was on the 11th floor). The shower is just huge and spotless. Above all, the matresses are really incredible; Something like a new system taking into account your weight to support your entire body 'sur mesure'. Can't describe, it has to be experienced. The evening service left both nights on our bed side table either cookies and brownies...very appreciated attention! We definetly and highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “So cool it hurts!”
Reviews.Author: Frequenttraveller060
Reviews.Content: Stayed hear for my girlfriends 30th birthday. Emailed them in advance and they upgraded me free of charge on arrival. The rooms were large, and the bathroom unbelievable. The soaking tub was amazing and the shower brilliant as it has a view over Brooklyn Bridge. At night the bar fills out with the young and beautiful from the downtown area. The area in which the hotel is located is very different from mid town. Different in a good way though. The area is full of small restaurants and street cafes. It almost has a similar atmosphere to Notting Hill. In summary, an amazing hotel which really made the weekend special. I would return in a heartbeat - once I've saved up a bit!

Reviews.Title: “Another awesome weekend at hotel rivington”
Reviews.Author: waters62
Reviews.Content: I have been here a few times over the past two years and it is the only place I will ever stay in NYC. If there wasn't so much to do in this neighborhood I would spend my entire weekend in bed. The beds are awesome. What is even better is the bathroom. Every time I have stayed my bathroom has been different. The staff is very helpful and friendly. They know the area well and always have good suggestions on where to eat. Clean, hip hotel with amazing rooms and a unique design. Suggestions for places to eat sugar sweet sunshine (best cupcakes ever!) the creeperie (was on the food network) and for the best eggs benedict ever order room service!!

Reviews.Title: “A bit of chic in the Lower East Side”
Reviews.Author: LondonOaf
Reviews.Content: Both my friends and trusted website metrotwin.com raved about the Hotel on Rivington, so I decided to stay there during a recent trip. If you like Lower East Side cool fused with a bit of pampering, then you're going to love the Rivington. We stayed on the 12th floor and was amazed at how quiet the rooms were, despite the busy streets below. And the view from my room was just stunning. The rooms themselves are spacious and generous - our bed was gigantic and the tub in the bathroom could have filled an army. To my surprise, I would recommend this as a romantic get-away, as much as a destination for single travelers wanting to get up to no good in the local area - you couldn't be better placed, the bars between ludlow and stanton all have a cool rock vibe going on, making this a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Too cool for school”
Reviews.Author: DepDawg
Reviews.Content: Ok - so its a design hotel, and you expect it to be trendy and cool. But a hotel can go overboard on being hip. In fact so hip that that guests feel uncomfortable being there... There are good bits - the views from the floor to ceiling windows and the deep large slate bath was excellent. The bed was very comfortable and arriving late after a flight delay the roomservice food was excellent too. However, the corridor lighting is so moody as to be literally gloomy and dark, and the staff are off hand - nowhere was this more evident at breakfast where you have to ask for, and then pay extra for orange juice... on a bed and breakfast rate - come on. The experience of the rooms don't justify the cost, which is high even for Manhattan - so think carefully before you book. There are better locations and better hotels for less money.

Reviews.Title: “fab start to our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: izzymac
Reviews.Content: We picked the Rivington from a list of over twenty hotels we'd found in NYC that ticked all our 'wants & needs'. It won because of the floor to ceiling windows and the location.... we wanted non-gentrified NYC and that's what we got! It's door staff were great, friendly and welcoming. The reception staff were a mixed bunch... some 'to cool for school' some were very friendly approachable and couldn't do enough for you, so I guess it depends who's on the desk as to how you view the service here... I know some other reviewers have not been impressed with the service and I think they may just have been unlucky! The room was stunning... the decor's good but nothing too special but it gives the perfect backdrop for the real attraction of the room... the windows. They really let the Lower East Side in, we had a balcony and every time we returned to the room without fail, we went straight over to the balcony door to 'let the city in'. We had views that stretched from slightly north of the Williamsburg bridge right round to the Brooklyn bridge and when out on the balcony the Financial district in the distance... when the new building at the world trade centre go up that's gonna be one helluva view! The shower was a bit of a concern for me as although we knew it was in the window and had no curtain when we booked, I'd sort of assumed it would have some mechanism to frost the glass (there is a frosted panel that goes to waist height but no higher!).... nope! But my fears of 'peeping toms' were soon settled as soon as you put the water on it steamed up so you could see NYC but it couldn't see you!! The bed is a super comfortable tempur mattress and I had some of the best nights' sleep in a hotel I've ever had. The complimentary breakfast was just right if you wanted just to get going and weren't going to have a New York breakfast in somewhere like Katz's (just round the corner) there were plenty of pastries, toast, cereal, juice and coffee to go around. I get the feeling that most of the hotels guests aren't the type who normally make it to breakfast... there were a few very familiar faces staying there and it was particularly nice running into someone from our hometown who was playing Radio City that week. It's definitely that sort of hotel.... the sort of place that is cool enough and discrete enough for the famous not to be hassled, but also so that mere mortals don't feel out of place. The location is good, you're not far from a subway station, a three minute walk from the front door. There are multitude of bars and restaurants nearby, both the hip and seedy are in the mix. And areas like Soho, Little Italy, China Town and the Village are all walk able distances. Even if your tastes run to the chain fast food places they are represented too. If I had to take fault with anything it would be one thing... the laptop size safe isn't... that is to say if you have anything bigger than a netbook size laptop then forget it, you're gonna have to use the safe at reception. Otherwise we had a fab 4 days and nights, the Rivington really made the first 4 days of our honeymoon memorable, we'll be back... if only for the views!

Reviews.Title: “Positive Experience, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: BooKat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights last weekend. Will return. From check-in to check-out, the staff (everyone from the bell boy to the concierge to the bar staff!) were lovely and ready to help whenever necessary. Our room was a high corner king, 18th floor. By NYC standards, the room was big and the bathroom was huge. It is true that the room furnishings were showing a little wear, but the true beauty of the room lies in the glass walls which put a panoramic view of NYC on display. At night, the view was memorable. The Tempurpedic (spelled that wrong?) bed was beyond comfortable to me, although spouse thought it was not firm enough. The room has a small bar with a fridge that you can use for your own items. Cookies or fudge left by the turndown staff - nice touch! The club at night is popular, but we never had a problem getting back into the hotel. I liked having nightlife right in the hotel (so convenient to head upstairs to sleep when you've had enough!), but some may be turned off by that. The only downside to our stay was that Saturday night was noisy outside; even on the 18th floor we could hear the street noise until 5 a.m. Friday night was fine. I would suggest a stop at the attached hair salon; I had the best blow-out of my life and Serge was a great stylist. Neighborhood was full of interesting shops (especially vintage), cafes and bars.

Reviews.Title: “hype, not hip”
Reviews.Author: jujub34ns
Reviews.Content: Booked a high floor corner king with balcony. I don't know, maybe it's me, but floor twelve in a 20 story building isn't exactly "high floor" and there was no balcony. The included breakfast consisted of toast and coffee, served by snippy wait staff who were waiting to be discovered by DeNiro. Try to get back into the hotel after the club on the first floor opens and you'd better hope that a doorman recognizes you because the bouncer won't let you in. The pictures on the website were terrific, unfortunately, the reality was in dire need of a reburbishment. The shoddy workmanship mentioned by previous reviewers shows. The interior decor isn't all that special (better stuff at Ikea). The neighborhood is definitely still iffy (it IS the Lower East Side) and every bit as grimey as expected. The proximity to clubs is nice, but that's about it. It's very much like the Schrager hotels in that the emphasis on design precedes comfort and service. Stay here for the experience - once - and only if you get a decent rate as I did (under $400). However, for their standard rate of $650 per night, they have to do better. There are hipper hotels, in better locations, and with better service for what Rivington charges.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the $$$$$”
Reviews.Author: MandKLondon
Reviews.Content: After much deliberation and internet research we decided on the Rivington and weren't disappointed. Theres so much choice, Gansevoort, Hudson, Mercer but the views are unbeatable at the Rivington, rooms are a good size and as a visitor you will get to experience the lower east side - very cool area. We always favoured the west village and meatpacking, but this has lots of hip quirky bars / restaurants which we wouldn't have found had we not stayed in a new area. Its pricey but definitely worth paying more for a high floor. We had a corner suite so loads of space. (good wardrobe space too). Waking up to clear blue skies and Manhattan sky line is amazing and showering with a view of the empire state is awesome. We would definitely stay again and will recommend to friends, but ask for the highest floor possible. Minor negative - the rubbish is collected at about 3am and its pretty noisy (for about 10mins). Its in a cool neighbourhood, in the early hours bars and clubs close so people are on the streets, which is noisy so could annoy some. Staff were really friendly and helpful, and a complimentary breakfast in an NYC hotel is always welcome for the mornings when Pastis is chocca!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Huge Room”
Reviews.Author: GoBlueTraveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms are huge and in excellent condition. I found the service to be very prompt. I requested a room toward the back of the building. Therefore, I slept really well. However, I was not there on a weekend night. I enjoyed staying in the lower east side for the first time. It's a fun neighborhood. I didn't like the small tiles in the bathroom but that's just me. Overall, a good place if you want to pay the price.

Reviews.Title: “Best View In NYC”
Reviews.Author: Grinadam
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights in room 1825 (unique room 18th floor). Simply spectacular view of midtown manhattan. I have never ever seen views like this from a hotel room. Hotel had bottle of champagne waiting. No street noise from this level and bed was extremely comfortable. Bathroom was floor to ceiling windows (bottom half frosted) which was quite unique. Simply an amazing hotel, but quite pricey.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: babyjeans
Reviews.Content: love it...simply amazing..the view ,the area is the best for the real newyork feel..not the touristy kind of thing..the cafes and resturants near by...the hotel trendy decor..the friendly friendly staff...u just feel at home..i just would like to recommend that ppl stay away from the standard rooms... i requested an upgrade when i saw the standard with no view..cuz if u want to stay in this hotel u have to pay alittle more to get an amazing view of the real city.u got to see the sunset and rise of new york in the best ways possible.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap decor and awful service”
Reviews.Author: Des1726
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed at. Small rooms and cheapo furnishings is not chic minimalist decor. The rooms do not have desks or workspaces of any type whatsoever, so if you need to do any work, you are out of luck. The TV was 22" rather than 42" like every other hotel. The elevators bounce and shimmy. The concrete walls and metal doors give the hotel a dormitory feel. The service from the front desk was awful. I shortened my reserved stay of three nights and left after one night because the hotel could not provide me a room with a desk or table. No apology was offered. Instead, I was told I should have paid more attention to the room description when booking if a table or desk was something I expected in a hotel room. When I asked for a late checkout of 2 pm so that I had somewhere to stay until I could check into my room at another hotel, I was told they had to have the room back by 1 pm. The front desk staff seems to have no understanding of the level of service expected by guests accustomed to staying at luxury hotels. Avoid staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “giddying”
Reviews.Author: LongIslandSoundOsa
Reviews.Content: The Riv is giddyingly comfortable and awesome and expensive. For us, it was a delightful Friday night splurge. Early October is beautiful in NYC and we enjoyed both The New Yorker Festival and Open House New York Weekend (OHNY). They upgraded us to a corner suite on the 10th floor, perhaps because we asked for "something quiet" which seemed impossible given the thundering retro mix blasting at THOR, directly below where we checked in. We had just eaten dinner there, the food was exquisite (the flight of ceviches and the gnocchi esp), but had to shout at the top of our lungs at each other across the table to be heard. In the room, once we figured out how to open the curtains (the electric switches are next to the bed and look like light switches) we were all oohs and ahs over the night views of the city, including a blue-lit Empire State Building and the rivulets of 20 somethings lining up for the night clubs 10 floors below. My favorite memory is waking up at hour intervals starting in the early morning to various forms of weather, including a dense yellow-gray blanket of sky with a clear front line, to a bright blue firmament studded with tiny puffs of white, to light rain. My one bone to pick is that for a luxury hotel with a very replete mini (lets say maxi) bar in the room, it would be nice for those of us more desirous of innocent libations such as a late night cup of tea or coffee upon waking, to have a coffee/tea bar with cream and sugar available.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings. Hip but lots of street noise at night.”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveler67
Reviews.Content: I agree with the poster from Bordeaux about the noise. I was on the 8th floor and even so, the street noise was brutal up till 4am with club noise and cabs honking their horns. Now I appreciate NYC is a major city and if you stay there you have to appreciate some noise but for a new'ish hotel you would have thought they would have addressed this problem (ie double glazing?) at the time of construction. My room smelled musty - as if someone had been smoking in there and the cleaning staff had really been trying to get rid of the smell, but hadn't succeeded. Having said that it definitely does have a vibe, and it was a 20 min walk to Soho. All in all - mixed feelings. Would I go back? No - New York's a big place and there are plenty of alternatives. Would I recommend friends stay there? No.

Reviews.Title: “4th of July fireworks”
Reviews.Author: funromanticgetaway
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay here to view the 4th of July fireworks display. Many of the rooms have an unobstructed view of the fireworks. The rooms are nice, and the hotel is located in a hip neighborhood. The room service is also tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: boggart
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel on Rivington. I know some other reviewers have commented on noise / disturbances but for us the biggest plus point was that our high floor room was a real oasis of calm from the frenetic streets of New York. The dimly lit corridors and lift chill you out the minute you arrive back at the hotel. Yes, you can always hear the buzz of traffic but the huge tub, comfy beds and luxurious carpet made it such a relaxing stay. In terms of service some areas could definitely be improved. We had a very small query about the curtains in our room which was dealt with in a fairly disorganised fashion. The breakfast service was a bit hit and miss. The waiters were great but the staff who take your room number weren't at all welcoming and not really on the ball. The bellmen and housekeepers were by far the friendliest and most helpful members of staff. The Lower East Side is a really interesting place to visit at the moment; you get a real sense of an area in a period of transition. I can recommend popping into Teany, also on Rivington Street. Went in there with a big hangover that was swiftly cured by their iced white tea, macaroni cheese, lovely waitress and the Velvet Underground. The subway is literally round the corner so you can be elsewhere in Manhattan in a matter of minutes. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: Tillsville
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our wedding night and we weren't disappointed at all. Due to a mix up with the booking we were upgraded to the Owners Suite which I have to say was just soooooooo good! Me and my new husband ran around the enormous suite like excited litte children! Views from the 17th floor are the best, so do mention on booking that you want to be higher up and it's worth having a 'feature room' too, the bath tub we had was just perfect! Staff were very friendly, food in the restaurant good and the Friday night party-night was great for people watching! So all in all, a cool hotel which I am more than happy to recommend!

Reviews.Title: “mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: bubble88
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to go to this hotel. I booked it as a surprise for my boyfriend. I booked directly on the hotel website and asked if they could give me a room on the highest floor possible. On the day of arrival we were very happy to hear that they had reserved a room on the top floor! The view and everything was really stunning!! But then the problems began... Some photographer-guy had booked the penthouse for his work and they had a big party after. It was as if the party actually was in our room... It was really loud and very disturbing. My boyfriend went to the guy to ask if he could turn down the music a little... but nothing happened of course. The reception staff didn't really help us either. They told us that they would do something about it but never did. After 2 hours we went to the reception again to ask if they could give us another room because we really didn't want to "party" with these people. It was REALLY loud, never experienced something like that before. And I didnt' really understand why they would let people stay in this room when there is a huge party going on in the penthouse. It is simply ridiculous when the walls are so thin that you think you're in the penthouse, too.... Anyways. It ended with us being "downgraded" to a room on the 9th floor which was really not worth the money at all!!! Apart from the noise there was no view at all. So make really sure you'll be on a top floor room if you want to stay in this hotel!! The next morning we complained again to the hotel manager and he gave us a discount. But I will still not go to this hotel anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Views, fab Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Haylz77
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights for our honeymoon. We booked a suite and when we checked in we had been upgraded to a unique king suite on the 19th floor! The views were stunning day and night. All the staff in the hotel were friendly and couldn't do enough for you. The only disappointing thing was that our bathroom was internal with no window. The one complaint I have is that being on the 19th floor, its one below the penthouse which they rent out for parties. One night we returned early due to illness and were subjected to very loud music!! We did complain to the front desk the next morning and they gave us a 50% discount on our room rate for the night so we could live with that! All in all, fantastic hotel, staff, rooms everything.

Reviews.Title: “Very trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: MadameMango
Reviews.Content: We asked our friend who lives in NY to book us into a great hotel for our weekend stay there. She chose the Hotel on Rivington and we were captivated by the pictures we saw online. We booked a queen room which was on the 4th floor. Having stayed in hotels in New York twice before I was extremely surprised by the size of the hotel room. It was very large in comparison to any other hotel in New York (and we weren't in a suite). The bathroom was stunning - a HUGE shower cubicle that was also a steam room. Good buffet breakfasts in the downstairs restaurant (would be nice to have something other than coffee available without having to ask the staff). The only negative thing I would say was that being on the 4th floor, and at the front of the building, it was quite noisy at night. There is a nightclub downstairs and 2 opposite and you could hear that when going to bed. It wasn't loud enough to wake me up, but the first night I wondered if I would be able to fall asleep or not. But I would say overall a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms - Not So Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Abygal
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel on Rivington for a weekend at the end of June. Arrived early and was told the room wasn't ready yet and to call back. I called once an hour before the standard check in time and was told the room still wasn't ready. Arrived at the hotel at check in time and the room still wasn't ready. A half hour later, we were given our room. All things considered we were lucky as the rest of the family that needed rooms (we were there for a wedding) waited over an hour later after the rooms were supposed to be completed. I think it's because we asked and asked and asked. The staff was friendly, just not very competent. Once we were given our room - corner king on the 19th floor, it was awesome. I thought it was pretty large considering NYC standards. The bed was totally comfortable, the bathroom was clean and the view was incredible. Even though we had made it to our room, the housekeeping had to come in and finish restocking the mini bar. Seems the hotel management needs to hire more staff or become more efficient. On Saturday night, the hotel was really packed with bar-goers. I could see how it'd be loud for those on lower floors, but we heard nothing on the 19th. Only issue was walking through the velvet rope just to enter the hotel - a little uncomfortable after a long day of wedding activities. Overall, if you're looking for a trendy hotel with hip furnishings, then you've found your place. Just don't expect to get your room on time. If you're ok with that and just relaxed, you'll enjoy the place.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly trendy - worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: LanaBLondon
Reviews.Content: Situated in the heart of the newly gentrified lower east side (one of my favourite parts of NYC) Hotel on Rivington is a fabulous hotel for the young and young at heart. Location plays a massive role in why I loved staying here. Ultra funky and exclusive boutiques are all within arms reach of the hotel making it a perfect base. Its also surrounded by 'real New York' - Delancey St around the corner offers a taste of this which is always exciting. We stayed in room 412 - an upper floor king suite with Japanese soaking tub and balcony. It was spectacular - you must stay in a room with a view. The tub offered full emersion with a view over LES to the Williamsburg bridge. The room itself was very spacious with floor to ceiling windows, a sitting area with couch/ coffee table, a massive king bed with high thread count linen and a plasma. The mini-bar wasn't overpriced like some hotels can be but had a big fridge so it was easy to buy drinks at one of the local deli's and stock up for a sun downer drink on the balcony - beautiful! The air-con and lighting in the bathroom were fab. The blinds successfully blocked out all light allowing for a deep sleep and were operated by the press of a button. House-keeping was great and room service menu was extremely reasonable and delicious. The complimentary conti breakfast was great - a selection of pastries / bagels / croissants / cereals / fruits and coffees avail from 7-11am with 3 choices of newspapers in the gorgeous bar area - we sat in the window overlooking bustling Rivington St most mornings in the sun next to rockstars and celebs with their agents - its a very trendy hotel (not really for kids, nor is the area). I was very impressed by the folder the hotel provides which lists all the local shops / bars / restaurants worth checking out - we tried a few and they were all fabulous - you really can't explore enough around this part of town. The uber trendy East village, Soho, and Nolita are all within 10mins walking and if you head towards the river you can easily walk through chine town down to Southport and walk across the Brooklyn Bridge to thriving Brooklyn - highly recommend this. There are also plenty of bus and subway connections close by. Cabs are easy to come by and don't cost much to move around. Most Sundays Rivington Hotel host a party in the penthouse which everyone is welcome to go to - definitely worth checking out even if just to check out the view across the city and the jacuzzi! We were really really impressed with this hotel (if you hadn't noticed) and will recommend to all friends and family visiting New York and will definitely stay again when we return as the Lower east side will only continue to get better. We moved to midtown after our stay here and even though it was nice being close to Central Park, 5th Ave and all the tourist attractions, we found ourselves wanting to go and check out downtown time and time again - its just so much more vibrant, young and interesting - you will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: b0ris19
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because of the location in lower east , the sleek architecture of the building and the cool vibe of the area. Unfortunatelly after 5 years of opening , the decor fall down in maintenance, some stain on the carpet and scratch on the furniture make this place declining and not as appealing as expexted. the staff is amateur and desinterested. The value for money is poor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Architecture, Operation Not As Expected”
Reviews.Author: nolatravel
Reviews.Content: Ever since seeing the image of one of the High Floor King corner rooms in a magazine I have wanted to stay at this hotel - because of it's design. The voyeuristic facade is entirely transparent including bathrooms and showers on the facade wall, some with fritted glass - though the rooms have drapes. But once in the room you want to leave the drapes open, and it is obvious when looking up from the outside and seeing the occasional human silhouette in a towel or robe that many of the hotels guests feel the same way. The location is interesting, the building is great, and the rooms are great, if money is no object. I was disappointed by the operation of the hotel though. For the prices and the architecture the staff did not make you feel welcome or like you were in a special place - that feeling stopped with the physical environment - I felt like I was at a trendy bar begging to be let in - not a hotel. I dare say I would have liked the hotel better if there were no staff, and I checked in by machine - because the hotel itself is great (perhaps it has too few elevators!) - it was something about the atmosphere created by the staff that had the negative impact - they were neutral and indifferent - like in a trendy club. Not rude, but not attentive as I would expect from a property like this one. Upon check in our "non smoking" room reeked of smoke as if it was a bar the night before. We told the bellman who said they would deodorize, we left for a while and came back to the room. It was too horrible of a cigarette smell. We called the desk and said we needed a different room, the insisted they could air it out. We said it was too horrible a smell and we could check into another hotel, and they said they would call us back. They called back and found us a room two floors down on 10 (We had requested a High King With Soaking Tub on floors 9-20 and specifically asked for a high floor). We asked to see the new room first. It had great air quality so we took it. We enjoyed the rest of out stay - watching a fantastic thunderstorm move through around the glass facade, enjoying the deep soaking tub, the view, and the local restaurants and bars. Actually there was one staff person who we thought was great - the housekeeper. She aimed to please; she brought us treats at the turn down service. The rest of the staff could learn something from her.... The continental breakfast was drab, and the service for this was also indifferent - things were empty, things were cold, and staff could care less, or if they did care, they tried hard to make it seem like they didn't - perhaps they were just recovering from a late night out the evening before... who is to know. I would go back, but I would go back not expecting anything from the hotel staff - and I would actually pay more money for a better room higher up... when you are into the experience for $475 (plus tax) you might as well spend $675 to get something more over the top... I would recommend this hotel to people from Europe who sees tremendous value in the currency rates. I would not say that it has great service - so if that were what you want I would not stay here. This is a cool place to hang out and sleep, but it does not feel like a full service hotel (though it has restaurant, bar, room service etc.), and it isn't conveniently located to any of the traditional New York attractions. It is however hip + coolâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Summer Weekend in NYC”
Reviews.Author: edcobbjr
Reviews.Content: The Hotel provided stunning views of the city from my 15th floor corner room. From my balcony I was also able to look directly down into the hotels restaurant, THOR, where I later enjoyed a remarkable Hanger Steak. From dinner, the logical move was into the lobby bar which was full by midnight. The hotel's staff was very helpful during my stay and helped make it an enjoyable one which I will plan again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, loved the LES!”
Reviews.Author: badsparklythings
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 days in the first week in June and really enjoyed it. We booked a high floor corner king with balcony and got a really clean, spacious room on the 17th floor. The balcony is room but had a fab view, even more so at night, over the bridges and down towards the finacial district. The shower was powerful, the bath products very nice and the robes excellent. The bathroom was very slightly shabby and scuffed around the edges but kept brilliantly clean. The (huge) bed was wonderful and the curtains kept the room nicely dark in the morning. Turndown service with little snacks was nice too. Front desk staff were a bit aloof and not the friendliest although the door staff were fab and did lots to help. Adam, concierge, arranged a limo airport transfer on arrival which was reasonably priced and prompt. Transfer back to Newark (pricate cab) was arranged for us by the hotel too and was fine ($60). Sunday nights during the summer, a penthouse party is held from 1pm-sunset on the room, which we really enjoyed, amazing views. We ate the buffet breakfast twice and it was perfectly acceptable, although not very special. No need to eat there really though, with so many excellent places all around. We really loved the LES area, two subway stops within a block or two and fab nightlife spots and boutique shopping within walking distance all around. Economy Candy right across the street and Katz's deli round the corner. The only reason i may not stay here again is that there are so many hotels in NYC i'd love to try! I really don't think this location can be beaten though, it's excellent.

Reviews.Title: “spacious rooms, great neighbourhood, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: slhTourist
Reviews.Content: I had a 2 week long stay at the Rivington and I was very happy with my hotel choice. PROS: I was in the lowest category room on the 8th floor, however it was still spacious, had good closet space and the bathroom had a tub. comfy bed, good pillows. Despite its cool vibe, the staff was genuinely friendly and went out of their way to help. everyone from the doorman, receptionist to housekeepers got to know me within a couple of days and made me feel welcome. the 8th is a lower floor, but I did not hear much noise from the street and once you shut the curtains, the room is a cocoon. Lots of choices in the mini bar, if you are ok with the prices. grocery store right next door as well. Really good room service, prices were good, portions were huge and they generally delivered within 15 minutes of placing the order. Great shower head, I really miss it now that I am back home. Great neighbourhood, check out falai, falai panneteria, inoteca, clinton baking co, sugar sweet sunshine, teany, stanton social, tre, frankies pizzaria - all within walking distance. subway (F) train half a block away. CONS: my shower had a smelly curtain. for such a modern bathroom, they should have chosen a different option to close the shower. no electrical outlets near the desk, the light switch design was confusing. elevators are really slow. In all, surisingly homey and intimate, despite the cool boutique vibe. oh - and quikbook.com has good deals on the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsTrellis73
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. It's in a great boho location on the lower east side - brilliant for shopping eating out & drinking - and avoiding the tackier tourist areas I contacted the hotel directly and Rob DelliBovi was really helpful with the booking (organising a great deal), and advising on the location. On our arrival, staff were really polite and helpful, rooms were excellent with v comfy tempur mattressed beds, smashing toiletries and great late night snacks with the turn down service!!!. I know some reviewers said they were perturbed by the unfrosted shower windows & I can appreciate that this may be a problem if staying under the 10th & overlooked. However, our room was on 18th floor & I experienced no such problems, enjoying an unobstructed panoramic view taking in the old regenerated tenements, brooklyn bridge, the river & downtown NY. The bar was really funky with music at the weekend. The DJ's selection of tunes was questionable at times, but the atmosphere was great & people watching value was well worth a few late night drinks. Our only gripe was that the lifts were really slow & got stuck several times while we were there. We attributed this to the fact that there wasn't a staff service lift - something that could be rectified in the future? Overall I'd say that Hotel on Rivington is a wonderfully grown up decadent stay, in the perfect area of my very favourite city in the world. I'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Club or Hotel? I'm not sure...”
Reviews.Author: clarkedwards
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the room was great - amazing beds, views and a soaking tub. And location wise, it's perfect. But the whole experience was tainted by the staff, who on the whole were clueless and a little snooty. They really made us feel, well, pretty average...and that we should of been thankful just for being there. The most annoying thing was that the place turned into a nightmare 'bridge & tunnel' type club in the evenings. We had to wade through a crowd of overdressed twits and several meat-head bouncers just to get to the lift. I think the notion of cool left this place a while back. Shame, because on paper this place looks amazing.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is Grand”
Reviews.Author: preppytravellers
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, great for groups who like to stay out late. Two things to be aware of...the elevators are slow. If you get a late checkout, they terminate your key cards at 12 noon...so it is a run around to get back into your room. Other than that...party on.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect New York Experience”
Reviews.Author: cutleran
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the highlights of our 3 week trip to the US. Having stayed in the W Hotel Times Square for 5 nights for the "touristy" intro to New York, this place really made us feel like we were in New York (rather than just another big city). You can literally spend more than a week in and around the walking vicinity of this place. Shopping nearby or in Soho. Eating at funky restaurants like WD-50, Katz's Deli... Then there was the room itself. We went for the Suite, and it was just awesome. Designer furniture and bright white walls (which were freshly re-painted). Excellent toiletries, two flat screens, automatic curtains that reveal a corner room which is pretty much glass all the way round (out one side you are staring right at the empire state building, the other towards the lower manhattan business district). As just another highlight to our stay, on the way down in the lift from our room to the ground floor, none other than lindsay lohan was entering the lift. Its certainly not your Hyatt/Hilton/Sofitel hotel experience because of its surroundings, and those who are so used to that might find it a bit "different" and edgey (you'll be kept awake for a while from the horn honking and happy party people through the "glass" exterior to your bedroom for example on a saturday night), but thats all part of the appeal of this place. Dont bother spending exorbitant prices for a brand name experience in New York that will be the same everywhere. Come here and get the real deal... One thing I would definately recommend though is that our experience could have been very different if i wasn't in one of the rooms on a higher floor. As a travellers tip, I'd definately fork out that little bit extra to ensure I'm above about the 8th/9th floor and above the surrounding buildings.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent modern hotel with a great view”
Reviews.Author: arcticnorth
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel right in one of New York's greatest nightlife neighborhoods. The rooms have a very clean, modern feel to them, with the removed urban backdrop of many floor to cieling windows. This is a full service hotel with all the amenities you would expect, and includes a lounge that is popular at night. The views from our room on the 17th floor were breathtaking, as there arent really any other tall buildings in the immediate area. It was great waking up in the morning and having this view as your first sight. Interesting, clean bathrooms with an elegant minimalistic touch. Extremely comfortable mattresses. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: 449travel
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 day stay at the Hotel on Rivington and it was fantastic! The hotel was hip but still comfortable. It didnt try too hard to be cool, service was excellent, and the floor to ceiling windows in the rooms were awesome. The best part of the hotel had to be the sales director Rob O'DelliBovi (i think he may be Irish) He was so helpful, and made everyone feel like a VIP. (Plus he has an amazing grasp on contemporary urban music...ask him about Skee-Lo). All in all, we had an unforgettable stay at the Hotel On Rivington. I will definitely recommend it to everyone i know traveling to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Alvin08
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 5 night stay in the Hotel on Rivington and would thoroughly recommend it. For us it was in agreat location with loads of bars,restaurants & boutique shops. Soho, East Village, Greenwich Village, Chinatown, Little Italy all within easy walking distance. The room was a good size (great for New York) with a big comfy bed, well stocked mini bar and more than adequate storage space. The bathroom was also a good size with a great shower and quality toiletries. Rooms were cleaned quickly and had nice touches with turn down service. The bar gets very busy and noisy at weekends until late, Loud music would make rooms directly above on levels 3 - 5 very noisy. We were on level 6 at the back of the hotel and could still faintly hear the noise, but was'nt too much of a problem. Plus some of the bar staff think that they are too cool for their own good, can be a bit rude. Not all just the exceptional few. On the whole everyone was very polite and helpful. Would certainly recommend this hotel to people looking for something a bit more individual in a great location away from the madness of Midtown/Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: malachyxxxx
Reviews.Content: great hotel in a great location. one of the few areas in manhattan that still has a bit of it's original character. great record shops, little clothes shops, bars and restaurants, full of character and great food sitting next to puerto rican nail bars and barber shops etc. we had a corner room on the 16th floor with amazing views. the service was frindly and efficient. We didnt spend much time in the bar downstairs but then again why would you when there are so many others around to check out? soho is a 10 minute stroll and williamsburg is a 10 dollar cab ride. recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing the second time round...”
Reviews.Author: Ditagirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel on Rivington for the first time in Dec '06, having found it online. We were blown away by the amazing view from our room, the service and the atmosphere. So, we had no hesitation in booking in the next time we came to NYC, in Dec 07. What a difference a year makes! We booked in to the same standard room and requested a room with a view - and arrived that evening, opened the curtains in our room to be confronted with a brick wall! Nice. We requested a transfer, and were moved the next day, to a room almost $200 more a night, but with a decent view. The hotel has not weathered well in the time it's been opened and it really needs a little TLC. Flaking paint in the bathroom and chipped tiles -the TV was almost falling off it's stand - it's the little details which make the difference, especially when you're paying out of the nose for it! The air con was thunderous, in London I live over a tube line and even that is quieter! The staff are charming at all times, the housekeeping were a little sloppy in that our room was never made up pre-4pm. Room service is 'ok' but nothing spectacular (you're better off wandering around the corner to Starbucks to get your morning coffee!). On weekends the club downstairs is heaving, but the doorstaff were very polite and let us through to the hotel without too much hassle. All in all, I do like this hotel, but with a bill of almost Â£1500 for 4 mediocre nights accommodation, they really need to make it worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great night at the Hotel on Rivington”
Reviews.Author: glyndot
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel on Rivington for one night, with some business colleagues. The hotel is on the Lower East Side of New York, which is a neighborhood in I hadn't been to before , but really liked. Nice and intimate, with cool bars / clubs / restaurants / shops. The hotel is boutiquey, being pretty small, with trendy wallpapers in the communal areas. I found the staff friendly, efficient and knowledgeable (especially the doormen), and had no problems. My room was pretty large, with all the basics you expect, including a very nice shower room, plus a small balcony. My colleague's rooms were all different - one was small but with great views from the 16th floor; another had a hot tub, another had a steam room! The only problem was that the bar served my Hendrick's and tonic with lime, when it should really be served with cucumber. They'll learn!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Belgian_EU
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel over Christmas 2007, having first decided to eat in their restaurant, then having checked the website and the room photos, changed our hotel booking to match. We were upgraded on arrival to a high floor king with soaking tub (room 142) and were very pleasantly surprised to get: - very large room (for New York) with sofa, large wardrobes, extremely large bed, floor-to-ceiling windows, large bathroom and a shower looking out onto New York itself. Breakfast and Wifi included in the price. The room was not well explained - I had to ring down to find the switches for the electric curtains - but otherwise impeccable. And the Tempur-pedic bed was a joy to sleep on. The room was also quiet day and night. They are building a large apartment block nearby, but we heard nothing. The area is a bit rundown, but you are less than 5 mins away from the Delancy-Essex Street metro stop, where the F train will take you up to Midtown very quickly. All in all an excellent hotel, and I would stay there again with pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: WineLover89
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the best hotel in NY! Our room was on the 10th floor with a tub, very spacious (not typical for NY) tidy and extremely clean. The staff was amazing and the gentleman James steals the show. We booked 4 amazing restaurants and two great shows (even though Broadway was on strike) We loved Thor as well (in house restaurant) definitely try it out when you stay at this hotel, overall two thumbs WAY up!

Reviews.Title: “CRY me a river!!!”
Reviews.Author: gr8t88
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were excited to finally have a weekend alone. We booked the Hotel on Rivington after we heard positive feedback from our friends. We were looking forward to a hip, fun, trendy experience on the lower east side. We arrived at the hotel at 5pm to find our room wasn't ready. (we were told on the phone that check in time began at 2p) We had dinner reservations at 7 and had driven two hours (in traffic) so we wanted to shower and relax before we had to leave. When we asked when the room would be ready the desk clerk said "I'm not sure- it could be as long as an hour or so." and walked away. We decided to have a drink while we waited. We ordered two of their signature drinks and it took nearly 20 minutes for them to arrive! When we finally got our drinks, my husband noticed that there was a fly in his drink! When we told the server she offered no apology, but said that she would bring a fresh drink right away. She came back about 10 minutes later with a new drink and our bill. We didn't ask for our bill and were shocked that we were charged for both drinks! We were finally checked in just before 6pm with little time to prepare for dinner. The room left much to be desired- there was a stain on the sheets and a used cottonball on the bathroom floor. The staff wasn't able to secure us reservations at any of the restaurants of our choice so we went with their recommendations. They suggested Gemma at The Bowery Hotel- which we loved! We fell in love with the Hotel too so the next time we stay in NYC we're staying at the Bowery! I left a note for management at the desk at check out, but still haven't recieved a response.

Reviews.Title: “Love Love Love it!!”
Reviews.Author: J0J034
Reviews.Content: We visited The Hotel on Rivington for a 3 night stay to kick off our Honeymoon and was a little dubious when we booked due to a few not so hot reviews. All I can say is anyone visiting this Hotel will have the BEST time. We were put on the 15th Floor in a corner unit with floor to ceiling windows and the views were spectacular, especially at the night time when the city is lit up( there was a fab thunderstorm during our stay and watching it from the room was amazing). The service was second to none with the maid calling twice a day, Reception could not be more helpful, Ren bathroom products restocked each day, great breakfast. The location was excellent, a 5 min walk to SoHo etc and lots of bars and restaruants in the area. The hotel also has a bar and club which are both very cool, and the doormen are very nice & don't look at you as if you are a nobody cause you are not famous (unlike LA!) One word of advice though, the Hotel is situated on the Lower East Side and as its an up and coming area it may look a little scruffy to some, but I must stress its not!! and you will notice some Big name hip hotels are opening in the area which just proves this is the area to be in!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Giulia73
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel located in an area we didn't know so well. The staff was excellent, we got an extra bed for our 10yo daughter free of charge. Check out the bar's furniture. Excellent breakfast in a lovely dining area that becomes a dinner place for hotel guests and non- in the evening. The rooms aren't too big but they are excellently appointed and the madrass is just sooo confortable. Shower was very good too. Come here if this is your first time in New York or if you want to discover a new side of the Big Apple. Very near to Subway and When Harry Met Sally's famour Jewish restaurant. We strongly recommend this hotel for your future stays.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it, fun neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: blackster
Reviews.Content: Made a nice change from the other (excellent) hotels I ususally stay in when in new york. Enjoyed going out in this hipster neighbourhood for comparatively cheap food. Liked the good views through the huge windows in my room and found the food in THOR good. Even enjoyed the silly "MTV cool" of the bar dwellers on the weekend evenings. Would stay again were it not for the fact that there is so much superlative competition in NY.

Reviews.Title: “loved this funky lower east side hotel”
Reviews.Author: clondon
Reviews.Content: the rivington is an interesting place to stay that offers comfy amenities without completely having lost its lower east side edge. front desk staff were helpful and housekeeping and room service were great. the architecture is interesting, having somehow integrated a modern addition (with loads of natural light) in a fluid manner with the existing buidling. we got upgraded to one of the nicer wetrooms, and the bathroom/sauna combo was fantastic. breakfast was great and the bar is fun for drinks and people watching. great location if you like the lower east side, with a number of dive bars and solid restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: kwnNy
Reviews.Content: We used to live in NYC and sometimes stay over when we have social plans and don't want to drive home late. The high floor king room was small, but typical for NYC. The bed was extremely comfortable. I had reserved a rollaway cot for my teen son who was with us, and his bed was also fine. The room was very clean. The spare modern furnishings and simple paint job do tend to show wear and tear, but everything was clean. We had a nice view, and the room was quiet despite the raucous nightlife taking place below us. The valet parking was easy to use and very convenient. The complementary breakfast was simple, but easy to get, and quite good. (bagels cream cheese, coffee, danish and fruit) My one complaint was the lighting in the bathroom . The modern decor was very sexy, but it was a black room with lousy lighting. I couldn't see well enought to put make up on which was annoying. If we needed to be in this part of towna gain we would go back, but we have stayed in other hotels that are comparable for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Time at the Hotel on Rivington”
Reviews.Author: debi.in.london
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from Aug 30 - Sept 1 2007. We were visiting friends in New York for a week, and as it was my birthday on the Friday we thought we'd stay somewhere special. I had read an article on this hotel and thought the floor to ceiling windows would be great, and heard lots of good things about the Lower East Side. When we got to the hotel they showed us to our room, and it turned out to be a basic king room when I had booked a high level corner king with a balcony on their website. We went back down to reception and I showed them my print out of our reservation. They said that there had been an error when updating their website and we had booked the high level with a balcony for the same price as a basic king. I wasn't impressed, and was really disappointed with the basic king, so was going to kick up a real fuss if they said there was nothing they could do. Turns out they looked for the room we originally wanted, but there weren't any available, so they had to put us into a suite at no extra charge! It didn't have a balcony which was disappointing, but the room itself was amazing and on the 12th floor. Apparently this was a $700/night room. It was quite large with a wall of closets, a sitting area with two couches, a bathroom with a massive shower with two showers in one and a view, and a bedroom area with corner windows. It was obvious they were gutted that they had to give us this room for $350, but it was their mistake and put it right with no fuss. The shower was the best I've ever had, the bed was the best I had ever slept in. The views were great to the north, the east side wasn't the greatest but still cool. I didn't notice that the room was shabby. Room service was prettty good, we did get apples and cookies left by the bed, though when we called to have something picked up for drycleaning it took them a while to pick it up, but we were around anyways so it didn't matter. The staff were all friendly and helpful. The only thing was that I had mentioned in the reservation that it was my birthday and did they do anything special for that, and where most hotels would give you a bottle of champagne, we got nada. They probably thought they had done enough by giving us the suite!! Also we had some friends back to the suite after dinner for some champagne and they were happy to bring up some extra champagne glasses if it did take a bit of time. We had dinner in THOR on my birthday and the food was really good and the restaurant looked great. The only thing I could say was that it was a little empty until about 10-10:30pm. The bar was really nice with good cocktails, though we did have a bit of a pain trying to sit down in it late on a Friday night, apparently they would rather leave the couches empty in case someone who wants to buy bottles of booze comes along, but saying that once they found out we had just eaten there they took us and my friends who had just arrived straight to a couch and sadly it did make us feel a bit special..... but only saying that we were staying at the hotel didn't mean much, we had to say we had just eaten there. It was very lively and cool on a Friday night and there was a line to get in outside. The Lower East Side is a fantastic area in New York. Really lively and lots of nice bars and restaurants. I would really recommend this hotel, but I would definitely recommend that you pay extra for a high level and better room, otherwise there is no point. The basic king we first saw was disappointing for the price I thought. It was pretty basic with not a lot of windows and a dark and unspecial bathroom. Pay the extra and get a better room. We'll definitely be going back there and sadly will have to go for the high corner king instead of the suite, but I'm sure it will be great too.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool”
Reviews.Author: strahd9
Reviews.Content: My stay there on Tue 9/25- Thur 9/27 was very good. I opted for here cause since I can't afford Abby Road, I took the Moby Road musical get away (he used the hotel for album art for his Hotel CD). :) The workers from desk to doorman to THOR were all very pleasent and helpfull. I liked the locactioning alot. It was close to alot of different eateries nearby. From Vegan (TeaNY) to delis (Katz from Harry Met Sally). A good range for all tastes. The room was a pretty good size, not as small as I feared a NY room would be. The only bad things I could think of was little things like a nick in the drywall, a small tear on my blanket and no ice machines on the floors (maybe I'm just not use to non chain hotels). And I will agree that you'll probably want to go as high up as you can afford. I got a 4th floor room facing north. Which would have been great had there not been a apt across to the side from me. But I didn't mind it much. It's a very alive area at night. It wasn't loud or bad durring the midweek, but might get loud durring the weekend? Overall I had a great time and enjoyed my stay. Hopefully next year I can afford another return and maybe my Mets will win that game. :)

Reviews.Title: “Hip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gomo42
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Hotel on Rivington for one night. It was a little hard to find the hotel since the hotel does not have sign outside of the building. The hotel sticks out since it is the tallest building around the area. They have vallet parking which was simple and easy. The doorman brought us into the hotel and showed us the elevator which you take to the second floor to check in. The first floor has a bar and restaraunt, which was very busy at night. The bar opened up onto the street so there was a nice breeze and it was nice to people watch while enjoying a drink. Our room was ready upon arrival. There was a nice lounge near the reservation desk that looks out towards the busy street. Our room was on the 9th floor. Heads up the hallways are very dark and the room numbers are lit up. The room was very nice. There are huge windows which you can sort of open. We had a pretty good view. We could see the Empire State Building. There was a couch and desk with portable phones. The bathroom was somewhat small and very dark. There was a flatscreen tv and plenty of closet space. Our beds were turned down for us and we also got an apple. The neighboorhood was different from what we were used to. There were many clubs/bars on the street so there were lots of young people around. It was not the cleanest of neighboorhoods and there were not a lot of shops around the area. The doormen outside the hotel were the best. They were very helpful with getting taxis and telling us about the local area. All the employees were very nice and went out of their way to help us. We would go back to the hotel but just be aware its not the best of locations in the city but the hotel makes up for that!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Horrible View from the Room”
Reviews.Author: LAGeographer
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in an interesting and vibrant part of town. The hotel bar and local clubs are hoping even during the week. I was happy with everything about the hotel except the view from the room. Like one other reviewer, I specifically requested NOT to be put on a lower floor and I was put on the 5th floor, which for this hotel is definitely a lower floor. The view was horrible and looked out onto an alley and into people's apartments, and yes that means their apartments looked directly into my room. This might not sound so bad except that the shower wall is only half frosted glass, which means anyone in a floor higher than 5 in the adjacent building can look directly into the shower and bathroom, which can be a little uncomfortable and I'm no prude. I complained and asked for a higher room but was told no rooms were available. I believe this to be completely untrue given the significant number of dark windows for the duration of my 4 day stay and the low level of traffic in the hotel. I didn't pay rack rate but could have gotten in an equally nice hotel with a much better view for far less. Given the horrible NON-view, I opted to not spend any time in my room at all, which is a shame because the actual room itself was quite comfortable. For the business traveler, if you're looking to work from your room, forget it, there is no desk space and the T1 lines are hidden behind the furniture. Over-all, if you don't care about a view or are willing to pay full price to get one, this is an okay place to stay. I for one am not going to recommend it to anyone given the "screw you attitude of the staff", which is apparent even when they offer an obviously insincere, "I'm sorry" if you express dissatisfaction with any aspect of the hotel. Two thumbs up for location and two thumbs down for their lower floors and the staff's "screw you attitude" the management. The experience is being WAY oversold on their website.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful and beautiful experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jnr2007
Reviews.Content: my wife and I stayed there for 2 nights - one before and one after our wedding night. it was great - the place designed in a modern beautiful way, our room had a japanese style bath and a king size bed that make you wont stay in bed all the day long... the breakfast we ordrered to our room from the hotel resturant was one of the best hotel's breakfast i ever had! the best part was that our order which was for a low floor and no bath tab room, was upgraded in our arrival for a hi-floor and a huge tab - in a lower price!!! there was some other small things that made this experience even better - in our wedding night some friends came to our room and one of them, drank as hell, ordered quite a few movies and music from the "on demand". when we checked out the lovely receptionist canceled it upon my wierd explantion... ...or the lovely woman in the hotel's bar that with her lovely smile made our night even better! thank you wonderful stuff, thank you smart developer that open this hotel in the middle of Manhattan's lower east side! we as a newyorkers would recomend this place to everyone who wants to stay in the trendy lower east side and can afford it!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a disaster. A total catastrophe.”
Reviews.Author: coryhussain
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Rivington on December 3rd 2006. We were told at the time of the booking directly that we would be put in a medium room with unobstructed views of Manhattan. We never requested a room with any additional amenities or luxuries othert than one simple request that it be a medium room with a city view as advertised on the website for the hotel. Needless to say, we got a room facing the alley and overlooking the glass ceiling of the restaurant in the hotel lobby. On trying to bring it to the attention of the hotel staff, we were snubbed and told that due to the lack of any further vacancies, we would have to contact Manuela Kolb, the manager of Hotel Rivington during our time there. We were not able to get a hold of her at the time of our stay, so resorted to emailing her after returning back for an explanation. Having paid well over 900 dollars for a 2 night stay in a medium room that according to the website said that it had unobstructed views, anyone can imagine our dismay. She insisted that the room was what we had 'asked' for and given the reservations to, when to my insistence our experience was to the contrary. To this day, she has not replied to our emails and the staff has not offered a satisfactory explanation. It is to my dismay that having heard so highly of this hotel, we were left with such distaste on the response of the management. I would have expected resolution of the situation quickly haivng acknowledged the decor and the reputation of this hotel. But the lack of integrity in dealing with any disputes probably ranks higher than the lack of a simple amenity we had repeatedly requested prior to coming to the hotel and willing to pay for... an unobstructed view as promised.

Reviews.Title: “Definately needs more experience”
Reviews.Author: bcc7
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay on this hotel for our anniversary trip to New York, and after what I considered a long and thorough investigation we thought that this hotel was what we had in mind, and even thought Hotel on Rivington is not that bad, I have to say that it was not what we had in mind at all. On the upside, the hotel is beautiful and the concept is great, location is wonderful since itâ€™s on the lower side and Soho is walking distance. The rooms are minimalist yet stylish and the bed is definitely dreamy, as well as the bathroom and THOR. On the downside, the service is not that great, it needs more experience, such as the great service that you find in established hotels like The Palace, where the staff is incredibly helpful and nice. Our room had a balcony with a not so nice view and the worse part was that on the weekend we could listen to the music and laughter in THOR even though we were on a much higher level (we had trouble sleeping to be exact!). Letâ€™s give this hotel some more time and experience and then Iâ€™m sure it will be a great place, but for now, I think we wonâ€™t be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “A stylish boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Buben
Reviews.Content: I agree with other reviewers that travelers should consider what they want out of their trip to NYC before booking at the Rivington. If you want to spend most of your time seeing Broadway shows and visiting museums, you might be better off in midtown or uptown. But if you would like to be near the Village and Soho, the Rivington is a stylish choice. My husband and I stayed here three nights over a long weekend in July. We had room 113 on the 11th floor, which was a king room. It is a corner unit, with wall to ceiling glass windows on two sides. The bathroom has both a shower (with frosted glass windows, so you get the feeling of showering in front of an open window in the city), and a soaking tub. Toiletries are nice and replenished daily. The design of the hotel is funky and cool. The room is by no means large, but it is well-designed and perfectly fine (hotel rooms in NYC are definitely smaller than average). The continental breakfast is pretty good. There is coffee, whole pieces of fruit, cereal, pastries, and bagels. The bagels and pastries are from a bakery. The downsides â€“ no juice, tea, or water. I suppose these could have been tracked down if we had gotten a waiter to help, which we didnâ€™t do. I gave the hotel four rather than five stars because (1) there is no music in the hotel â€“ you have to pay $10 to play a â€œjukeboxâ€� on the TV for 120 minutes â€“ a total ripoff, I think. A CD player is standard in this kind of place; (2) the NY Times was not delivered to the door; (3) ice was quite difficult to track down (no ice bucket in room, I was put on hold when I called for it, and finally went to lobby restaurant and got some); (4) no tea/water at breakfast. I found service good. Upon check-in, there was no bellman to help with my bags (my husband was parking). The man behind the desk helped me instead. When I looked for ice, the hostess helped me track it down, even though the restaurant was quite busy. The club is hopping on Friday and Saturday nights. We did not hear a thing in our room, but I can imagine that rooms on the lower floors might be quite noisy. I would watch out for this if booking a less expensive room. We didnâ€™t order from room service, but it looked to be quite inexpensive, which was a good thing. The minibar was also well stocked and quite inexpensive (in other NYC hotels, I have seen water being sold for $10!) I did not feel a bit unsafe in this neighborhood at any point. There were plenty of normal looking people out on the street barhopping and clubbing, and I never felt that weird â€œweâ€™re the only ones on an empty street with only a strange-looking man across from usâ€� feeling. The LES is one of the more interesting sections of NYC these days, and if you are looking for a stylish place to stay, the Rivington is a solid choice.

Reviews.Title: “Think about what you want out your NY trip...”
Reviews.Author: have$willtravel
Reviews.Content: I have been to NY several times and I did enjoy my Rivington stay, BUT, it's not for everyone. I loved the LES - there were great restaurants, shops and bars - all with a very hip vibe. Our room was a suite on the 14th floor with views to die for. I could see all the way to mid-town from the front room and the bedroom and from the other side of the bedroom, we could see the financial district. With no other buildings to hamper our view, it was fantastic! The room decor is spare and modern. The mini bar is large enough to put your own wine and cheese in and is stocked with some fun, sexy items. I had initial misgivings about the Tempurpedic bed (I thought it would be too soft) but my fears were unfounded, as I slept like a baby. The housekeeping staff did a good job of keeping things clean and well stocked. Room service is prompt and expensive, but, hey, what room service isn't? Now I did stay for a whole week and as the days progressed closer to the weekend, so did the noise from the street. Folks, it's a party down there and if you don't have a room on a higher floor you might as well join the partyers because there will be no sleep for you. We were on the 14th floor and still could hear the noise from the bars across the street. On the plus side, during the day the area is a peaceful. The bathroom is spacious and the shower was huge with great water pressure and a view. I did not have a room with a soaking tub. If you are looking for the Times Square/Broadway/Central Park experience, you may want to book a hotel closer to mid-town so you don't spend your time in taxis or on the subway. I would stay here again. I loved the artsy neighborhood and yeah, it can be a little gritty, but I never felt unsafe. I loved that I could go into a dress shop and actually see the owner designing her dresses or the shoe shop and see the owner making his (very expensive) shoes and purses I loved the small restuarants and bars that seem to come alive at night. Oh yeah, check out the Italian wine bar across the street - very good food and also go to 1492 on Clinton street for the best mojitos in NY (great paella too!).

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: humejon
Reviews.Content: I arrived Friday after a 3 hour delay in Nashville and all I wanted to do was get to my room. Unfortunately, the room was not ready until 3, which is exceptable and pretty normal. I went down to THOR and asked for a scotch, the bartender was quite rude and short. After that i was not very excited b/c all the reviews had said great customer service. Drank my scotch and went back to check in. I had requested a top floor and a japanese tub b/c of the one year anniversary. I got to the 11th (not very high) and no japanese tub. I called down to the desk and Adam answered and said since i booked several months ago he would see what he could do. He called back and i was given room 153. A corner room with a japanese tub and nice view of the city. After the move everything was glorious. We ordered room service that was delivered in 15 min. ususally it takes 30-45minutes. There is some definite truth to most of the reviews about the hotel being a little beat up. there were small scratches on the wall and one of our chairs had some sort of stain on it. For how new the hotel is there shouldnt be these issues. But as long as you see past them your stay will be wonderful. I really enjoyed my stay at Hotel on Rivington and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Funky & Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Alirog
Reviews.Content: This is our second visit to Hotel On Rivington, last time the builders were still in so we wanted to see the finished product. We were not disappointed. We had a large room on 16th floor with downtown view, balcony, exterior shower & soaking tub. I would recommend this room type if you can afford to splash out a little. The bed is amazing, got great nights sleep, the bathroom was pretty cool, although took a little getting used to the glass wall to outside! The hotel itself is in the Lower East Side area of Manhattan & I would recommend it if you have been to New York before & want to stay somewhere a bit different. There are loads of great bars & restaurants within walking distance of hotel & subway stop is just around the corner. We found the breakfast to be fine, if a little limited & all the staff we encountered were all keen to help. Overall a great base to choose for a memorable stay in NYC

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: fan987
Reviews.Content: I have visited NY many times but have rarely visited the LES. I can now say it is one of the more interesting areas of NY. Its refreshing after long days around the Central Park/ Times Square area. The hotel stands out among the other buildings in the neighborhood but it really works. The staff if very welcoming and the design in the entrance-area nice. The bar/restaurant design is also nice but I have seen more interesting in other ny hotels like the mercer, gansevoort. Food at Thor for breakfast is good but overpriced. You get a free breakfast too but this is just muffins, coffee, etc. What really stands out about this hotel is the rooms. I was on the front of the 10th floor and wow what an awesome view of the ny skyline. I love the floor to ceiling windows. The tempur-pedic mattress was heaven, as was the shower pressure. I love how you can take a shower (it was actually double headed) and look out at the city. We were there on fri-sat and the bar was extremely busy both nights. We avoided it - it was too packed for its own good. Also, they play the music louder than the sound systems can really handle. Overall staff and clientele is pretty attractive. Many Europeans staying here. Would definately stay here again for the room.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel !”
Reviews.Author: carotpa
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel after staying 2 nights in midtown. As it was our first time to NY we were a little worried about the area when we arrived at Rivington street. However our worries soon disappeared when we got to know LES and our way around. Its a great place and much nicer and more interetsing than the touristy areas. Our room was really really nice. The view was amazing - we were on the 16th floor and having the little balcony was so nice. The room itself is so big and furished really modern just what you expect. The bed linen was gorgeous (frette - so it should be!) And the little touches on the room are great. The bathroom was my favourite (lovely yellow mosaic tiles!) The ren products in the bathroom were brilliant also. The only thing I would say about the room is it needs a little attention as the carpets, paintwork and overall finish looks a little worn and tired and when you are spending $400 + a night you expect things like this to be perfect. The breakfast was ok , nice fresh coffee and pastries BUT I was not happy at being charged Â£6 for a small glass of orange juice. Ridiculous!!!!! Overall the hotel is great, nice, buzzy and young! No stuffy business travellers! the area is also great and the choice of resturants is unbelievable! We will definatley return very soon .

Reviews.Title: “Tries too hard to be FAB but pretty good overall”
Reviews.Author: ThomasAlek
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel over the Easter Weekend. As everyone by now knows this hotel is located in the LES, so people that stay here WANT to stay here - no tour buses (thank god) or tour groups. Guests were mostly European (heavy on English accents) with very few North Americans - I think the location scares the businessmen. GOOD: Front Desk Service was pretty good from the young (but def. not model looking) staff. Housekeeping did a great job, Doorman were great guys with taxi requests. Steam Shower is amazing - never seen that in a standard room anywhere before. The rooms are HUGE by NYC standards. I am sure my "Regular" room was bigger than most Manhattan apartments. Comp Breaky with coffee, pastries, ham, cheese and bagels (but no juice - gotta pay for that) was sufficient and more than most hotels give you. Wait staff was seriously flaky and obviously did not want to be there. Their regular rates seem high but comparing it with other NYC hotels of similar caliber it is not bad. This hotel is a good deal if you get it for under $300 (which I did) BAD: The much lauded Beds were not all THAT. I personally prefer the Westin Bed. Room was spare, minimalist to the extreme. For a relatively new hotel the furnishings and finishes are already seriously scuffed and dirty. Tables, carpets, chairs, etc are all showing major wear and tear and will need replacement soon. This is a PARTY Hotel. The Bar and Resto was crazy packed Fri and Sat night with everyone and their mother. The guests in the room next to mine decided to throw their own party and it took many calls to security to break it up (they had like over 50 people in their room!) The original construction of this hotel is poor if the guests can see it (which we can) paper thin walls, poorly cut carpets, badly laid tiles, etc..I think this place was built in a hurry. OVERALL: Pretty much satisfied with my stay and not surprised as the previous reviews are pretty much accurate. BTW The LES is a great hood to stay in (net yet TOO trendy) to still get the real non touristy NYC (but hurry). Hear that Soho?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place”
Reviews.Author: DarrenLewis
Reviews.Content: Funky, cool, hip are the words that you'd associate with this hotel - not much to look at from the outside (well at street level) but once inside it's just those words! Staff are helpful and friendly or certainly were when I was there! Rooms on the higher floors are spacious and the view is terrific. Bathrooms exceptional - the Japanese soaking tub was great just a shame my partner wasn't travelling with me! Had dinner in THOR and it was great - buzzy atmosphere, good service and the duck ravioli was to die for!!! As for location, yes it's not really salubrious but not subway just around the corner, and it's not far to Chinatown, Little Italy etc etc. I'd say more bohemian than upmarket but felt comfortable walking around! A $15 taxi ride from central park and a great base for lower Manhattan! Great for couples with a passion for style and rock and roll!
