Reviews.Title: “Unique location for a hotel, Extremely Modern, Very Sexy”
Reviews.Author: Indus5
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a saturday night at Hotel on Rivington and we loved it. From the unconventional layout, to the glass curtain walling, to the voyeuristic shower walls, everything about this place screams hedonistic pleasure. The service was prompt, the staff were friendly. But the real joy is in the rooms itself. We booked the lowest rate ($255) so we were not too high up (7th). However we got a corner room which is entirely glassed on two sides, had a balcony and gives you an amazing feeling of being out in the open. Granted we were on the inside space but we were high enough that the view wasn't totally obstructed and we could see the Williamsburg bridge in the distance. The bed is one of the best beds I've slept in. The shower and bathroom are very modern, although my wife was embarassed at using the shower because some of the windows aren't frosted so anyone looking up can totally see you if they're paying attention. Maybe thats part of the reason that people want to stay here: watch and be watched. You shouldn't be entirely surprised that the hotels cash bar also includes a sex games book, vibrator and binoculars! Suffice to say, my wife and I had a very satisfying weekend. Its not a Marriott or businessman/tourist trap by any means. Its for the traveler or couple that's looking for a truly unique stay in Manhattan. The lounge downstairs is very chic bumping at night, so you don't have to go far to have fun. Given the location, all of Soho and the village are in close proximity. We even got street parking since we got there in the afternoon on saturday. Breakfast is included which is an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel, it's my New York home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: Tamster18
Reviews.Content: It took us ages to decide on a hotel for our recent trip to New York, but I'm so glad we made our choice with the Rivington. Based in the Lower East Side, you couldn't get much hipper. everything, and i mean everything you could need is on your doorstep-bars, resturants you name it. It was such a major effort not be lazy and wander to yet another fabulous little abode for our evenings entertainment. On arrival we did have a slight quibble as there was no doorman and the reception area isn't immediately obvious(it's on the 2nd floor). However this was instantly dismissed when we were greeted by very friendly and helpful reception staff. Our room...well it was amazing. If you like contemporary furnishings , and neutral tones , with amazing views then this place is for you. If you like , more traditional/or floral decor then this will not work for you. The bathroom was a delight-views from the bath can't be missed looking out over the city , you just can't beat it. Oh and did i say the tub is definitely big enough for two.The tempur bed makes every nights sleep dreamy...There was nothing wrong with our room in the slightest , however our neighbour smoked and we could smell this in our bathroom.Not being smokers it made us feel a bit sick .After a quick chat with the reception staff they moved us (i mean literally ) to another room without a quibble to another room with amazing views of city up and downtown.A free breakfast included in the price, nothing fancy . However if you want to push the boat out the food in the hotel is AMAZING! And if your lucky enough to be there over the weekend then maybe you'll be served by Giles the lovely waiter. That said , i found the level of service not on the same level as that in the hotel.I felt that some of the waiting staff were more concerned with networking than the job they were being paid to do.If you're feeling tired though, the hotel bar is the place to be, the music rocks, the cocktails rock and thre is a really eclectic crowd to observe.Oh i forgot to mention free internet use if you haven't remembered your laptop. And just because they were so lovely the reception staff really do get a huge thumbs up, no question was too inane and they were full of advice, tips and helpful information.We won't be staying anywhere else. The Rivington is the bomb!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: travel-agentSaoPaulo
Reviews.Content: IÂ´m a travel agent and I travel quit often. For my surprise I went to to Hotel on Rivington as a friend indication, and he coundt have been more right. The hotel is amazing in a quiet and trendy neigbohood. The staff were impeccable, I felt like a princess. Hotel on Rivington is one of the few hotel in NYC that includes breakfast. A good breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “BEST of the trendy boutique-like hotels! Luxury”
Reviews.Author: subgum
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many of the New York 'boutique' hotels, I have a penchant for modern, clean design. I've totally given up on the once proud Morgans group> the Hudson, Morgans and the Royalton each have their major downsides. I even tried some newer boutique places like DREAM. NIGHT , the LIBRARY, and the classics like the Gansevoort and the Maritime... This place takes the cake in terms of value, ameneties, and decor. Even the least expensive room [275] was at least 3 times larger than a room twice that much at the Hudson, and it had a balcony! They upgraded me for free to a medium King, which had glass walls on both corners of a corner room, the view was spectacular! and for not a buck more! The people were friendly, the room service was spectacular from THOR the place downstairs... It was an anniversary from heaven.

Reviews.Title: “Rivington Rip Off”
Reviews.Author: 2dboy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is over priced for what you get. I travel to NYC quite often and thought I would treat myself to a nicer hotel this time around. The Rivington was advertised as a boutique style hotel and the room was about $350 a night. When I arrived, it took a long time to get my room. The elevator was so small, and the lobby was nothing special - I started to worry when I got off on my floor and the smell was overwhelming. The whole area had a gassy smell. Disgusting. The room was small, and the decor very tired. Sure, it had a duvet on the bed, but big deal. The furniture is old, the quality of the wood bad, and the room small. Very small. Imagine my surprise when I open the curtains and am facing a brick wall. Nice. For $350, I want a view. I marched donwstairs to ask to be moved to a higher floor - how funny that someone else in front of me in line was complaining about the same things. I had to seriouslly fight for a better room - they did not want to accomodate me. Finally after about 30 minutes, they moved me up to a "city view" room which was just as bad - had a view, but nothing great. The smell was not as bad on this floor. Needless to say, I stayed one night and moved to the Millenium Hilton the next day, where I got a jr. suite for $250 (walk in rate). Be warned, this hotel is not good.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nirvana”
Reviews.Author: andrawatkins
Reviews.Content: The Hotel on Rivington is one of the best boutique deals in the City. The sleek rooms are well appointed with super comfy bed and linens, glassed in shower with a view, superior toiletries. On the floors above 8, the views can go for miles. If you are shy, this hotel may bother you because at least 2 walls in the room are entirely glass, and a wall in the bathroom is also glass. Wrap around motorized black-out curtains are installed for privacy. This hotel was on a relatively quiet street in an up and coming neighborhood, a short walk to Chinatown, SoHo and the Village. Breakfast was included with our room, and it was served in the funky restaurant downstairs. Our room was always clean when we returned. The water pressure in the shower was amazing. I didn't want to get out! We would absolutely stay here again when visiting NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Joseph8
Reviews.Content: Excelent hotel. Staff is friendly and welcoming, the restaurant is out of this world, room is ample, great bed, incredible views, clean, bathroom is big an full of nice touches (as the floor heater). The Hotel on Rivington is in a class by itself....totally reccomended!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pcassey76
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my stay at the hote on rivington. It was a get away weekend from my girlfriend and I and we couldn't have had a better experience. We had a great room with such a breathtaking view at night. The service was great and all the employees went out of their way to make us feel so welcome. We were both first time visitors and we fell in love with Ny and this hotel. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone looking for great rooms and service.

Reviews.Title: “Very Cool for School”
Reviews.Author: CRGBucks
Reviews.Content: The only negative I would have for the Rivington is its location. A definite cab ride from the main attractions, on arrival after basically a day of travelling the hotel is anything but welcoming. However, do not let that put you off. This place is ice cool, and surrounds with you every comfort to ensure you have an enjoyable stay. The piece de resistance is the view, the glass frontage providing some dramatic windows to the Manhattan skyline. We were upgraded to a suite for our first wedding anniversary, and I have rarely had a better night's sleep on the super-comfy bed. The service was good, but not spectacular, although our general experience of NY courtesy was surprisingly disappointing, so the Rivington's service levels were above average in comparison. If you are looking for a safe chain hotel in the heart of the city the Rivington is definitely not for you. However, if you're after something a little different and cutting edge, give the Rivington a go.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable but location-challenged”
Reviews.Author: MangoChetney
Reviews.Content: We joined our teenage daughter on a expense paid trip to NYC for a modeling shoot and her agency selected and paid $375 a night for a standard room, Rm. 85. We stayed 2 nights. The hotel is indeed an oasis in the lower east side neighborhood. The service staff, bellmen, food servers are outstanding -- they give Four Seasons kind of attention and make this place a wonderful stay. We moved to the Waldorf Astoria for the weekend and would have loved to see this kind of service. We ate dinner both nights in the hotel (because the neighborhood was intimidating to us at night). Pork chops, steak, fish and drinks were very good. The decor and the rooms are upbeat and stylish. The beds were great. No complaints from us.

Reviews.Title: “More Hype Than Hip”
Reviews.Author: NoahJenda
Reviews.Content: After taking a tour of the hotel on a previous trip, we booked the top level "large" room for $475 a night. We were seriously disappointed at the "bait and switch" tactics used - the room we got was not anywhere near as nice as the room they had shown us in our tour, although it was at the same price level. Our room had a filthy, sticky bathroom and curtains that didn't cover the whole windows and were too thin to block out the lights of the city. My wife got no sleep the night before a big job interview. We ended up switching to another hotel at 6:30am so we could use a decent bathroom. Even the "hip" Japanese soaking tub was a disappointment. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. No more "hip" hotels for us.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and credit card busting!”
Reviews.Author: sadysady
Reviews.Content: New York is my favourite city in the world and the LES is my favourite neighbourhood so I was hugely excitied when I found out that a new luxury hotel had opened there and immediately rushed to book. I was aware that the hotel was fairly newly opened so expected that there may be some issues. Unfortunately some of the disappointment I experienced was nothing to do with newness - rather there is just a really bad finish to some of the fittings. Given the supposed standard of this hotel I would have expected better. First class hotels need a first class finish - that is what customers are paying for. I have a horrible feeling that the rivington hopes to attract the kind of guests to whom shelling out big money is nothing. I'm not one of these guests - this was a big treat for me and was supposed to be my first experience of a really good new york hotel. I was particulary shocked by the lack of music in the rooms - having to pay for the privelege when the rooms are so expensive seems really mean. On check out we were informed that we could have had an i-pod docking station, however this was not mentioned when we checked in and was no-where in the hotel literature. Also - even if we had been mad enough to pay for music in our rooms - the selection was dismal. Not what one would expect from a hotel situated right in the heart of New York's hippest music area and presumably targetting the kind of audience who want to hang out in local bars, clubs and gig venues. My biggest disappointment was the view (or lack of) I was of the impression that even the cheaper rooms had great views of the skyline - wrong!! all I could see was the restaurant and the fairly grimy back yard. On the plus side - and yes there were some - the basic design of the hotel is good and the staff were very friendly. The bed was AMAZING - don't think I have ever slept so well, and the mid level bar was really nice and cosy. However I can't shake off the feeling that the price is just to high for what is on offer, and I know that when I was there I was still getting quite a good deal as not everything was complete. The rates have gone up substantially in the last year. If I could afford it I would perhaps still book a room, but only because of where it is. When the LES Thompson opens next year this hotel is seriously going to have to raise it's game.

Reviews.Title: “stylish”
Reviews.Author: Tomana
Reviews.Content: we loved it here. with a suite on the 10th floor, floor to ceiling windows all round the room and a floor to ceiliing window (tinted half way up!) in the shower there were amazing views over manhattan. the bed was huge and comfy and even just the treat of opening the blinds by remote control to see the empire state building in the distance made it worth every penny. the hotel is in the trendy lower east side district, so gets a bit noisy around there at night, esp as there is a cool bar on the ground floor. everything about the place is stylish and the service was perfectly good. breakfast was worth getting up for, altho you did have to pay for anything but the basics. highly recommend it, esp to young couples looking for a cool but comfortable place

Reviews.Title: “Hip Lower East Side Oasis”
Reviews.Author: Marco-Mintwithhole
Reviews.Content: Achingly trendy but we got a good deal through Quikbooks - worth trying. Hotel minimalist in style but still quite comfortable spacious rooms. To get rooms with a view back up to midtown Manhattan you probably have to be on about the tenth floor or above. Ate in the restaurant once. Pretty good. Breakfast buffet included in the room rate .. not that common in the US. Provided a very adequate start to the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great swanky hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nic6191974
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rivington on July 20th and was very pleased with my stay. My only complaint was that the hotel/valet service was not adequately represented so I actaully drove by the hotel and had to go around the block, call the hotel and ask where the valet was. My room was very spacious for a NYC hotel and the bed was extremely comfortable. The staff was friendly and the bellhops were accomodating. I would def stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Two Thumbs Way Up High in the Sky!”
Reviews.Author: call_me_a_cab
Reviews.Content: Weâ€™ve had several favorite hotels in NYC, but the Hotel on Rivington beats all. We recently returned from a long weekend, and have nothing but praise. For those of you who enjoy details: It was pouring rain when we arrived, and Noel the valet was quick to take our car keys and help Lester the bellman with our luggage. It was 11:00 in the morning, and our large corner room was not yet ready, but another person at the front desk said â€œwe have an even better room, on a higher floor (19), thatâ€™s available now.â€� I made sure it had all my requirements â€“ no smoking, king-sized bed, corner room, same rate. Yes, yes, yes, yes. So we were able to check in to our absolutely GORGEOUS room several hours early. The view was spectacular, bright, airy, very clean. Even though I was born & raised in NYC, Iâ€™ve never seen a view like this. We were way up in the sky! There was plenty of space in the bathroom to accommodate two people, which is very unusual, especially in NY. A shelf to put personal stuff would have been helpful, instead of just the flat counter on the left side of the sink, but thatâ€™s a small complaint, given the fact that both of us could wash up, and both of us could shower at the same time. Shower had great water pressure, and there was plenty of piping hot water for long, leisurely showers. Yes, this hotel is wonderful for couples. A burnt-out bulb in the lamp was changed immediately. A couple of pens would have been handy to jot down phone numbers, but thatâ€™s a minor complaint. The common hallway was very dark (I could have used a minerâ€™s helmet) but I think the effect theyâ€™re going for is stark contrast. The hallways are so dark, and then you open the door to your room, and the light is so bright!! The area is buzzing with activity. Thereâ€™s plenty of action, restaurants, bars, shopping, etc. The location is loaded with history, and there are wonderful places to walk, including Lower East Side, Chinatown, Wall Street, SoHo, Greenwich Village, Flatiron District. Getting our car back at check-out was a breeze. It took no more than 10 minutes. And a word about the staff: Beautiful? Sure. Nose-up attitude? Definitely NOT. I was treated with charm and respect during my entire stay. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. All thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “They have made corrections”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently submitted a review/story explaining my experience. The general manager quickly responded to me and corrected the problem. I will take him at his word that corrections have been made to correct the issues identified and look forward to giving the Hotel on Rivington another try.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel off the tourist trail”
Reviews.Author: Jesse_Holmes
Reviews.Content: This is a 'boutique' hotel in the Lowr East Side - quite an 'edgy' area. Lots of cool bars and eating places close by. A short walk takes you to Soho or the East Village. Room (Medium King)was fab - amazing views over Lower Manhattan from two walls of full height glass (including the shower!). Unusual finishes are used throughout, but are showing signs of wear and tear in places. Staff all very friendly and helpful when required. Not a place for families though...

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably Disappointing and Unimpressive”
Reviews.Author: supssy
Reviews.Content: To be quite honest, my husband and I have stayed at many luxury hotels. This one claims to be luxurious, but in terms of service, being responsive to customer's needs, cleanliness of the rooms, amenities, and price. It supremely fails in every category. In addition, the staff are inexperienced and you can tell--have no background on hospitality or understand common courtesy (or is common sense a better word). For example, when we called to check if we could check-in one hour early while we were heading into New York City, the reservationist told us to come by (the hotel) and they would see if they could work something out. We get to the hotel and THEN are told that there were no rooms to be checked into until 3PM (check-in time) because they are booked, We wasted our time going there.. they could have told us earlier. We wait until 3PM on a couch near the receptionist. When 3PM approaches, we are told that they don't have our reserved room. We wait until 3:15PM and are told that we have been upgraded because of the inconvenience. We of course take this as a bonus... However, when we reach our room, the " large suite" which is nice, but NOT worth the $$$$ (I am telling you guys, don't waste your money) it smelled of stale cigar smoke (the smell reminded me of a OTB joint). So immediately, we go back to the lobby and ask for a new room. We get our new room and it's not much better. It isn't even clean. But we thought, what are the chances they would change our rooms again without them thinking we're being prima donnas (which is totally justifiable when spending $400 plus a night). I don't think the room was ever cleaned before they gave it to us. because days later when we checked out, we were charged for an intimacy kit that we didn't even use. It was ridiculous when I called to complain about the charge, the guy giggled when he described what was in the kit. It was pretty humilating. There is little professionalism when it comes to this hotel, I tell you. Also, when calling to speak to the manager, you never get him. It's impossible to reach the man. So if you guys have any complaints, good luck trying to get any attention or resolution. Your words fall on deaf ears. I also must complain about the food as well. Maybe at the restaurant and possibly for dinner, Thor is considered good. However, for breakfast, it was edible at best... and to top it all of... the simple breakfast came close to $50 for two people. It's not the expense as much as what you got for it... If you are the type that expects the full package when spending a lot of money, this is not the place to stay. The only thing the place offers are cool windows. I'm in the design industry and our "large suite" was kinda unimpressive. I expected better decor. Especially after all the press. This hotel reminds me of the Standard Hotel on Sunset Blvd., in L.A.. Thumbs down!!! Won't stay here again.... rather stay at the Soho Grand, or many other places for the amount. Cooler neighborhood and better service.

Reviews.Title: “Hot Hotel for Cool Kids”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nobody else mentioned how much of a nightclub scene there is - at least on the Friday and Saturday we were there. AWESOME tempur-pedic beds, cool design. I liked the views from the floor-to-cieling glass walls, but they don't provide a lot of insulation on a cold night. The bathroom floor was FREEZING (we couldn't get the heated tiles to work). Our fellow guests were mostly hip, thirty-something tourists. We heard a lot of British accents and there was the same big group of Germans in the bar every evening. (By the way; there is NO rooftop pool or bar - only on the ground floor and second floor). Staff was friendly, and checkin/checkout was easy. We got to have a 2pm late checkout, and the bellman stored the bags. I just wish they had showed us how to use the curtains, tv , telephone, etc. (lots of high-tech stuff with hard to find buttons) Overall, we really like the place. And it seems to be the IT place to be right now. Lenny Kravitz was hanging out one night. When we checked-in we shared the tiny elevator with a camera crew and a very tall model. We rode the elevator to the top floor with them "by accident" and saw the Victoria's Secret photoshoot going on in the penthouse suite (huge, sprawling space, fantastic views). My boyfriend was ga-ga eyed. The photographer was not amused and slammed the door in my face.

Reviews.Title: “Jaw-dropping views!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The neighborhood around the hotel looks a little scary; lot's of spray painted grafiti and litter on the sidewalk, but don't be fooled! As soon as the sun goes down, the blocks around "THOR" are crawling with beautiful, well-dressed scenesters. All those metal-gated storefronts opened up into hip designed bars and restaurants. When we checked in, our room wasn't ready, so we waited in the deserted restaurant with the one lonely server who brought us cappucinos. 12 hours later, I couldn't believe we were in the same place! it had morphed into a party - loud reggae music and lot's of people out of a fashion magazine spread (none of which I believe were hotel guests). The first big surprise was the view from our 19th floor "large" room. It truely is a different city from up there. It looks like there are two different room-types at Rivington - those above the roof-line, and those below. Spring for the upper rooms, the view alone is worth it. It was also nice to escape the club scene in the lobby for our peaceful little room. (it was rather small for $400/night) but did have a nice tub, and the small balcony/terrace was a nice surprise. Did I mention the VIEW IS UNBELIEVABLE, we went to sleep at night watching the flash bulbs from cameras on the Empire State Building 50 blocks away. The staff, though overwhelmed at times (the spanish operator "accidentaly" hung up on me twice after placing me on hold when I called to be connected to room-service), were truely helpful and friendly. I was disappointed they didn't sell cigarrettes in the hotel (its illegal in NYC), but the bellhop volunteered to run out for pack. (!) Overall, the staff seems very young. The manager - who look's like he's twelve - overheard my husband say it was our anniversary, and sent up a free bottle of champagne with a sweet note apologizing for having to wait to get into our room. A for effort!

Reviews.Title: “Hype and unique in Lower East Side”
Reviews.Author: paris-paris75
Reviews.Content: We had a part of our honeymoon at the Hotel on Rivington. As it was a special occasion and our first trip to NYC, we ask for a special room. We got a "large" one on the 18th floor. Room was incredibly great: view, space (really large), a gorgeous bathroom with both shower and deep japanese tube (really deep and big : two of us side by side). Design of the room is very pure, ultra modern : superb now, I don't know how would it be in few years? We had a great time but some things are important to be said : The breakfast is not included and as others reviews tells, don't take it there : very expensive for very poor food in lovely design plates (all around you have a lot of fancys cafes and bars with delicious breakfasts and brunches). Second thing : part of the staff seems to be more interested by his haircut than by guests and it's a pity in a such beautifull place. I want to be clear: only a part of the staff act this way, we had great experiences with the front desk (reservation for us in the VIP list of an electro party) and also with the technician who came install a dvd player (free by the way, a kind attention). To resume : if you're super trendy and ask trendy things, you will get them. If you're a pragmatic customer asking a plug adapter, you may have to call back few times before to get it ;-)! We're about 30 and loving nightlife and original places so we loved it but maybe, this place is not for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Rivington is a Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: jkoer
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a stay at the Rivington with mixed emotions. I stayed in what they call a "large" room on the 17th floor. This hotel overcharges at big boy rates but does not deliver big boy service. The front desk is understaffed and when the phones are ringing they can barely get you checked in. Expect to have some issues, the toilet ran, the keys to my room did not work stuff like that....Also, the Hotel restaurant is a disaster do not even try it, even for breakfast. The room itself was great, the Japanese tub and heated floors are nice although you can tell the place was hastily built and put together....The carpets are poorly cut, the tile job is second rate ect )not what you would expect at $450 a night...This hotel reminded me of some Hotels in South Beach, high on the cool factor, low on the service level (they do try but it is just not consistent, they need to hire a manager from a first rate hotel)...it is to bad because it could really be a great hotel if they could put it all together.. I will say this, I love the location as an alternative getaway in NYC vibe and overall enjoyed my stay... this in not a business hotel. If you have patience and want to experience NYC and the East Village it is great spot...Just be prepared for some bumps in the road....

Reviews.Title: “I loved it--but not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: AnnieKingston_NY
Reviews.Content: I stay in Manhattan for two to three nights every month, so I have a lot of experience with the hotel scene. Although the Hotel on Rvington seemed a little risky, I was so intrigued that I booked three nights there and got home yesterday with quite a tale to tell. First of all I adored it because it was interesting, comfortable, clean, "different" from oter hotels, the people (staff) were friendly and knowledgeable, the bed was wonderfully comfortable, the location was wonderful (for downtown fun and exploration), the subway and plenty of good eating and shopping were close by, and it was a "happening", sophisticated, interesting scene but not a noisy, obnoxious, or intrusive one. Got all that? On the other hand: the cheap furnishings do border on "stark". A hotel catering to that many partiers is going to wind up with a few funny smells in the halls. If you like bouncing on a bed (because, uh, you travel with your own circus troup?) you won't like the temper-pedic. It gives bu it doesn't bounce. And, somewhat ironically, the mini-bar is stocked with not just the usual "safe sex" packet, but a prettily-packaged kit containing a---. There are also two books and a deck of cards which will guarantee uncomfortable queries from impressionable children, or out-of-town parents if you are foolish enough to put them up here. Me, I wanted to stay here forwever (and I don't feel like that after three nights in any hotel, even the Ritz-Carlton downtown). But I'd feel uncomfortable hving my daughter here. I have to mention as well that the service was incredibly good. From valet parking to carefully showing me how everything in my room worked, to polite and friendly maid service that didn't mind working around me while I worked on my laptop, to front desk people who provided me with an ethernet connection, a cell phone charger, a drink in the resident's lounge although it had to be fetched from elsewhere, and a thorough and respectful discussion of all my room charges and the possibility of getting a "universal design" room for my next stay, I have never had such good, intelligent, knowledgeable service. I can't wait to go back--but this might not be the right spot for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Unremarkably unremarkable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My first and last stay at the Hotel on Rivington was completely unremarkable. Check-in was handled smoothly and the bellman was friendly and offered a few suggestions of things to do around the neighborhood. My â€œRegularâ€� room was located on the fourth floor of the hotel, facing Rivington Street, but there was only minimal street noise, even late at night when Thor got hopping. The room was generously sized for New York standards, including a king-size bed and a sitting area for two with a small coffee table, as well as some cool electric curtains to discourage peeping neighbors. The bed, a Tempur-pedic mattress covered in Frette linens, was comfortable and luxurious. However, with nothing on the wall except for a small flat-screen television and the only color coming from a diminutive vase with two flowers, the dÃ©cor straddled the line between minimalist chic and unacceptably stark. Plus, at $315 a night, an alarm clock might have been nice. The bathroom was quite large, with a wonderful steam shower and high-end toiletries. However, I think the whole room felt shoddily constructed; the tiles in the bathroom didnâ€™t line up with the walls and the baseboards were uneven, revealing unfinished parts of the construction that should have remained hidden. The hotel offers guests a free daily New York Times except, apparently, on Sundays, which was rather disappointing and pretty cheap. The Manager appears to be cheap, too--my request for a late check-out would have required an additional half-day charge (the literature in the room indicated it would be complimentary occupancy-permitting and if I departed before 5:00). The Hotel on Rivington is undoubtedly the best place to stay on the Lower East Side. But for a more consistent experience and better value, I would choose one of the more established properties in Soho or Tribeca if youâ€™re set on a below-14th Street experience.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: MarkoP
Reviews.Content: First, let me say I would most definitely choose the hotel on Rivington the next time I'm in New York, and second, let me say the hotel has some major kinks to work out, mostly in staff training. The staff we dealt with were uniformly nice and tried to help, but the hotel seems pervaded by a sort of cluelessness (many of the other reviews have noted this). Favorite example: while checking out, the woman at the counter kept me waiting a few minutes while she dealt with a customer complaining about food-poisoning from the room-service breakfast, and then chatted with her colleagues about what to tell him... really not something to do in front of another client! (We also ordered room service and had no problems.) All this is really vastly outweighed by the hotel's many charms. The vews of New York through the full-wall windows are just unbeatable, and the Rivington has the benefit of being the only tall building in the area (something you can't get in midtown, no matter what the price). The curtains and shades retract at the press of a bedside button. The beds are top-notch though a little strange (tempur-pedic memory foam). The bathroom products are excellent. Free WiFi that works seamlessly. Great minibar. Very reasonable rates. The neighborhood is my new New York favorite, close to all of downtown (SoHo, East Village, Tribeca) with a real culinary renaissance going on right now, lots of exciting new restaurants and clubs within a few blocks. It's still a little rough, so wouldn't be ideal for people scared of urban grit, but we felt very safe walking around even late at night. Once the staff hit their groove, it will be a five-star hotel for sure (and the rates are likely to climb).

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel, bad hood, they can see you too”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Once your inside the hotel, it is okay. The neighborhood is not a place to take a stroll after dark. It is not a place I really liked even during the day. I can bench 215 lbs and it is still not a neighborhood to go out in after dark. The outer walls are made of glass. It was like a glass office building. It was different. Remember, if you see the world, the world sees you. This is especially true at night and in the bathroom. It is one thing to have views of NYC, it is another thing TO BE A view in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “They took reviews under consideration”
Reviews.Author: ABD119
Reviews.Content: The service is very attentive and pleasant (except they charged me almost $200 for checking out at 4PM). Rooms are remarkably spacious and the view from the 14 floor is just breathtaking. The bed mattress and linens were phenomenally comfortable. First room I checked into had a broken shower. They immediately replaced it with a room that had a broken window handle. I'll probably come back. Avoid the restaurant unless you're interested in miniature modern art painted on plates.

Reviews.Title: “Think outside the Ratrace”
Reviews.Author: Ah-Jeung
Reviews.Content: This was a pre-Honeymoon, avoid reality trip immediately after the wedding, so I chose somewhere away from all the mess in Midtown Manhattan - if you want somewhere a little bit different - try the Rivington! We stayed in Unique Suite 183, floor to ceiling windows facing due north - spectacular view! Best part is their thermapedic beds (the NASA ones) - but this suite it was the stand alone bathtub in the bathroom the same size as the bedroom, with the water filling from the ceiling into the tub....very nice. The neighbourhood is edgy and not the norm - worth 2 nights of wining/dining in a very relaxing/un-pretentious hotel. High floor is a must for the view, their restaurant is nice (THOR) but the neighbourhood is great with all types of bars/restaurants/cafes - there is no gym at this place - the toiletries are great also Paul Lebreque...very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Send your staff to customer service school”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was intrigued by the hotel when I was looking for somewhere new and interesting to stay in NY in October. Although the hotel is not in the most convenient neighborhood, I still gave it a try to check out the rooms and decor. The staff at check-in and at the front door were nice, although clearly not very experienced. My room had some very interesting features (heated floors), electric shades. For being only open a few months, however, the decor was already showing quite a bit of wear - dirty and worn carpets, scratched floor in the elevator, worn drapes, etc. The big problem comes, however, when you try to get any help from the front desk. I tried to get some help booking dinner at Balthazar. The hotel advertises a "special relationship" with the owners of Balthazar and Schiller's. When I had them try to book dinner, they could not. I asked what about the "special relationship", I was told by the concierge that they don't really have one. I was a little surprised (given that they advertise it on their website) and asked for the manager. The manager basically got in an argument with me about how could I expect to get in at a hot restaurant on that night. I continued to explain to him that my problem was the false advertising not the failure to get a reservation. He proceeded to become belligerent and rude and yell at me and call me classless. After basically reducing me to tears, I asked him what hotel management school he possibly leared that this was the proper way to treat a customer and he said life. Life was where he had learned to do that - nice life to know to be yell and scream at a customer. Don't waste your time or your money. This place needs to be bought by a company that knows how to run hotels and to clean and remodel it.
